trans-unit.source: If your setting is better described with a comparison “like the shows Firefly or Westworld but with X,” you might consider an alternate slate of roles, possibly types suitable for a science fiction game where PCs can be pilots, scientists, technicians, and so on. Alternatively, a mix of both the roles noted here and those indicated for a science fiction game might work best for your game.
trans-unit.target: If your setting is better described with a comparison “like the shows Firefly or Westworld but with X,” you might consider an alternate slate of roles, possibly types suitable for a science fiction game where PCs can be pilots, scientists, technicians, and so on. Alternatively, a mix of both the roles noted here and those indicated for a science fiction game might work best for your game.

trans-unit.target: Weird West Descriptors

trans-unit.source: In a weird west setting, as elsewhere, descriptors are designed to provide additional information about how and why characters take actions. Descriptors provide motivation and incentive, and place characters in the starting adventure.
trans-unit.target: In a weird west setting, as elsewhere, descriptors are designed to provide additional information about how and why characters take actions. Descriptors provide motivation and incentive, and place characters in the starting adventure.

trans-unit.source: Species Advancement
trans-unit.target: Species Advancement

trans-unit.source: The Forgeborn and Risen descriptors include suggestions for how to advance or improve a PC’s inherent nature as that sort of creature (becoming even more forgeborn if you are a made being, for example). You can allow a character with such a descriptor to choose any of the indicated abilities (plus any others you feel are appropriate for the descriptor) in place of a type ability, either upon advancing to a new tier, or as a character advancement option in exchange for 4 XP.
trans-unit.target: The Forgeborn and Risen descriptors include suggestions for how to advance or improve a PC’s inherent nature as that sort of creature (becoming even more forgeborn if you are a made being, for example). You can allow a character with such a descriptor to choose any of the indicated abilities (plus any others you feel are appropriate for the descriptor) in place of a type ability, either upon advancing to a new tier, or as a character advancement option in exchange for 4 XP.

trans-unit.source: Forgeborn
trans-unit.target: Forgeborn

trans-unit.source: Forgeborn—also called golems—are animate figures of metal, reanimated flesh, or other normally inert materials. Forgeborn are constructed for a specific purpose; their primary task is often to guard the alchemist that made them. As such, they usually ain’t playing with a full deck when it comes to brains. You’re different—somehow, you got a fully developed sense of self, and either never had or lost your compulsion to serve your maker. Maybe your alchemist creator emancipated you once they understood your animated form contained a fully realized mind, or maybe you ran away when the chance offered itself. Either way, you’re on your own now, choosing your own goals and jobs.
trans-unit.target: Forgeborn—also called golems—are animate figures of metal, reanimated flesh, or other normally inert materials. Forgeborn are constructed for a specific purpose; their primary task is often to guard the alchemist that made them. As such, they usually ain’t playing with a full deck when it comes to brains. You’re different—somehow, you got a fully developed sense of self, and either never had or lost your compulsion to serve your maker. Maybe your alchemist creator emancipated you once they understood your animated form contained a fully realized mind, or maybe you ran away when the chance offered itself. Either way, you’re on your own now, choosing your own goals and jobs.

trans-unit.source: Most folks who see you don’t immediately realize you’re not on the short leash of someone nearby. Maybe that’s fine by you, since that keeps them from interfering in your business or asking too many pesky questions. Other times, you can’t help it, and proudly proclaim your independent status to anyone and everyone.
trans-unit.target: Most folks who see you don’t immediately realize you’re not on the short leash of someone nearby. Maybe that’s fine by you, since that keeps them from interfering in your business or asking too many pesky questions. Other times, you can’t help it, and proudly proclaim your independent status to anyone and everyone.

trans-unit.source: Work with your GM to determine what materials you’re made from and what you look like. But even if you’re covered in metal, the nature of your particular construction is such that a bullet or blow is nearly as damaging to your workings as to normal flesh. On the other hand, healing magic is magic, and if any is to be had, it works as well on you as anyone else.
trans-unit.target: Work with your GM to determine what materials you’re made from and what you look like. But even if you’re covered in metal, the nature of your particular construction is such that a bullet or blow is nearly as damaging to your workings as to normal flesh. On the other hand, healing magic is magic, and if any is to be had, it works as well on you as anyone else.

trans-unit.source: You gain the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: You gain the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: Durable: +4 to your Might Pool.
trans-unit.target: Durable: +4 to your Might Pool.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You know your own kind. You are trained in tasks related to interacting with, identifying, tracking, or repairing other forgeborn.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You know your own kind. You are trained in tasks related to interacting with, identifying, tracking, or repairing other forgeborn.

trans-unit.source: Resistant: You gain two assets to defense rolls to resist effects that would daze or stun you, and you’re immune to poison and disease.
trans-unit.target: Resistant: You gain two assets to defense rolls to resist effects that would daze or stun you, and you’re immune to poison and disease.

trans-unit.source: Fixable: Even if you are killed, as long as all of your parts are collected, a willing alchemist who spends several days repairing you can bring you back with a successful difficulty 5 Intellect‑based roll. However, the GM may decide you have some lasting damage, such as 2 fewer Pool points.
trans-unit.target: Fixable: Even if you are killed, as long as all of your parts are collected, a willing alchemist who spends several days repairing you can bring you back with a successful difficulty 5 Intellect‑based roll. However, the GM may decide you have some lasting damage, such as 2 fewer Pool points.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You’re just not as quick as a living creature. Your Speed defense tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You’re just not as quick as a living creature. Your Speed defense tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Though it’s not something they necessarily meant to do, the other PCs’ actions gave you your independence, and they asked you along.

trans-unit.source: You were looking for a job, same as any other independent being, and applied to a job posting.

trans-unit.source: You’re on the run from your creator, and the PCs’ presence allows you to blend in.

trans-unit.source: Grizzled
trans-unit.target: Grizzled

trans-unit.source: Life’s thrown trials aplenty your way. Yet you’re still here. Your skin is sun‑kissed and weathered and your hair is streaked with gray, sure, but that just speaks to your resilience. You’re seasoned—you’ve got the wisdom of long experience behind you. Your crinkled eyes only enhance your steely gaze, because you exude the quiet confidence of the battle‑tested. ’Course, you’ve also learned the value of companionship, and your face easily breaks into a warm smile when your friends are nearby.
trans-unit.target: Life’s thrown trials aplenty your way. Yet you’re still here. Your skin is sun‑kissed and weathered and your hair is streaked with gray, sure, but that just speaks to your resilience. You’re seasoned—you’ve got the wisdom of long experience behind you. Your crinkled eyes only enhance your steely gaze, because you exude the quiet confidence of the battle‑tested. ’Course, you’ve also learned the value of companionship, and your face easily breaks into a warm smile when your friends are nearby.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’ve seen your share of things. You are trained in local lore and history.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’ve learned to see through folks’ mendacity. You are trained in detecting falsehoods.

trans-unit.source: Try, Try Again: You don’t give up easy. You don’t have to spend a level of Effort the first time you retry a task, if you don’t want to.
trans-unit.target: Try, Try Again: You don’t give up easy. You don’t have to spend a level of Effort the first time you retry a task, if you don’t want to.

trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: A job needed doing. Clearly you were the person with the most experience, so you stepped up.
trans-unit.target: A job needed doing. Clearly you were the person with the most experience, so you stepped up.

trans-unit.source: You got caught out and would’ve died, but the other PCs saved you.
trans-unit.target: You got caught out and would’ve died, but the other PCs saved you.

trans-unit.source: You’re looking for one last grand adventure or two before age catches up with you.
trans-unit.target: You’re looking for one last grand adventure or two before age catches up with you.

trans-unit.source: You don’t suffer fools, and the way things were going, the PCs would’ve failed without you.
trans-unit.target: You don’t suffer fools, and the way things were going, the PCs would’ve failed without you.

trans-unit.source: Laconic
trans-unit.target: Laconic

trans-unit.source: You’re a soul of few words—or no words at all, when a shrug or nod will do. Now there’s some who’ll flap their jaws about everything that comes into their head. Sometimes they get under your skin. But you don’t upbraid them; nope—you just frown. You’re direct and to the point, avoiding elaboration. You’re comfortable with pauses, and when you do speak, your words carry extra weight. All that said—and that’s a hell of a lot more than you would say—you don’t mind other folks. Just their prattle.
trans-unit.target: You’re a soul of few words—or no words at all, when a shrug or nod will do. Now there’s some who’ll flap their jaws about everything that comes into their head. Sometimes they get under your skin. But you don’t upbraid them; nope—you just frown. You’re direct and to the point, avoiding elaboration. You’re comfortable with pauses, and when you do speak, your words carry extra weight. All that said—and that’s a hell of a lot more than you would say—you don’t mind other folks. Just their prattle.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: When you didn’t answer, everyone assumed you’d agreed to the job, and so here you are.
trans-unit.target: When you didn’t answer, everyone assumed you’d agreed to the job, and so here you are.

trans-unit.source: You lost your poker stake and now you need the money.
trans-unit.target: You lost your poker stake and now you need the money.

trans-unit.source: Of all the folks you’ve known, the PCs are the least annoying and most accepting of your stillness.
trans-unit.target: Of all the folks you’ve known, the PCs are the least annoying and most accepting of your stillness.

trans-unit.source: You were wrongfully fingered for a crime, and the PCs believed your side of the story.
trans-unit.target: You were wrongfully fingered for a crime, and the PCs believed your side of the story.

trans-unit.source: Risen
trans-unit.target: Risen

trans-unit.source: You died. Now you’re back. Except not completely—you’re what them alchemists call a necrovore, or as regular folks whisper in your wake, Damned. And perhaps you do bear a sigil branded onto your flesh by a demon from Perdition. Maybe your situation is the result of some other curse that pulled you screaming back into animation. Or you might be called back from death due to your own need to finish a task you failed to accomplish before life fled.
trans-unit.target: You died. Now you’re back. Except not completely—you’re what them alchemists call a necrovore, or as regular folks whisper in your wake, Damned. And perhaps you do bear a sigil branded onto your flesh by a demon from Perdition. Maybe your situation is the result of some other curse that pulled you screaming back into animation. Or you might be called back from death due to your own need to finish a task you failed to accomplish before life fled.

trans-unit.source: Whatever the cause, you no longer breathe, your eyes dimly shine and blink only when you remember to, and your skin takes on an unnatural pallor.
trans-unit.target: Whatever the cause, you no longer breathe, your eyes dimly shine and blink only when you remember to, and your skin takes on an unnatural pallor.

trans-unit.source: Sigil‑Branded: If your existence is a result of some strange demonic machination, you might bear a sigil that glimmers red as a coal. The sigil demonstrates that a power in Hell has laid claim to your soul. Maybe you know all about that demonic power and what tasks you must perform on its account, or not: where the sigil originated and what it portends might be as big a mystery to you as why you’re back among the living in the first place.
trans-unit.target: Sigil‑Branded: If your existence is a result of some strange demonic machination, you might bear a sigil that glimmers red as a coal. The sigil demonstrates that a power in Hell has laid claim to your soul. Maybe you know all about that demonic power and what tasks you must perform on its account, or not: where the sigil originated and what it portends might be as big a mystery to you as why you’re back among the living in the first place.

trans-unit.source: Hell Hide: +1 to your Armor.
trans-unit.target: Hell Hide: +1 to your Armor.

trans-unit.source: Deathless Resilience: When you’re debilitated, you can still act as if you were only impaired, even if your Speed is at 0. You’re still killed if you descend three steps on the damage track.
trans-unit.target: Deathless Resilience: When you’re debilitated, you can still act as if you were only impaired, even if your Speed is at 0. You’re still killed if you descend three steps on the damage track.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes You Come Back: If you descend three steps on the damage track, you can spend 2 XP to return to animation at some point the GM chooses within the next few days.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes You Come Back: If you descend three steps on the damage track, you can spend 2 XP to return to animation at some point the GM chooses within the next few days.

trans-unit.source: Stiff as Death: You ain’t as supple as you once was. Anytime you apply a level of Effort using Speed, it costs 1 additional point of Speed.
trans-unit.target: Stiff as Death: You ain’t as supple as you once was. Anytime you apply a level of Effort using Speed, it costs 1 additional point of Speed.

trans-unit.source: Inability: Something ain’t right about you. Your positive interaction tasks and tasks related to interacting with animals are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: Something ain’t right about you. Your positive interaction tasks and tasks related to interacting with animals are hindered.

trans-unit.source: When everyone else ran away from you, the PCs stayed to learn more about your situation.
trans-unit.target: When everyone else ran away from you, the PCs stayed to learn more about your situation.

trans-unit.source: You saw the PCs struggling with a necrovore and decided to show them not all undead were bad.
trans-unit.target: You saw the PCs struggling with a necrovore and decided to show them not all undead were bad.

trans-unit.source: The choice was between a half‑life on the edges of society and joining the PCs’ mission.
trans-unit.target: The choice was between a half‑life on the edges of society and joining the PCs’ mission.

trans-unit.source: The PCs knew you before you died and wanted you back again even though your memories from back then are blurry.

trans-unit.source: Slick
trans-unit.target: Slick

trans-unit.source: You’ve got a silver tongue. Some of that’s down to natural talent, but your polished persona is mostly a product of constant practice. You’ve spent long hours mastering your ability to manipulate games of chance, run elaborate confidence games to get the better of your enemies, and hold yourself confidently. Plus, you’ve learned how to dress well—a well-turned-out individual is always taken more seriously, or such has been your experience, so you usually dress to impress.
trans-unit.target: You’ve got a silver tongue. Some of that’s down to natural talent, but your polished persona is mostly a product of constant practice. You’ve spent long hours mastering your ability to manipulate games of chance, run elaborate confidence games to get the better of your enemies, and hold yourself confidently. Plus, you’ve learned how to dress well—a well-turned-out individual is always taken more seriously, or such has been your experience, so you usually dress to impress.

trans-unit.source: Glib: +2 to your Intellect Pool.
trans-unit.target: Glib: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re trained in deception; you can apply this training to games of chance where an element of bluffing is involved, such as poker.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re trained in deception; you can apply this training to games of chance where an element of bluffing is involved, such as poker.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re trained in all tasks involving positive or pleasant social interaction.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re trained in all tasks involving positive or pleasant social interaction.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re trained in all tasks involving identifying or assessing danger, lies, quality, importance, function, or power.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re trained in all tasks involving identifying or assessing danger, lies, quality, importance, function, or power.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You do not willingly enter dangerous situations. Any initiative actions (to determine who goes first in combat) are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You do not willingly enter dangerous situations. Any initiative actions (to determine who goes first in combat) are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a set of expensive clothing ideal for any occasion where you wish to dress to impress.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a set of expensive clothing ideal for any occasion where you wish to dress to impress.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes your exploits create sore losers, and you joined the PCs hoping their presence would protect you.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes your exploits create sore losers, and you joined the PCs hoping their presence would protect you.

trans-unit.source: You tried to fleece the PCs in a confidence game, but somehow you got caught up in their mission.
trans-unit.target: You tried to fleece the PCs in a confidence game, but somehow you got caught up in their mission.

trans-unit.source: You realized the PCs’ job might be especially lucrative and you invited yourself along.
trans-unit.target: You realized the PCs’ job might be especially lucrative and you invited yourself along.

trans-unit.source: You helped the PCs get out of trouble with the law by winning a bet with their jailer.
trans-unit.target: You helped the PCs get out of trouble with the law by winning a bet with their jailer.

trans-unit.source: Trailblazing
trans-unit.target: Trailblazing

trans-unit.source: You ain’t afraid to explore badlands, high plains, or weirder locales. That’s down to your pioneering spirit. Others like to stick close to what’s known, but you like to ride out to see places others can’t even imagine. Fear of the unknown is something you just don’t understand; it’s the known that makes you afraid. Spending too much time in one place makes you itchy and irritable. You live for the next time you’re blazing a fresh trail, scouting a new territory, and coming around another bend just to see what’s up ahead.
trans-unit.target: You ain’t afraid to explore badlands, high plains, or weirder locales. That’s down to your pioneering spirit. Others like to stick close to what’s known, but you like to ride out to see places others can’t even imagine. Fear of the unknown is something you just don’t understand; it’s the known that makes you afraid. Spending too much time in one place makes you itchy and irritable. You live for the next time you’re blazing a fresh trail, scouting a new territory, and coming around another bend just to see what’s up ahead.

trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re trained in wilderness navigation tasks, including finding your way through unknown locations.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You’re easily bored. Tasks requiring sustained attention of one or more minutes are hindered.

trans-unit.source: You were hired by the PCs to guide them to a strange location.
trans-unit.target: You were hired by the PCs to guide them to a strange location.

trans-unit.source: You have reason to believe that journeying with the other PCs will lead you to many more places unknown to you.
trans-unit.target: You have reason to believe that journeying with the other PCs will lead you to many more places unknown to you.

trans-unit.source: The one time you got in trouble out on your own, the PCs happened by and saved you.
trans-unit.target: The one time you got in trouble out on your own, the PCs happened by and saved you.

trans-unit.source: You saw the PCs from afar, figured something interesting was happening, and wanted to be part of it.
trans-unit.target: You saw the PCs from afar, figured something interesting was happening, and wanted to be part of it.

trans-unit.source: Trigger-Happy
trans-unit.target: Trigger-Happy

trans-unit.source: You’re not just fast, you’re lightning fast. Quick‑thinking and nimble, you’re swift to act in critical situations—chiefly, when you’re in a showdown with another gunslinger. Some say you’re a little too fast on the draw. But any time folks call you “trigger‑happy” as if it’s a put‑down, you just smile, because they’re burnishing your reputation. Your rapid reaction time comes in handy in all sorts of situations. ’Course, nothing is ever as important as putting a bullet in an opponent before they do the same to you.
trans-unit.target: You’re not just fast, you’re lightning fast. Quick‑thinking and nimble, you’re swift to act in critical situations—chiefly, when you’re in a showdown with another gunslinger. Some say you’re a little too fast on the draw. But any time folks call you “trigger‑happy” as if it’s a put‑down, you just smile, because they’re burnishing your reputation. Your rapid reaction time comes in handy in all sorts of situations. ’Course, nothing is ever as important as putting a bullet in an opponent before they do the same to you.

trans-unit.source: You gain the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: You gain the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: Breakneck: +2 to your Speed Pool.
trans-unit.target: Breakneck: +2 to your Speed Pool.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re trained in initiative tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re trained in initiative tasks.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re trained in Speed defense.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re trained in Speed defense.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You may be fleet, but your Might defense rolls are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You may be fleet, but your Might defense rolls are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a light or medium pistol (your choice).
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a light or medium pistol (your choice).

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: Another PC was about to be gunned down and you saved them with a quick draw of your own.
trans-unit.target: Another PC was about to be gunned down and you saved them with a quick draw of your own.

trans-unit.source: One of the other PCs recruited you for your unique talents.
trans-unit.target: One of the other PCs recruited you for your unique talents.

trans-unit.source: You hurt or killed someone important and had to get out of town, so you went with the PCs.
trans-unit.target: You hurt or killed someone important and had to get out of town, so you went with the PCs.

trans-unit.source: You showed up when and where you did on a dare—because, hey, you don’t back down from dares.
trans-unit.target: You showed up when and where you did on a dare—because, hey, you don’t back down from dares.

trans-unit.source: Unforgiving
trans-unit.target: Unforgiving

trans-unit.source: They done you wrong and you ain’t gonna rest until they’ve paid the price. Maybe the crime or betrayal that befell you was long ago, and you’ve been looking for the perpetrators’ trail ever since, with only limited luck. Or maybe it happened recently, when your life as you knew it ended. Did you lose a spouse? A child? A community?
trans-unit.target: They done you wrong and you ain’t gonna rest until they’ve paid the price. Maybe the crime or betrayal that befell you was long ago, and you’ve been looking for the perpetrators’ trail ever since, with only limited luck. Or maybe it happened recently, when your life as you knew it ended. Did you lose a spouse? A child? A community?

trans-unit.source: You go about other tasks in the meantime, but you’ve become someone with an extra, underlying goal: vengeance. If you can only figure out who deserves it and/or where they’re hiding, and/or maybe even who they are in the first place.
trans-unit.target: You go about other tasks in the meantime, but you’ve become someone with an extra, underlying goal: vengeance. If you can only figure out who deserves it and/or where they’re hiding, and/or maybe even who they are in the first place.

trans-unit.source: Vengeance Achieved? Work with your GM if you’d prefer this descriptor to be part of a revenge character arc. If so, vengeance may be something you can achieve and move on from, at which point it might be appropriate to change out your descriptor. Then again, you might have been Unforgiving so long that you’re set in your ways.
trans-unit.target: Vengeance Achieved? Work with your GM if you’d prefer this descriptor to be part of a revenge character arc. If so, vengeance may be something you can achieve and move on from, at which point it might be appropriate to change out your descriptor. Then again, you might have been Unforgiving so long that you’re set in your ways.

trans-unit.source: You gain the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: You gain the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: Tragedy‑Toughened: +2 to your Might Pool.
trans-unit.target: Tragedy‑Toughened: +2 to your Might Pool.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You scare other folks. You’re trained in intimidation tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You scare other folks. You’re trained in intimidation tasks.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’ve learned to tell when others shade the truth. You’re trained in detecting falsehoods.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’ve learned to tell when others shade the truth. You’re trained in detecting falsehoods.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re always on the lookout. You’re trained in tracking tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re always on the lookout. You’re trained in tracking tasks.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You don’t care enough to be polite. Your positive interaction tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You don’t care enough to be polite. Your positive interaction tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have an additional medium weapon.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have an additional medium weapon.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs are hunting the same outlaws as you, though they may have different reasons.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs are hunting the same outlaws as you, though they may have different reasons.

trans-unit.source: You found the PCs instead of the one(s) you’re tracking, and they needed help.
trans-unit.target: You found the PCs instead of the one(s) you’re tracking, and they needed help.

trans-unit.source: It’s something to do until you find another clue to help you along your path.
trans-unit.target: It’s something to do until you find another clue to help you along your path.

trans-unit.source: You have no idea how you joined the PCs. You’re going along with it until a chance to gain vengeance presents itself.
trans-unit.target: You have no idea how you joined the PCs. You’re going along with it until a chance to gain vengeance presents itself.

trans-unit.source: Wily
trans-unit.target: Wily

trans-unit.source: You’re a real sly dog if ever there was one. Quick‑thinking and hard to cheat, folks would be plum foolish to take what you say at face value, ’cept for your friends, of course. You know how to work most any situation to your advantage. You’re not so much a silver‑tongued devil as you are a few steps ahead of whatever’s about to happen.
trans-unit.target: You’re a real sly dog if ever there was one. Quick‑thinking and hard to cheat, folks would be plum foolish to take what you say at face value, ’cept for your friends, of course. You know how to work most any situation to your advantage. You’re not so much a silver‑tongued devil as you are a few steps ahead of whatever’s about to happen.

trans-unit.source: Others rely on their looks or their charm to get ahead in the world, and you can’t help but smirk when you consider their shortcomings. No sir, for you, it’s all about that gray stuff between your ears.
trans-unit.target: Others rely on their looks or their charm to get ahead in the world, and you can’t help but smirk when you consider their shortcomings. No sir, for you, it’s all about that gray stuff between your ears.

trans-unit.source: You gain the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: You gain the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: Crafty: +2 to your Intellect Pool.
trans-unit.target: Crafty: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

trans-unit.source: Skill: Always looking for an advantage, you’re trained in all interactions involving lies or trickery.
trans-unit.target: Skill: Always looking for an advantage, you’re trained in all interactions involving lies or trickery.

trans-unit.source: Skill: Seeing things as they really are is the first step in outfoxing others. You’re trained in perception tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: Seeing things as they really are is the first step in outfoxing others. You’re trained in perception tasks.

trans-unit.source: Hunch: When you apply a level of Effort using Intellect to a non‑combat task, you can also choose to apply a free level of Effort once. The ability is restored after you make a recovery roll.
trans-unit.target: Hunch: When you apply a level of Effort using Intellect to a non‑combat task, you can also choose to apply a free level of Effort once. The ability is restored after you make a recovery roll.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You pay a little too much attention, even to things you shouldn’t. Your Intellect defense rolls are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You pay a little too much attention, even to things you shouldn’t. Your Intellect defense rolls are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You acquired an item another PC lost and thinks is gone for good. Now you have an additional expensive item, assuming you don’t choose to give it back to the PC who lost it.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You acquired an item another PC lost and thinks is gone for good. Now you have an additional expensive item, assuming you don’t choose to give it back to the PC who lost it.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: Your wily plan convinced the other PCs to join your mission.
trans-unit.target: Your wily plan convinced the other PCs to join your mission.

trans-unit.source: Although you won, your scheme angered nearby outlaws, and the PCs are the only reason you lived.
trans-unit.target: Although you won, your scheme angered nearby outlaws, and the PCs are the only reason you lived.

trans-unit.source: You told the PCs you would double their profits on their next job if they allowed you in on it.
trans-unit.target: You told the PCs you would double their profits on their next job if they allowed you in on it.

trans-unit.source: You’re one hundred percent certain the other PCs will fail if you don’t come along.
trans-unit.target: You’re one hundred percent certain the other PCs will fail if you don’t come along.

trans-unit.source: Foci of the Weird West
trans-unit.target: Foci of the Weird West

trans-unit.source: Because these new foci were created specifically for the weird west genre, each has an expanded description with more story details than the foci in the _Cypher System Rulebook_ (which have short, broad descriptions suitable for being adapted to many different genres).
trans-unit.target: Because these new foci were created specifically for the weird west genre, each has an expanded description with more story details than the foci in the _Cypher System Rulebook_ (which have short, broad descriptions suitable for being adapted to many different genres).

trans-unit.source: The GM and player should adjust focus details to suit the specific campaign.
trans-unit.target: The GM and player should adjust focus details to suit the specific campaign.

trans-unit.source: Blazes Paths
trans-unit.target: Blazes Paths

trans-unit.source: You read the land. You know every twisted arroyo, spiny cactus, and change in the weather. And what you don’t know, you soon learn by sniffing the wind, tasting the dirt, and squinting across the wilderness landscapes. As you go, you mark the way for others to follow, notching trees or scribing stones with your personal symbol. As you become more and more accomplished, the network of trails you’ve blazed enhances not only your reputation as a pathfinder, but also your personal spiritual strength, allowing you to see what’s happening along them, to flash along the miles you blazed in mere moments, and even return to the first time you ever set foot on a trail.
trans-unit.target: You read the land. You know every twisted arroyo, spiny cactus, and change in the weather. And what you don’t know, you soon learn by sniffing the wind, tasting the dirt, and squinting across the wilderness landscapes. As you go, you mark the way for others to follow, notching trees or scribing stones with your personal symbol. As you become more and more accomplished, the network of trails you’ve blazed enhances not only your reputation as a pathfinder, but also your personal spiritual strength, allowing you to see what’s happening along them, to flash along the miles you blazed in mere moments, and even return to the first time you ever set foot on a trail.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. For some reason, whenever that character stands right next to you, your navigation tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. For some reason, whenever that character stands right next to you, your navigation tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You’re not sure how they found out, but that character knows about the one time you got lost and couldn’t find your way without help.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You’re not sure how they found out, but that character knows about the one time you got lost and couldn’t find your way without help.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Seeing you use your focus abilities triggers memories in them of having grown up someplace completely different than where they previously remembered. That memory is up to the other PC. If the memory is weird enough, they may want your help to find a way back there.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Seeing you use your focus abilities triggers memories in them of having grown up someplace completely different than where they previously remembered. That memory is up to the other PC. If the memory is weird enough, they may want your help to find a way back there.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You found them close to death while you were blazing a path out in the wilderness. They either have no memory of what led them to that spot, or ended up there for a harrowing reason—it’s up to that PC.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You found them close to death while you were blazing a path out in the wilderness. They either have no memory of what led them to that spot, or ended up there for a harrowing reason—it’s up to that PC.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a hatchet, blue dye, and a brush—all equipment you use to blaze your trails in the wilderness.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a hatchet, blue dye, and a brush—all equipment you use to blaze your trails in the wilderness.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Speed Pool. Major Effect Suggestion: An ally or indicated target can immediately move up to a short distance.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Speed Pool. Major Effect Suggestion: An ally or indicated target can immediately move up to a short distance.

trans-unit.source: Tier One
trans-unit.target: Tier One

trans-unit.source: Pathfinder Skills: You are trained in your choice of two of the following skills: blazing, navigation, perception, initiative, sensing danger, or tracking. You can choose this ability multiple times, but you must select different skills each time. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Pathfinder Skills: You are trained in your choice of two of the following skills: blazing, navigation, perception, initiative, sensing danger, or tracking. You can choose this ability multiple times, but you must select different skills each time. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier Two
trans-unit.target: Tier Two

trans-unit.source: Happy Trails: Whether you’re traveling along a path you’ve previously marked, or you’re navigating and blazing a new trail, roaming with you puts your companions at ease. During rests on any day you’ve traveled together, you and your party gain +1 to your recovery rolls. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Happy Trails: Whether you’re traveling along a path you’ve previously marked, or you’re navigating and blazing a new trail, roaming with you puts your companions at ease. During rests on any day you’ve traveled together, you and your party gain +1 to your recovery rolls. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier Three
trans-unit.target: Tier Three

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Trail Awareness or Trail Sensor as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Trail Awareness or Trail Sensor as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Trail Awareness: Your connection with trails you’ve blazed is always with you. When traveling on, camping near, or within visual range of any trail you’ve blazed, you gain an asset on one attack or defense roll thanks to your knowledge about what else is using the path. Once used, this ability renews after your next recovery roll. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Trail Awareness: Your connection with trails you’ve blazed is always with you. When traveling on, camping near, or within visual range of any trail you’ve blazed, you gain an asset on one attack or defense roll thanks to your knowledge about what else is using the path. Once used, this ability renews after your next recovery roll. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Trail Sensor (3 Intellect points): You imbue a newly created blaze symbol (or replace a blaze symbol you’ve previously created) with a spiritual connection to your mind’s eye. For the next 24 hours, you can concentrate to see, hear, and smell through the sensor, no matter how far you move from it. If you also have a similar ability from another source, this effect lasts twice as long. The sensor doesn’t grant you sensory capabilities beyond the norm. A few rounds to create the enhanced blaze symbol; action to check.
trans-unit.target: Trail Sensor (3 Intellect points): You imbue a newly created blaze symbol (or replace a blaze symbol you’ve previously created) with a spiritual connection to your mind’s eye. For the next 24 hours, you can concentrate to see, hear, and smell through the sensor, no matter how far you move from it. If you also have a similar ability from another source, this effect lasts twice as long. The sensor doesn’t grant you sensory capabilities beyond the norm. A few rounds to create the enhanced blaze symbol; action to check.

trans-unit.source: Tier Four
trans-unit.target: Tier Four

trans-unit.source: Blaze Door (5+ Intellect points): You can instantly transport yourself between two blaze symbols you’ve previously marked, as long as you use this ability while within immediate range of one of your symbols. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to bring other people within immediate range with you; each level of Effort used in this way affects up to three additional targets. Action.
trans-unit.target: Blaze Door (5+ Intellect points): You can instantly transport yourself between two blaze symbols you’ve previously marked, as long as you use this ability while within immediate range of one of your symbols. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to bring other people within immediate range with you; each level of Effort used in this way affects up to three additional targets. Action.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Blaze Recovery: You gain an additional one-action recovery roll if you take it within long range of a blaze symbol you’ve made. Once you’ve used this ability, you can’t use it again until after your next ten‑hour recovery roll. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Blaze Recovery: You gain an additional one-action recovery roll if you take it within long range of a blaze symbol you’ve made. Once you’ve used this ability, you can’t use it again until after your next ten‑hour recovery roll. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Step Across Time or Trail Cypher as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Step Across Time or Trail Cypher as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Step Across Time (7+ Intellect points): While you are within immediate range of any blaze symbol you’ve previously marked, you and up to three willing characters who are next to you travel to a point of your choosing earlier in time, when you were all traveling on the same trail the marker is part of or a connecting trail. When you appear in the past, you do so at the location you were along the trail then, replacing earlier versions of yourself in so doing. Upon arriving at your temporal destination, you and your fellow time travelers are stunned (and unable to act) for one minute. Using this ability is usually a one‑way trip. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to bring additional people with you; each level of Effort used in this way affects up to three additional targets. Action.
trans-unit.target: Step Across Time (7+ Intellect points): While you are within immediate range of any blaze symbol you’ve previously marked, you and up to three willing characters who are next to you travel to a point of your choosing earlier in time, when you were all traveling on the same trail the marker is part of or a connecting trail. When you appear in the past, you do so at the location you were along the trail then, replacing earlier versions of yourself in so doing. Upon arriving at your temporal destination, you and your fellow time travelers are stunned (and unable to act) for one minute. Using this ability is usually a one‑way trip. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to bring additional people with you; each level of Effort used in this way affects up to three additional targets. Action.

trans-unit.source: Trail Cypher: Choose one cypher that you carry. The cypher must have an effect that is not instantaneous. You destroy the cypher and embed its power into a trail you’ve blazed. Any time you are on that trail or a connecting trail, you gain the effect of that cypher continuously. You can choose a cypher when you gain this ability, or you can wait and make the choice later. However, once you embed a cypher into your system of trails, you cannot later switch to a different cypher—the ability works only once. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Trail Cypher: Choose one cypher that you carry. The cypher must have an effect that is not instantaneous. You destroy the cypher and embed its power into a trail you’ve blazed. Any time you are on that trail or a connecting trail, you gain the effect of that cypher continuously. You can choose a cypher when you gain this ability, or you can wait and make the choice later. However, once you embed a cypher into your system of trails, you cannot later switch to a different cypher—the ability works only once. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Collects Bounties
trans-unit.target: Collects Bounties

trans-unit.source: You know just where to look to find the latest wanted posters. Each one that goes up on the side of the jail or the wall of the post office is potentially another job and another reward. But money’s only half the deal—you also do it for the rush when you finally apprehend someone you’ve tracked across three territories. Some folks prefer to collect bounties without any undue fuss. But it wouldn’t be fun if those you stalk don’t put up a fight when you finally find them. And if it’s a fight, well, they’d best watch themselves. Most bounties you take on are advertised as dead or alive. You’d prefer them alive so they can face justice, but if it’s down to you or them, that’s no choice at all.
trans-unit.target: You know just where to look to find the latest wanted posters. Each one that goes up on the side of the jail or the wall of the post office is potentially another job and another reward. But money’s only half the deal—you also do it for the rush when you finally apprehend someone you’ve tracked across three territories. Some folks prefer to collect bounties without any undue fuss. But it wouldn’t be fun if those you stalk don’t put up a fight when you finally find them. And if it’s a fight, well, they’d best watch themselves. Most bounties you take on are advertised as dead or alive. You’d prefer them alive so they can face justice, but if it’s down to you or them, that’s no choice at all.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They accidentally provided information to a competing bounty hunter that lost you a quarry with a particularly lucrative reward.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They accidentally provided information to a competing bounty hunter that lost you a quarry with a particularly lucrative reward.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You happened to see a few documents while tracking down something unrelated, which leads you to believe they’re not exactly who they claim to be. You’ve since grown comfortable with them, but remain vigilant in case they turn out to be dangerous.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You happened to see a few documents while tracking down something unrelated, which leads you to believe they’re not exactly who they claim to be. You’ve since grown comfortable with them, but remain vigilant in case they turn out to be dangerous.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They rescued you from a train when outlaws blew it up, pulling you out of the wreckage at great risk to themself.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They rescued you from a train when outlaws blew it up, pulling you out of the wreckage at great risk to themself.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They know a secret story about your past that doesn’t reflect especially well on your character. But back then, you were young and stupid. Not like today. Right?
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They know a secret story about your past that doesn’t reflect especially well on your character. But back then, you were young and stupid. Not like today. Right?

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: Heavy leather duster (light armor).
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: Heavy leather duster (light armor).

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your attack against a foe is eased. Major Effect Suggestion: Make an immediate extra attack on your target.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your attack against a foe is eased. Major Effect Suggestion: Make an immediate extra attack on your target.

trans-unit.source: Tier One
trans-unit.target: Tier One

trans-unit.source: Seek and Hide: Tasks for tracking, looking for, or hiding from other creatures are eased. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Seek and Hide: Tasks for tracking, looking for, or hiding from other creatures are eased. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Know Where It Hurts: You inflict 1 additional point of damage against targets you’ve successfully tracked, hidden from, used Overwatch on, or studied for one full action. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Know Where It Hurts: You inflict 1 additional point of damage against targets you’ve successfully tracked, hidden from, used Overwatch on, or studied for one full action. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier Two
trans-unit.target: Tier Two

trans-unit.source: Ignore the Pain: You ignore the impaired condition and treat the debilitated condition as impaired. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Ignore the Pain: You ignore the impaired condition and treat the debilitated condition as impaired. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier Three
trans-unit.target: Tier Three

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Let Them Try or Surprise Attack as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Let Them Try or Surprise Attack as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Let Them Try: They usually don’t give up without a fight. You are trained in Speed defense tasks. If your foe is someone you’ve successfully interacted with (as noted under Know Where It Hurts), your Speed defense tasks against them also gain an asset. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Let Them Try: They usually don’t give up without a fight. You are trained in Speed defense tasks. If your foe is someone you’ve successfully interacted with (as noted under Know Where It Hurts), your Speed defense tasks against them also gain an asset. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Surprise Attack: If attacking from a hidden vantage, with surprise, or before your opponent has acted, you get an asset on the attack. On a successful hit, you inflict 2 additional points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Surprise Attack: If attacking from a hidden vantage, with surprise, or before your opponent has acted, you get an asset on the attack. On a successful hit, you inflict 2 additional points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 4
trans-unit.target: Tier 4

trans-unit.source: Total Awareness: You possess such a high level of awareness that it’s very difficult to surprise, hide from, or sneak up on you. When you apply a level of Effort to initiative and perception tasks, you gain two free levels of Effort. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Total Awareness: You possess such a high level of awareness that it’s very difficult to surprise, hide from, or sneak up on you. When you apply a level of Effort to initiative and perception tasks, you gain two free levels of Effort. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Free to Move: You ignore all movement penalties and adjustments due to terrain or other obstacles. You can fit through any space large enough to fit your head. You can apply three free levels of Effort to tasks involving breaking free of bonds, a creature’s grip, or any similar impediment. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Free to Move: You ignore all movement penalties and adjustments due to terrain or other obstacles. You can fit through any space large enough to fit your head. You can apply three free levels of Effort to tasks involving breaking free of bonds, a creature’s grip, or any similar impediment. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Greater Skill With Attacks or Lethal Damage as a tier 6 ability. Either way, you also gain Knock Out as a complementary tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Greater Skill With Attacks or Lethal Damage as a tier 6 ability. Either way, you also gain Knock Out as a complementary tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Greater Skill With Attacks: Choose one type of attack, even one in which you are already trained: light bashing, light bladed, light ranged, medium bashing, medium bladed, medium ranged, heavy bashing, heavy bladed, or heavy ranged. You are trained in attacks using that type of weapon. If you’re already trained in that type of attack, you instead are specialized in that type of attack. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Greater Skill With Attacks: Choose one type of attack, even one in which you are already trained: light bashing, light bladed, light ranged, medium bashing, medium bladed, medium ranged, heavy bashing, heavy bladed, or heavy ranged. You are trained in attacks using that type of weapon. If you’re already trained in that type of attack, you instead are specialized in that type of attack. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Knock Out (5+ Might points): You make a melee attack that inflicts no damage. Instead, if the attack hits, make a second Might‑based roll. If successful, a foe of level 3 or lower is knocked unconscious for one minute. For each level of Effort used, you can affect one higher level of foe, or you can extend the duration for an additional minute. Action.
trans-unit.target: Knock Out (5+ Might points): You make a melee attack that inflicts no damage. Instead, if the attack hits, make a second Might‑based roll. If successful, a foe of level 3 or lower is knocked unconscious for one minute. For each level of Effort used, you can affect one higher level of foe, or you can extend the duration for an additional minute. Action.

trans-unit.source: Lethal Damage: Choose one of your existing attacks that inflicts points of damage (depending on your type and focus, this might be a particular pistol, a special ability such as a blast of fire, or your unarmed attacks). When you hit with that attack, you inflict an additional 5 points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Lethal Damage: Choose one of your existing attacks that inflicts points of damage (depending on your type and focus, this might be a particular pistol, a special ability such as a blast of fire, or your unarmed attacks). When you hit with that attack, you inflict an additional 5 points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Gambles It All Away
trans-unit.target: Gambles It All Away

trans-unit.source: How long have you been haunting the card tables? Seems like a lifetime. You probably played your first hand of poker before you could even read words. People, though, were much easier to understand. You could always read other folks’ tells, whether that’s squinting, tapping, stammering, pulling at their earlobe, or any of a thousand other ways you know when to call their bluffs. Which is not to say you haven’t walked away from the table in the hole. But you’ve always been able to make it up later. So far, anyway. Lately, you’ve been having weird dreams of loss and void. Is Lady Luck fixin’ to turn her back on you? You hope not, because there ain’t nothing in the world keeping you from gambling it all away.
trans-unit.target: How long have you been haunting the card tables? Seems like a lifetime. You probably played your first hand of poker before you could even read words. People, though, were much easier to understand. You could always read other folks’ tells, whether that’s squinting, tapping, stammering, pulling at their earlobe, or any of a thousand other ways you know when to call their bluffs. Which is not to say you haven’t walked away from the table in the hole. But you’ve always been able to make it up later. So far, anyway. Lately, you’ve been having weird dreams of loss and void. Is Lady Luck fixin’ to turn her back on you? You hope not, because there ain’t nothing in the world keeping you from gambling it all away.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They beat you in a game of cards or dice when you totally thought you had them figured out. You befriended them rather than taking it personally (though it’s possible you’ve won that and more back since).
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They beat you in a game of cards or dice when you totally thought you had them figured out. You befriended them rather than taking it personally (though it’s possible you’ve won that and more back since).

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Whenever they sit next to you, Lady Luck seems to notice. Sometimes your tasks are eased, other times hindered, and you never know ahead of time how things will go for a given game.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Whenever they sit next to you, Lady Luck seems to notice. Sometimes your tasks are eased, other times hindered, and you never know ahead of time how things will go for a given game.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character doesn’t seem to care for how you make your living at the card tables.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character doesn’t seem to care for how you make your living at the card tables.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. When you were hurt by another gambler whose clock you cleaned, they stood up for you at great risk to themself.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. When you were hurt by another gambler whose clock you cleaned, they stood up for you at great risk to themself.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: A deck of especially fine playing cards.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: A deck of especially fine playing cards.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your next gambling, wagering, or similar task is eased. Major Effect Suggestion: You win a wager.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your next gambling, wagering, or similar task is eased. Major Effect Suggestion: You win a wager.

trans-unit.source: Tier One
trans-unit.target: Tier One

trans-unit.source: Gambler: You are trained in a table game in which you are not already trained. Choose from the following: poker, twenty‑one, farro, craps, blackjack, roulette, baccarat, or another game where gambling on the outcome is part of play. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Gambler: You are trained in a table game in which you are not already trained. Choose from the following: poker, twenty‑one, farro, craps, blackjack, roulette, baccarat, or another game where gambling on the outcome is part of play. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Interaction Skills: You are trained in two skills in which you are not already trained. Choose two of the following: deceiving, persuading, public speaking, seeing through deception, or intimidation. You can select this ability multiple times. Each time you select it, you must choose two different skills. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Interaction Skills: You are trained in two skills in which you are not already trained. Choose two of the following: deceiving, persuading, public speaking, seeing through deception, or intimidation. You can select this ability multiple times. Each time you select it, you must choose two different skills. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier Two
trans-unit.target: Tier Two

trans-unit.source: Courting Lady Luck: Maybe Lady Luck’s watching over you and keeping you from harm, or maybe you’re just damn lucky. When you would otherwise descend a step on the damage track, make an Intellect defense roll against the level of the foe or effect. If you succeed, you do not descend that step. If the step was because you fell to 0 points in a Pool, you are still at 0 points; you just don’t suffer the negative effects of being impaired or debilitated. If you would otherwise descend the final step on the damage track to death, a successful defense roll keeps you at 1 point in one Pool, and you remain debilitated. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Courting Lady Luck: Maybe Lady Luck’s watching over you and keeping you from harm, or maybe you’re just damn lucky. When you would otherwise descend a step on the damage track, make an Intellect defense roll against the level of the foe or effect. If you succeed, you do not descend that step. If the step was because you fell to 0 points in a Pool, you are still at 0 points; you just don’t suffer the negative effects of being impaired or debilitated. If you would otherwise descend the final step on the damage track to death, a successful defense roll keeps you at 1 point in one Pool, and you remain debilitated. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier Three
trans-unit.target: Tier Three

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Call Their Bluff or Card Genius as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Call Their Bluff or Card Genius as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Call Their Bluff (3 Intellect points): Are they bluffing or can they back up their claim? It doesn’t really matter when you fix your stare on a target within long range. If your Intellect attack succeeds, the target suffers 2 points of ambient damage each round for one minute or until the target can throw off the effect (PC targets suffer Intellect damage). If you use your action on a subsequent round to fully concentrate on the target, their attempts to throw off the effect are hindered and they take 4 points of ambient damage that round. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Call Their Bluff (3 Intellect points): Are they bluffing or can they back up their claim? It doesn’t really matter when you fix your stare on a target within long range. If your Intellect attack succeeds, the target suffers 2 points of ambient damage each round for one minute or until the target can throw off the effect (PC targets suffer Intellect damage). If you use your action on a subsequent round to fully concentrate on the target, their attempts to throw off the effect are hindered and they take 4 points of ambient damage that round. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Card Genius: The more you gamble, the sharper your mind becomes. You gain +5 to your Intellect Pool. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Card Genius: The more you gamble, the sharper your mind becomes. You gain +5 to your Intellect Pool. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 4
trans-unit.target: Tier 4

trans-unit.source: Winning Hand (4 Intellect Points): If you win a hand of cards or other wager, or if you succeed on an Intellect defense roll to resist a foe’s attack, you gain an action. You can use it immediately even if you have already taken a turn in the round. You can use this ability once per round. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Winning Hand (4 Intellect Points): If you win a hand of cards or other wager, or if you succeed on an Intellect defense roll to resist a foe’s attack, you gain an action. You can use it immediately even if you have already taken a turn in the round. You can use this ability once per round. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Consequences of Luck (5+ Intellect points): It used to be easier to be lucky all the time. Now, it takes a toll. When you roll a 1, you can reroll. If you reroll and roll a 1, 2, or 3, you must reroll again, this time expending a level of Effort plus the base Pool cost to activate this ability (5 Intellect points). If you roll a 1–5 on the second reroll, you must reroll again, expending a level of Effort and spending the base cost again (5 Intellect points), too. This progression of forced rerolls coupled with an increasing failure range continues until you roll higher than the failure range or you run out of Intellect points. (If the target number you roll is below the failure range, you might succeed on the task, but the forced‑rerolling continues.) Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Consequences of Luck (5+ Intellect points): It used to be easier to be lucky all the time. Now, it takes a toll. When you roll a 1, you can reroll. If you reroll and roll a 1, 2, or 3, you must reroll again, this time expending a level of Effort plus the base Pool cost to activate this ability (5 Intellect points). If you roll a 1–5 on the second reroll, you must reroll again, expending a level of Effort and spending the base cost again (5 Intellect points), too. This progression of forced rerolls coupled with an increasing failure range continues until you roll higher than the failure range or you run out of Intellect points. (If the target number you roll is below the failure range, you might succeed on the task, but the forced‑rerolling continues.) Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Fate Breaker or Gambling God as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Fate Breaker or Gambling God as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Fate Breaker: Something beyond your ken takes an interest in you. If you fail on a task (including an attack or a defense), you can change the die result to a natural 20. (That still might not be enough to succeed if the difficulty is higher than 6.) This ability doesn’t work if you roll a natural 1 for an attempted task, unless you reroll using Consequences of Luck and obtain a result that isn’t in the failure range. Once you use this ability, it is not available again until after you make a ten‑hour recovery roll. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Fate Breaker: Something beyond your ken takes an interest in you. If you fail on a task (including an attack or a defense), you can change the die result to a natural 20. (That still might not be enough to succeed if the difficulty is higher than 6.) This ability doesn’t work if you roll a natural 1 for an attempted task, unless you reroll using Consequences of Luck and obtain a result that isn’t in the failure range. Once you use this ability, it is not available again until after you make a ten‑hour recovery roll. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Gambling God: Any time you use Effort on an Intellect action, add one of the following enhancements to the action (your choice):
trans-unit.target: Gambling God: Any time you use Effort on an Intellect action, add one of the following enhancements to the action (your choice):

trans-unit.source: Free level of Effort -Automatic minor effect Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Free level of Effort -Automatic minor effect Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Hits The Saloon
trans-unit.target: Hits The Saloon

trans-unit.source: The saloon is an old friend, whether or not you visit the same one twice. Whatever the name on the sign out front, the pungent smells of whiskey, cigars, and sawdust lift your spirits like nothing else. ’Cept for actual spirits, of course. When that first shot hits your throat and sets a warm blaze in your belly, you can’t keep a smile from your lips. This here’s your home away from home, and inside are your friends, both old and those soon to be made. Though not everyone’s happy to see you—troublemakers soon learn that in a scrap, you only hit harder with each shot of whiskey you pour down your throat.
trans-unit.target: The saloon is an old friend, whether or not you visit the same one twice. Whatever the name on the sign out front, the pungent smells of whiskey, cigars, and sawdust lift your spirits like nothing else. ’Cept for actual spirits, of course. When that first shot hits your throat and sets a warm blaze in your belly, you can’t keep a smile from your lips. This here’s your home away from home, and inside are your friends, both old and those soon to be made. Though not everyone’s happy to see you—troublemakers soon learn that in a scrap, you only hit harder with each shot of whiskey you pour down your throat.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character has spent a lot of time with you saloon‑hopping. Once between any ten‑hour rest, you gain an additional asset when you collaborate on the same task, fight the same foe, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character has spent a lot of time with you saloon‑hopping. Once between any ten‑hour rest, you gain an additional asset when you collaborate on the same task, fight the same foe, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You saw them get their ass whooped in a saloon fight once, though they didn’t know you saw it. You can choose whether or not to share that information.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You saw them get their ass whooped in a saloon fight once, though they didn’t know you saw it. You can choose whether or not to share that information.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You and this character once had a terrible drunken argument that neither of you remember exactly, but neither can you let it go. Once between any ten‑hour rest (when the GM chooses), an action is hindered when you collaborate on the same task, fight the same foe, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You and this character once had a terrible drunken argument that neither of you remember exactly, but neither can you let it go. Once between any ten‑hour rest (when the GM chooses), an action is hindered when you collaborate on the same task, fight the same foe, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character has still never visited your favorite saloon, and you’ve promised to take them one day. Whether or not the character is interested is up to them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character has still never visited your favorite saloon, and you’ve promised to take them one day. Whether or not the character is interested is up to them.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You carry a sturdy, leak‑proof metallic whiskey flask.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You carry a sturdy, leak‑proof metallic whiskey flask.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You don’t have to use an action to activate your next Jovial Presence ability. Major Effect Suggestion: You remember something a stranger in a saloon once said, and you can ask the GM one question about what you’re looking at.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You don’t have to use an action to activate your next Jovial Presence ability. Major Effect Suggestion: You remember something a stranger in a saloon once said, and you can ask the GM one question about what you’re looking at.

trans-unit.source: Tier 1
trans-unit.target: Tier 1

trans-unit.source: Jovial Presence (2 Intellect points): You observe or study a creature, object, or location for at least one round. The next time you interact with it (possibly in the following round), a related task (such as persuading the creature, attacking it, or defending from its attack) is eased. If you’re in a saloon, the task is eased by two steps. Action.
trans-unit.target: Jovial Presence (2 Intellect points): You observe or study a creature, object, or location for at least one round. The next time you interact with it (possibly in the following round), a related task (such as persuading the creature, attacking it, or defending from its attack) is eased. If you’re in a saloon, the task is eased by two steps. Action.

trans-unit.source: Enthusiastic Listener: You pick up stuff listening to folks gab in the bar. You are trained in one area of knowledge of your choice. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Enthusiastic Listener: You pick up stuff listening to folks gab in the bar. You are trained in one area of knowledge of your choice. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 2
trans-unit.target: Tier 2

trans-unit.source: Blitzer: You inflict 2 additional points of damage with unarmed attacks, or 3 points when you are one or more steps down the intoxication track. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Blitzer: You inflict 2 additional points of damage with unarmed attacks, or 3 points when you are one or more steps down the intoxication track. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Liquid Courage: Your defense rolls against fear are eased. They are eased by two steps when you are one or more steps down the intoxication track. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Liquid Courage: Your defense rolls against fear are eased. They are eased by two steps when you are one or more steps down the intoxication track. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 3
trans-unit.target: Tier 3

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Iron Stomach or Skill With Attacks as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Iron Stomach or Skill With Attacks as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Iron Stomach: The more you imbibe, the greater your tolerance grows (at least, so far. . . ). You gain +5 to your Might Pool. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Iron Stomach: The more you imbibe, the greater your tolerance grows (at least, so far. . . ). You gain +5 to your Might Pool. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Skill With Attacks: Choose one type of attack in which you are not already trained, such as unarmed attacks (though you could also select weapon options like light bashing, light bladed, and so on). You are trained in that kind of attack. You can select this ability multiple times. Each time you select it, you must choose a different type of attack. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Skill With Attacks: Choose one type of attack in which you are not already trained, such as unarmed attacks (though you could also select weapon options like light bashing, light bladed, and so on). You are trained in that kind of attack. You can select this ability multiple times. Each time you select it, you must choose a different type of attack. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 4
trans-unit.target: Tier 4

trans-unit.source: Bottle KO (5+ Might points): You make a melee attack that inflicts no damage. Instead, if the attack hits, make a second Might‑based roll. If successful, a foe of level 3 or lower is knocked unconscious for one minute. For each level of Effort used, you can affect one higher level of foe, or you can extend the duration for an additional minute. If you use a whiskey bottle to make the attack, your attack is eased. If you have a similar sort of knockout ability from another source (such as your type), the attack is eased by an additional step. Action.
trans-unit.target: Bottle KO (5+ Might points): You make a melee attack that inflicts no damage. Instead, if the attack hits, make a second Might‑based roll. If successful, a foe of level 3 or lower is knocked unconscious for one minute. For each level of Effort used, you can affect one higher level of foe, or you can extend the duration for an additional minute. If you use a whiskey bottle to make the attack, your attack is eased. If you have a similar sort of knockout ability from another source (such as your type), the attack is eased by an additional step. Action.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Learned a Few Things Over Drinks: You are trained in two areas of knowledge of your choice, or specialized in one area of knowledge of your choice. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Learned a Few Things Over Drinks: You are trained in two areas of knowledge of your choice, or specialized in one area of knowledge of your choice. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Inspiration in a Glass or Lethal Damage as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Inspiration in a Glass or Lethal Damage as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Inspiration in a Glass (6+ Intellect points): You meditate, perhaps over a drink, perhaps on a fond memory you made in a saloon or similar enjoyable location. You gain a level 6 subtle cypher of the general variety that you want (though the GM chooses the specifics) and can use it next round. If you are already at your cypher limit when you use this ability, choose which cypher you replace with the new one. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to increase the cypher’s level; each level of Effort used in this way increases the level by 1. Action.
trans-unit.target: Inspiration in a Glass (6+ Intellect points): You meditate, perhaps over a drink, perhaps on a fond memory you made in a saloon or similar enjoyable location. You gain a level 6 subtle cypher of the general variety that you want (though the GM chooses the specifics) and can use it next round. If you are already at your cypher limit when you use this ability, choose which cypher you replace with the new one. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to increase the cypher’s level; each level of Effort used in this way increases the level by 1. Action.
