trans-unit.source: Lethal Damage: Choose one of your existing attacks that deals damage (depending on your type and focus, this might be a specific weapon, your unarmed attacks, or maybe a bottle of whiskey). When you hit with that attack, you inflict an additional 5 points of damage. Enabler
trans-unit.target: Lethal Damage: Choose one of your existing attacks that deals damage (depending on your type and focus, this might be a specific weapon, your unarmed attacks, or maybe a bottle of whiskey). When you hit with that attack, you inflict an additional 5 points of damage. Enabler

trans-unit.source: Rides Like the Wind
trans-unit.target: Rides Like the Wind

trans-unit.source: Few things feel more empowering than when you jump into the saddle and ride! Maybe you have a special mount called Thunder, Caballo, Dusty, or a name you don’t share with others. Or perhaps any mount will serve, because you’re just that skilled in the saddle. Whatever the case, when you and your mount are moving, other folks say they have a hard time figuring where one of you stops and the other begins—you act as a single creature that almost nothing can stop.
trans-unit.target: Few things feel more empowering than when you jump into the saddle and ride! Maybe you have a special mount called Thunder, Caballo, Dusty, or a name you don’t share with others. Or perhaps any mount will serve, because you’re just that skilled in the saddle. Whatever the case, when you and your mount are moving, other folks say they have a hard time figuring where one of you stops and the other begins—you act as a single creature that almost nothing can stop.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You promised that character a ride anywhere they wanted to go on your mount. They haven’t yet taken you up on your offer.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You promised that character a ride anywhere they wanted to go on your mount. They haven’t yet taken you up on your offer.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You rode them to safety after they got in trouble with the law. Trouble hasn’t found you because of it. Yet.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You rode them to safety after they got in trouble with the law. Trouble hasn’t found you because of it. Yet.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. That character was hired to kill you, but they didn’t, because they like your mount.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. That character was hired to kill you, but they didn’t, because they like your mount.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Due to a misunderstanding of identity, you rode them down once. They still have a scar, but it’s up to them whether they hold it against you.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Due to a misunderstanding of identity, you rode them down once. They still have a scar, but it’s up to them whether they hold it against you.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: A mount plus riding gear including saddle, bridle, and stirrups.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: A mount plus riding gear including saddle, bridle, and stirrups.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Speed Pool or 2 health to your mount. Major Effect Suggestion: You can take a second action this round.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Speed Pool or 2 health to your mount. Major Effect Suggestion: You can take a second action this round.

trans-unit.source: Tier One
trans-unit.target: Tier One

trans-unit.source: Rider: You are trained in riding any kind of creature that commonly serves as a mount in the setting. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Rider: You are trained in riding any kind of creature that commonly serves as a mount in the setting. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Trick Rider: You can make an attack with a light or medium ranged weapon and attempt a riding task as a single action. Riding tasks could be as straightforward as keeping up with a fleeing foe or as tricky as hanging upside down beneath your galloping mount, standing upright on the saddle of your galloping mount, and so on. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Trick Rider: You can make an attack with a light or medium ranged weapon and attempt a riding task as a single action. Riding tasks could be as straightforward as keeping up with a fleeing foe or as tricky as hanging upside down beneath your galloping mount, standing upright on the saddle of your galloping mount, and so on. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 2
trans-unit.target: Tier 2

trans-unit.source: Supernatural Jump (4 Speed points): You can use this ability in one of two ways. If you’re on your mount, you can move a long distance from one location to another almost instantaneously, carried by the creature you ride. You must be able to see the new location, and there must be no intervening barriers. Alternatively, you can use this ability to summon your mount from wherever it happens to be, leap up into the saddle, and use Trick Rider to make an attack or attempt a riding task. (Your mount can usually reach you even if you are deep underground, high in the air, or in another dimension, because your connection to your mount transcends the natural.) Action.
trans-unit.target: Supernatural Jump (4 Speed points): You can use this ability in one of two ways. If you’re on your mount, you can move a long distance from one location to another almost instantaneously, carried by the creature you ride. You must be able to see the new location, and there must be no intervening barriers. Alternatively, you can use this ability to summon your mount from wherever it happens to be, leap up into the saddle, and use Trick Rider to make an attack or attempt a riding task. (Your mount can usually reach you even if you are deep underground, high in the air, or in another dimension, because your connection to your mount transcends the natural.) Action.

trans-unit.source: Tier 3
trans-unit.target: Tier 3

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Enhanced Speed Edge or Nimble in the Saddle as a tier 3 ability. Either way, you also gain Expert Rider as a complementary tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Enhanced Speed Edge or Nimble in the Saddle as a tier 3 ability. Either way, you also gain Expert Rider as a complementary tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Enhanced Speed Edge: You gain +1 to your Speed Edge. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Enhanced Speed Edge: You gain +1 to your Speed Edge. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Expert Rider: You are specialized in all tasks related to riding a mount, including those pertinent to the care and healing of your mount. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Expert Rider: You are specialized in all tasks related to riding a mount, including those pertinent to the care and healing of your mount. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Nimble in the Saddle: Whether in the saddle or not, you’ve developed amazing reflexes. You’re trained in Speed defense tasks. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Nimble in the Saddle: Whether in the saddle or not, you’ve developed amazing reflexes. You’re trained in Speed defense tasks. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 4
trans-unit.target: Tier 4

trans-unit.source: Gallop Across the Sky (4+ Speed points): Your ride your mount into the air and fly for one minute at a rate of up to a long distance each round. For each level of Effort you apply, you can increase the duration of the effect by one minute or carry one ally of about your size with you that will also fit on your mount. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Gallop Across the Sky (4+ Speed points): Your ride your mount into the air and fly for one minute at a rate of up to a long distance each round. For each level of Effort you apply, you can increase the duration of the effect by one minute or carry one ally of about your size with you that will also fit on your mount. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Dangerous When Mounted: When you attack from your saddle, you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Dangerous When Mounted: When you attack from your saddle, you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Ride Across the Miles or Tornado Ride as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Ride Across the Miles or Tornado Ride as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Ride Across the Miles (6+ Speed points): You can ride your mount to an open location on the planet that you’re familiar with almost instantaneously. If you apply a level of Effort, you can attempt to penetrate covered locations that you’re aware of as long as a route exists from the open air to the area you want to reach. Action.
trans-unit.target: Ride Across the Miles (6+ Speed points): You can ride your mount to an open location on the planet that you’re familiar with almost instantaneously. If you apply a level of Effort, you can attempt to penetrate covered locations that you’re aware of as long as a route exists from the open air to the area you want to reach. Action.

trans-unit.source: Tornado Rider (7 Speed points): Your mount’s flashing hooves churn up a small tornado, lifting you and your mount a long distance into the eye of the supernatural storm. The tornado moves as you direct it up to a short distance each round for up to five minutes or until you dismiss it. The swirling winds damage creatures, objects, and structures within short range of the tornado’s eye. Each round, creatures in the area take 3 points of damage due to debris on the wind. Attempts to damage objects or structures with your tornado are eased by two steps. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Tornado Rider (7 Speed points): Your mount’s flashing hooves churn up a small tornado, lifting you and your mount a long distance into the eye of the supernatural storm. The tornado moves as you direct it up to a short distance each round for up to five minutes or until you dismiss it. The swirling winds damage creatures, objects, and structures within short range of the tornado’s eye. Each round, creatures in the area take 3 points of damage due to debris on the wind. Attempts to damage objects or structures with your tornado are eased by two steps. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Spits Fire and Lead
trans-unit.target: Spits Fire and Lead

trans-unit.source: You once crossed paths with a fiery demon, learned a bit of blazecraft from an alchemist, or maybe just always had a special talent for starting fires. That and your love of letting your six‑shooters bark combine to make you the feared gunfighter that you are today. You might have developed a reputation already as you move between plains and badlands, using your uncanny skills to avenge, promote justice, or just enrich yourself. Whatever the case, it’s how you’ll acquit yourself when, inevitably, you draw your burning iron.
trans-unit.target: You once crossed paths with a fiery demon, learned a bit of blazecraft from an alchemist, or maybe just always had a special talent for starting fires. That and your love of letting your six‑shooters bark combine to make you the feared gunfighter that you are today. You might have developed a reputation already as you move between plains and badlands, using your uncanny skills to avenge, promote justice, or just enrich yourself. Whatever the case, it’s how you’ll acquit yourself when, inevitably, you draw your burning iron.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character also likes fire. You both deal 1 additional point of damage when you fight the same foe using fire.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character also likes fire. You both deal 1 additional point of damage when you fight the same foe using fire.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You’re certain this character appreciates your smoldering gun and is impressed by how well you shoot. This may or may not actually be the case.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You’re certain this character appreciates your smoldering gun and is impressed by how well you shoot. This may or may not actually be the case.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They quietly think you’re either a demon or kin to demons. How they feel about demons is up to them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They quietly think you’re either a demon or kin to demons. How they feel about demons is up to them.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You failed to protect this character at some point in the past, and you feel compelled to make up for your failure.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You failed to protect this character at some point in the past, and you feel compelled to make up for your failure.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: A six‑shooter (medium or heavy weapon) and 20 rounds of ammunition.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: A six‑shooter (medium or heavy weapon) and 20 rounds of ammunition.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You graze a target so that their tasks are hindered next round. Major Effect Suggestion: The target ignites, taking 2 points of damage from fire each round for three rounds (or until they or an ally use an action to douse the flame).
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You graze a target so that their tasks are hindered next round. Major Effect Suggestion: The target ignites, taking 2 points of damage from fire each round for three rounds (or until they or an ally use an action to douse the flame).

trans-unit.source: Tier 1 Type Swap If you wish, you can swap one or two abilities gained from your type for one or two of the following. Ask your GM what reloading rules are like for pistols before choosing Reload.
trans-unit.target: Tier 1 Type Swap If you wish, you can swap one or two abilities gained from your type for one or two of the following. Ask your GM what reloading rules are like for pistols before choosing Reload.

trans-unit.source: Cogent Shot: You can spend points from either your Speed Pool or your Intellect Pool to apply Effort to hit a target with a gun or increase the damage inflicted doing so. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Cogent Shot: You can spend points from either your Speed Pool or your Intellect Pool to apply Effort to hit a target with a gun or increase the damage inflicted doing so. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Reload (1 Speed point): When using a weapon that normally requires an action to reload, you can reload and fire (or fire and reload) in the same action. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Reload (1 Speed point): When using a weapon that normally requires an action to reload, you can reload and fire (or fire and reload) in the same action. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 1
trans-unit.target: Tier 1

trans-unit.source: Smoldering Gun (1 Intellect point): Your gun blazes with flame for ten minutes, glowing red and discharging a tendril of smoke from the barrel. The flames don’t burn you, but you inflict 1 additional point of damage with the gun while it burns. While the gun burns, it automatically flares when anyone tries to touch you or strike you with a melee attack, dealing 2 points of damage to them. Flames from another source can still hurt you. While your gun smolders, you gain +1 Armor against damage from fire from another source.
trans-unit.target: Smoldering Gun (1 Intellect point): Your gun blazes with flame for ten minutes, glowing red and discharging a tendril of smoke from the barrel. The flames don’t burn you, but you inflict 1 additional point of damage with the gun while it burns. While the gun burns, it automatically flares when anyone tries to touch you or strike you with a melee attack, dealing 2 points of damage to them. Flames from another source can still hurt you. While your gun smolders, you gain +1 Armor against damage from fire from another source.

trans-unit.source: Alternate Energy: If you’d prefer another element or energy source, such as ice or necrotic energy, work with your GM to adjust this and related abilities. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Alternate Energy: If you’d prefer another element or energy source, such as ice or necrotic energy, work with your GM to adjust this and related abilities. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Practiced With Guns: You are practiced with guns and suffer no penalty when using one. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Practiced With Guns: You are practiced with guns and suffer no penalty when using one. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 2
trans-unit.target: Tier 2

trans-unit.source: Summon Gun (3 Intellect points): If you’re ever without your six‑shooter, you can summon it (or another just like it) instantly to your hand, already loaded. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Summon Gun (3 Intellect points): If you’re ever without your six‑shooter, you can summon it (or another just like it) instantly to your hand, already loaded. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 3
trans-unit.target: Tier 3

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Meticulous Aim or Quickdraw as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Meticulous Aim or Quickdraw as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Meticulous Aim: If you spend an action lining up your shot while Smoldering Gun is active, each level of Effort adds 5 points of damage to a successful attack instead of 3. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Meticulous Aim: If you spend an action lining up your shot while Smoldering Gun is active, each level of Effort adds 5 points of damage to a successful attack instead of 3. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Quickdraw: If you act first and your firearm is holstered, you can draw and fire your weapon so blindingly fast that you gain a surprise action against your foe, even if your foe was already aware of your presence (but not if combat has already begun). This doesn’t allow your allies to act with surprise, only you. You have an asset on the attack. On a successful hit, you inflict 2 additional points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Quickdraw: If you act first and your firearm is holstered, you can draw and fire your weapon so blindingly fast that you gain a surprise action against your foe, even if your foe was already aware of your presence (but not if combat has already begun). This doesn’t allow your allies to act with surprise, only you. You have an asset on the attack. On a successful hit, you inflict 2 additional points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 4
trans-unit.target: Tier 4

trans-unit.source: Blazing Bullets (1+ Intellect points): While Smoldering Gun is active, you inflict an additional 3 points of damage with your chosen weapon (+4 points of damage total). In addition to the normal options for using Effort, applying a level of Effort can cause the bullet to explode on impact, potentially dealing damage to all creatures in immediate range of your target; roll an attack for each separately. Even if you miss, you still deal 1 point of damage with fiery lead shrapnel. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Blazing Bullets (1+ Intellect points): While Smoldering Gun is active, you inflict an additional 3 points of damage with your chosen weapon (+4 points of damage total). In addition to the normal options for using Effort, applying a level of Effort can cause the bullet to explode on impact, potentially dealing damage to all creatures in immediate range of your target; roll an attack for each separately. Even if you miss, you still deal 1 point of damage with fiery lead shrapnel. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Forgeborn Bullet (5 Intellect points): Your fired bullet blooms into a fiery forgeborn with a somewhat humanoid appearance that does your bidding for up to ten minutes. (You can’t summon a forgeborn and attack with the same bullet.) After its task is complete, you dismiss the fiery forgeborn as part of another action, or if it is destroyed, it implodes back into a smoldering bullet. Action to initiate. Fiery forgeborn: _level 4; anyone who tries to touch or strike the forgeborn with a melee attack automatically takes 1 fire damage_
trans-unit.target: Forgeborn Bullet (5 Intellect points): Your fired bullet blooms into a fiery forgeborn with a somewhat humanoid appearance that does your bidding for up to ten minutes. (You can’t summon a forgeborn and attack with the same bullet.) After its task is complete, you dismiss the fiery forgeborn as part of another action, or if it is destroyed, it implodes back into a smoldering bullet. Action to initiate. Fiery forgeborn: _level 4; anyone who tries to touch or strike the forgeborn with a melee attack automatically takes 1 fire damage_

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Hot Shot or Never Miss a Shot as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Hot Shot or Never Miss a Shot as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Hot Shot: When you hit a target with a gun attack while Smoldering Gun is active, you can choose to reduce the damage by 1 point but gain an additional related effect and/or hit a target in a precise spot. Possible effects include (but are not limited to) the following:
trans-unit.target: Hot Shot: When you hit a target with a gun attack while Smoldering Gun is active, you can choose to reduce the damage by 1 point but gain an additional related effect and/or hit a target in a precise spot. Possible effects include (but are not limited to) the following:

trans-unit.source: You can ignite a structure (if you succeed on an Intellect‑based task against its level).
trans-unit.target: You can ignite a structure (if you succeed on an Intellect‑based task against its level).

trans-unit.source: You can create a flaming message in the sky consisting of a handful of words that lasts for up to a minute.
trans-unit.target: You can create a flaming message in the sky consisting of a handful of words that lasts for up to a minute.

trans-unit.source: You can shoot an object out of someone’s hand.
trans-unit.target: You can shoot an object out of someone’s hand.

trans-unit.source: You can shoot the leg, wing, or other limb your target uses to move, reducing their maximum movement speed to immediate for a few days or until they receive expert medical care.
trans-unit.target: You can shoot the leg, wing, or other limb your target uses to move, reducing their maximum movement speed to immediate for a few days or until they receive expert medical care.

trans-unit.source: You can shoot a strap holding a backpack, armor, or a similarly strapped‑on item so that it falls off. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: You can shoot a strap holding a backpack, armor, or a similarly strapped‑on item so that it falls off. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Never Miss a Shot: If you shoot at a target and miss, reroll. If you hit, it’s because your shot ricochets off a nearby surface and actually hits, inflicting 2 fewer points of damage. Each time you reroll the same shot, 2 more points are deducted from the total damage, until the wildly ricocheting shot finally hits its target or the damage amount goes to 0. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Never Miss a Shot: If you shoot at a target and miss, reroll. If you hit, it’s because your shot ricochets off a nearby surface and actually hits, inflicting 2 fewer points of damage. Each time you reroll the same shot, 2 more points are deducted from the total damage, until the wildly ricocheting shot finally hits its target or the damage amount goes to 0. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Strikes Like a Rattler
trans-unit.target: Strikes Like a Rattler

trans-unit.source: Your body is a venomous weapon able to cripple and kill. Watchful as a coiled rattlesnake, you’re ready to evade an attacker, then strike back with fists, elbows, knees, or feet that sink into flesh with the speed of fangs. Fact is, you’ve got a supernatural connection to venomous serpents, the rattler in particular. That spiritual fusion empowers you both offensively and defensively, maybe even eventually giving you power over snakes, or allowing you to become a serpent avatar after shedding your skin.
trans-unit.target: Your body is a venomous weapon able to cripple and kill. Watchful as a coiled rattlesnake, you’re ready to evade an attacker, then strike back with fists, elbows, knees, or feet that sink into flesh with the speed of fangs. Fact is, you’ve got a supernatural connection to venomous serpents, the rattler in particular. That spiritual fusion empowers you both offensively and defensively, maybe even eventually giving you power over snakes, or allowing you to become a serpent avatar after shedding your skin.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You rescued this character from a bad situation, but in doing so, you killed someone close to the character. Maybe that was also the PC’s persecutor, but there’s still some tension between you.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You rescued this character from a bad situation, but in doing so, you killed someone close to the character. Maybe that was also the PC’s persecutor, but there’s still some tension between you.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You were once given a package to deliver to them from a mysterious source, but you lost the package before you were able to hand it over.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You were once given a package to deliver to them from a mysterious source, but you lost the package before you were able to hand it over.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You accidently envenomated them when they shook you awake or otherwise startled you. How they feel about that now is up to them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You accidently envenomated them when they shook you awake or otherwise startled you. How they feel about that now is up to them.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They owe you a significant amount of money.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They owe you a significant amount of money.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You make yourself a target, easing your allies’ defense rolls until your next turn. Major Effect Suggestion: You get a second wind and can make an immediate recovery roll that doesn’t count against your regular number of recovery rolls today.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You make yourself a target, easing your allies’ defense rolls until your next turn. Major Effect Suggestion: You get a second wind and can make an immediate recovery roll that doesn’t count against your regular number of recovery rolls today.

trans-unit.source: Tier 1 Type Swap If you wish, you can swap an ability gained from your type for the following.
trans-unit.target: Tier 1 Type Swap If you wish, you can swap an ability gained from your type for the following.

trans-unit.source: Swift Slither (1+ Speed points): You can move a short distance as part of another action. You can move a long distance as your entire action for a turn. If you apply a level of Effort to this ability, you can move a long distance and make an attack as your entire action for a turn, but the attack is hindered. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Swift Slither (1+ Speed points): You can move a short distance as part of another action. You can move a long distance as your entire action for a turn. If you apply a level of Effort to this ability, you can move a long distance and make an attack as your entire action for a turn, but the attack is hindered. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 1
trans-unit.target: Tier 1

trans-unit.source: Venomous Strike (1+ Speed points): For ten minutes, your unarmed attacks inflict 1 additional point of damage (ignores Armor) from venom. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Venomous Strike (1+ Speed points): For ten minutes, your unarmed attacks inflict 1 additional point of damage (ignores Armor) from venom. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Scaled (1+ Speed points): For one hour, your skin grows subtle, supple scales in vulnerable places, granting you +1 to Armor if you do not wear physical armor. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Scaled (1+ Speed points): For one hour, your skin grows subtle, supple scales in vulnerable places, granting you +1 to Armor if you do not wear physical armor. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Tier 2
trans-unit.target: Tier 2

trans-unit.source: Unarmed Fighting Style: You are trained in unarmed attacks, assuming you’re not already (because this ability provides no benefit if you are). Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Unarmed Fighting Style: You are trained in unarmed attacks, assuming you’re not already (because this ability provides no benefit if you are). Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Snake Charmer (1+ Intellect points): You calm an ophidian creature within short range. You must speak to it (though it doesn’t need to understand your words), and it must see you. It remains calm for one minute or for as long as you focus all your attention on it. The GM has final say over what counts as a snakelike creature, but unless some kind of deception is at work, you should know whether you can affect it before you attempt to use this ability on it. If you spend 1 additional Intellect point when you use this ability, you can calm all nonhuman beasts, as the GM determines (aliens, demons, animals that can speak, and forgeborn never count). Action.
trans-unit.target: Snake Charmer (1+ Intellect points): You calm an ophidian creature within short range. You must speak to it (though it doesn’t need to understand your words), and it must see you. It remains calm for one minute or for as long as you focus all your attention on it. The GM has final say over what counts as a snakelike creature, but unless some kind of deception is at work, you should know whether you can affect it before you attempt to use this ability on it. If you spend 1 additional Intellect point when you use this ability, you can calm all nonhuman beasts, as the GM determines (aliens, demons, animals that can speak, and forgeborn never count). Action.

trans-unit.source: Tier 3
trans-unit.target: Tier 3

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Gain Rattler Companion or Stupefying Rattle as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Gain Rattler Companion or Stupefying Rattle as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Gain Rattler Companion: You gain a supernatural rattlesnake—a dust diamondback—as a constant companion. It is over 10 feet (3 m) long and follows your psychic commands. You’ll probably make rolls for it in combat or when it takes actions (or it can ease your attacks or your defenses in combat). The companion acts on your turn. If your companion dies, you can hunt in the badlands for a few days to find a new one. Enabler. Dust diamondback: level 3, Speed defense as level 4; health 12; bite deals 3 damage plus 1 Speed damage (ignores Armor) on a failed Might defense roll
trans-unit.target: Gain Rattler Companion: You gain a supernatural rattlesnake—a dust diamondback—as a constant companion. It is over 10 feet (3 m) long and follows your psychic commands. You’ll probably make rolls for it in combat or when it takes actions (or it can ease your attacks or your defenses in combat). The companion acts on your turn. If your companion dies, you can hunt in the badlands for a few days to find a new one. Enabler. Dust diamondback: level 3, Speed defense as level 4; health 12; bite deals 3 damage plus 1 Speed damage (ignores Armor) on a failed Might defense roll

trans-unit.source: Stupefying Rattle (4 Speed points): With a slithering flourish and a ghost rattle echoing from some otherworldly source, you redirect a melee attack that would otherwise hit you if you succeed on a difficulty 2 Speed task. When you do, the misdirected attack hits another creature you choose within immediate range of both you and the attacking foe. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Stupefying Rattle (4 Speed points): With a slithering flourish and a ghost rattle echoing from some otherworldly source, you redirect a melee attack that would otherwise hit you if you succeed on a difficulty 2 Speed task. When you do, the misdirected attack hits another creature you choose within immediate range of both you and the attacking foe. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 4
trans-unit.target: Tier 4

trans-unit.source: Warmed by the Sun (2 Intellect points): After spending ten minutes in the sun, a hot spring, or other such warm location, you gain a free ten‑minute recovery roll. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until after your next ten‑hour recovery roll. Ten minutes to activate.
trans-unit.target: Warmed by the Sun (2 Intellect points): After spending ten minutes in the sun, a hot spring, or other such warm location, you gain a free ten‑minute recovery roll. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until after your next ten‑hour recovery roll. Ten minutes to activate.

trans-unit.source: Tier 5
trans-unit.target: Tier 5

trans-unit.source: Venom in Their Blood (5 Speed points): If you successfully attack a creature that you previously damaged with Venomous Strike, you deal 9 additional points of damage. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again during the current conflict. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Venom in Their Blood (5 Speed points): If you successfully attack a creature that you previously damaged with Venomous Strike, you deal 9 additional points of damage. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again during the current conflict. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Tier 6
trans-unit.target: Tier 6

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Shed Skin or Spray Venom as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Shed Skin or Spray Venom as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Shed Skin (7+ Speed points): You shed your normal likeness, revealing a terrifying 30-foot (9 m) long rattlesnake. For one minute, your abilities change as follows: You add 8 points to your Speed Pool, 1 point to your Speed Edge, 2 points to your Intellect Pool, and 1 point to your Intellect Edge; and you gain the “air gliding” ability (you can fly a long distance each round). After reverting to your normal form, you lose the benefit of air gliding, your Edge values return to normal, and you must subtract the same number of points you gained in your Pools (if this brings a Pool to 0, subtract the overflow first from your Might Pool, then your Speed Pool, and then, if necessary, from your Intellect Pool). While the ability was active, if you did not deal damage with Venomous Strike, your rolls are hindered by two steps until after your next ten‑hour recovery roll. Each additional time you use Shed Skin before your next ten‑hour recovery roll, you must apply an additional level of Effort. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Shed Skin (7+ Speed points): You shed your normal likeness, revealing a terrifying 30-foot (9 m) long rattlesnake. For one minute, your abilities change as follows: You add 8 points to your Speed Pool, 1 point to your Speed Edge, 2 points to your Intellect Pool, and 1 point to your Intellect Edge; and you gain the “air gliding” ability (you can fly a long distance each round). After reverting to your normal form, you lose the benefit of air gliding, your Edge values return to normal, and you must subtract the same number of points you gained in your Pools (if this brings a Pool to 0, subtract the overflow first from your Might Pool, then your Speed Pool, and then, if necessary, from your Intellect Pool). While the ability was active, if you did not deal damage with Venomous Strike, your rolls are hindered by two steps until after your next ten‑hour recovery roll. Each additional time you use Shed Skin before your next ten‑hour recovery roll, you must apply an additional level of Effort. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Spray Venom (5+ Speed points): You hiss and release a spray of burning, flesh‑dissolving venom at one target within short range, inflicting 5 points of damage. Even on a miss, you inflict 1 point of damage. If you apply a level of Effort when you make an attack with this ability (either to increase the odds of hitting or to increase damage), you can also choose to spin about as you spray venom, attacking every creature you choose within short range, and the improved chance to hit or deal damage applies to each attack. As with the base use, even on a miss, you inflict 1 point of damage. However, spinning as you spray venom is dizzying, leaving you dazed for a round afterward, during which time all your tasks are hindered. Action.
trans-unit.target: Spray Venom (5+ Speed points): You hiss and release a spray of burning, flesh‑dissolving venom at one target within short range, inflicting 5 points of damage. Even on a miss, you inflict 1 point of damage. If you apply a level of Effort when you make an attack with this ability (either to increase the odds of hitting or to increase damage), you can also choose to spin about as you spray venom, attacking every creature you choose within short range, and the improved chance to hit or deal damage applies to each attack. As with the base use, even on a miss, you inflict 1 point of damage. However, spinning as you spray venom is dizzying, leaving you dazed for a round afterward, during which time all your tasks are hindered. Action.

trans-unit.source: Extra Rules
trans-unit.target: Extra Rules

trans-unit.source: PLAYING POKER
trans-unit.target: PLAYING POKER

trans-unit.source: The most obvious way you’d use physical cards in a Cypher System game is by actually playing a few rounds of poker (like Texas hold ’em, five‑card draw, and so on), blackjack, faro, or some other card game when the characters have gotten themselves into an especially important in‑world card game.
trans-unit.target: The most obvious way you’d use physical cards in a Cypher System game is by actually playing a few rounds of poker (like Texas hold ’em, five‑card draw, and so on), blackjack, faro, or some other card game when the characters have gotten themselves into an especially important in‑world card game.

trans-unit.source: Usually, this means that you, the GM, will be standing in for one or more NPCs. The upshot is that every NPC poker player effectively has the same skill playing the game as you have, regardless of how good the NPC should be according to their stats. The same may be true of players, but at least they’re only simulating their single character; you could end up playing for multiple different NPCs over the course of a weird west campaign.
trans-unit.target: Usually, this means that you, the GM, will be standing in for one or more NPCs. The upshot is that every NPC poker player effectively has the same skill playing the game as you have, regardless of how good the NPC should be according to their stats. The same may be true of players, but at least they’re only simulating their single character; you could end up playing for multiple different NPCs over the course of a weird west campaign.

trans-unit.source: The following options can help you simulate different styles of play for different NPCs.
trans-unit.target: The following options can help you simulate different styles of play for different NPCs.

trans-unit.source: Simulating NPC Poker Players
trans-unit.target: Simulating NPC Poker Players

trans-unit.source: Hard‑bitten gamblers who make their living at the card tables fall into individual styles. A handful of play styles are recognized, categorized by a cardplayer’s tendencies at various stages during a particular hand. The intricacies of those styles have their place, but not here. Instead, this optional rule provides five streamlined and broad categories, paired with some guidance on how you as the GM can “cheat” to make a given NPC’s play style more like the person you’re standing in for at the table. Make sure to let players know you’ll be using this method ahead of time, because otherwise some could misunderstand and think you’re actually cheating, which wouldn’t be fun for anyone.
trans-unit.target: Hard‑bitten gamblers who make their living at the card tables fall into individual styles. A handful of play styles are recognized, categorized by a cardplayer’s tendencies at various stages during a particular hand. The intricacies of those styles have their place, but not here. Instead, this optional rule provides five streamlined and broad categories, paired with some guidance on how you as the GM can “cheat” to make a given NPC’s play style more like the person you’re standing in for at the table. Make sure to let players know you’ll be using this method ahead of time, because otherwise some could misunderstand and think you’re actually cheating, which wouldn’t be fun for anyone.

trans-unit.source: Ace
trans-unit.target: Ace

trans-unit.source: This NPC is an expert player who understands the intricacies of the game, how to bluff, and how to read the other players. They’re one of the best card sharks the PCs are ever likely to face.
trans-unit.target: This NPC is an expert player who understands the intricacies of the game, how to bluff, and how to read the other players. They’re one of the best card sharks the PCs are ever likely to face.

trans-unit.source: One way you can simulate this style of play is that you get two extra cards any time you draw cards for your hand, from which you can choose to make the best winning hand possible. For example, if you’re playing Texas hold ’em, you’d get four private cards (“hole cards”) instead of two that you’d use in combination with the community cards to make the best hand possible.
trans-unit.target: One way you can simulate this style of play is that you get two extra cards any time you draw cards for your hand, from which you can choose to make the best winning hand possible. For example, if you’re playing Texas hold ’em, you’d get four private cards (“hole cards”) instead of two that you’d use in combination with the community cards to make the best hand possible.

trans-unit.source: Reasonably Skilled
trans-unit.target: Reasonably Skilled

trans-unit.source: This NPC is pretty good. Good enough, anyhow, to keep playing the tables even after some bad hands.
trans-unit.target: This NPC is pretty good. Good enough, anyhow, to keep playing the tables even after some bad hands.

trans-unit.source: If you consider yourself such a player, you could just play the game as usual. However, if you’re somewhat new to the game, give this NPC the benefit of one extra card any time you draw cards to your hand, but otherwise play like you’d simulate an ace NPC poker player.
trans-unit.target: If you consider yourself such a player, you could just play the game as usual. However, if you’re somewhat new to the game, give this NPC the benefit of one extra card any time you draw cards to your hand, but otherwise play like you’d simulate an ace NPC poker player.

trans-unit.source: Cheat
trans-unit.target: Cheat

trans-unit.source: This NPC is reasonably skilled at poker, but they also sometimes cheat. Give this NPC the benefit of one extra card any time you draw cards to your hand, but otherwise play like you’d simulate an ace NPC poker player.
trans-unit.target: This NPC is reasonably skilled at poker, but they also sometimes cheat. Give this NPC the benefit of one extra card any time you draw cards to your hand, but otherwise play like you’d simulate an ace NPC poker player.

trans-unit.source: Novice
trans-unit.target: Novice

trans-unit.source: This NPC is just learning the game and really doesn’t have the experience to know how to consistently win. Most novices are quickly cleaned out and lose their seat at the table unless they have an especially large chip advantage.
trans-unit.target: This NPC is just learning the game and really doesn’t have the experience to know how to consistently win. Most novices are quickly cleaned out and lose their seat at the table unless they have an especially large chip advantage.

trans-unit.source: If you’re equally new to poker, you could just play the game as you can. However, if you’re actually a better player than a novice, you’ll have to handicap your play. That’s easy enough; just don’t choose the best hands and discard to lose, not win.
trans-unit.target: If you’re equally new to poker, you could just play the game as you can. However, if you’re actually a better player than a novice, you’ll have to handicap your play. That’s easy enough; just don’t choose the best hands and discard to lose, not win.

trans-unit.source: Maniac
trans-unit.target: Maniac

trans-unit.source: An NPC “maniac” plays most hands, even with a weak hand, and usually bets as if they’re going to win. This style leads to high variance, but in the long term, maniacs tend to lose lots of money.
trans-unit.target: An NPC “maniac” plays most hands, even with a weak hand, and usually bets as if they’re going to win. This style leads to high variance, but in the long term, maniacs tend to lose lots of money.

trans-unit.source: An easy way to simulate this style is just play that way; don’t fold, always call or raise the bet, and stay in the game as if you’ve got a winning hand.
trans-unit.target: An easy way to simulate this style is just play that way; don’t fold, always call or raise the bet, and stay in the game as if you’ve got a winning hand.

trans-unit.source: PC Skills and Real Poker
trans-unit.target: PC Skills and Real Poker

trans-unit.source: It’s possible that you’ll end up playing a real game of poker, twenty‑one, or another card game that corresponds to an in‑world game between the PCs and one or more NPCs. In which case, your players’ knowledge and ability to play the game will be literally on display.
trans-unit.target: It’s possible that you’ll end up playing a real game of poker, twenty‑one, or another card game that corresponds to an in‑world game between the PCs and one or more NPCs. In which case, your players’ knowledge and ability to play the game will be literally on display.

trans-unit.source: The question is: Does an in‑world character’s training or specialization in poker (and similar games where bluffing is important, as is knowledge of the odds of what other players might be holding) affect the player’s game of poker in the real world?
trans-unit.target: The question is: Does an in‑world character’s training or specialization in poker (and similar games where bluffing is important, as is knowledge of the odds of what other players might be holding) affect the player’s game of poker in the real world?

trans-unit.source: Your answer might be no. And that’s great. Your players might not want it any other way. But this optional rule gives players the opportunity to upgrade their chance of winning a hand or two if the character they’re playing is skilled (while the player is more novice‑level). As with when you enhance your own skill using this technique, make sure that all the players understand what’s going on—if one or more of the other players are using this rule to evoke the skill of their characters, they’re not actually cheating.
trans-unit.target: Your answer might be no. And that’s great. Your players might not want it any other way. But this optional rule gives players the opportunity to upgrade their chance of winning a hand or two if the character they’re playing is skilled (while the player is more novice‑level). As with when you enhance your own skill using this technique, make sure that all the players understand what’s going on—if one or more of the other players are using this rule to evoke the skill of their characters, they’re not actually cheating.

trans-unit.source: Trained in Poker: If the player’s character is trained in poker, the player can choose to get an extra card when they draw cards for a hand, which they can use to make the best winning hand possible. The ability is usable once, but renews each time they lose a hand.
trans-unit.target: Trained in Poker: If the player’s character is trained in poker, the player can choose to get an extra card when they draw cards for a hand, which they can use to make the best winning hand possible. The ability is usable once, but renews each time they lose a hand.

trans-unit.source: Specialized in Poker: If the player’s character is specialized in poker, the player can choose to get two extra cards when they draw cards for a hand, which they can use to make the best winning hand possible. The ability is usable once, but renews each time they lose a hand.
trans-unit.target: Specialized in Poker: If the player’s character is specialized in poker, the player can choose to get two extra cards when they draw cards for a hand, which they can use to make the best winning hand possible. The ability is usable once, but renews each time they lose a hand.

trans-unit.source: Cheating: What if a player’s character is something of an in‑world cheat at poker, but a player doesn’t have the skill to palm a card up their sleeve? Each time a player decides to use their character’s ability to cheat, use the same rule as presented for a character trained or specialized in poker for a character trained or specialized in cheating at cards, respectively, with one additional caveat, as follows.
trans-unit.target: Cheating: What if a player’s character is something of an in‑world cheat at poker, but a player doesn’t have the skill to palm a card up their sleeve? Each time a player decides to use their character’s ability to cheat, use the same rule as presented for a character trained or specialized in poker for a character trained or specialized in cheating at cards, respectively, with one additional caveat, as follows.

trans-unit.source: Each time a player relies on their character’s cheating skill, they must succeed on a Speed‑based task to cheat against the highest-level NPC playing (or closely observing) the game. On a failed roll, the NPC notices the cheat and probably calls out the character.
trans-unit.target: Each time a player relies on their character’s cheating skill, they must succeed on a Speed‑based task to cheat against the highest-level NPC playing (or closely observing) the game. On a failed roll, the NPC notices the cheat and probably calls out the character.

trans-unit.source: Evoking Poker with Dice
trans-unit.target: Evoking Poker with Dice

trans-unit.source: In some situations, you may want to use Cypher System–adjacent rules to evoke a game of poker PCs play with one or more NPCs, rather than actually playing poker with cards. Here’s a simple optional rule for doing just that. (For something even easier, see Even Quicker Poker Resolution With Dice.)
trans-unit.target: In some situations, you may want to use Cypher System–adjacent rules to evoke a game of poker PCs play with one or more NPCs, rather than actually playing poker with cards. Here’s a simple optional rule for doing just that. (For something even easier, see Even Quicker Poker Resolution With Dice.)

trans-unit.source: All dice rolls are made openly. In an actual game, players would hide their hole cards, but remember, this optional rule is for quick resolution, not exacting simulation. The rounds of betting that would normally occur and options for cardplayers to “develop” their hands come down to just a single roll under this procedure.
trans-unit.target: All dice rolls are made openly. In an actual game, players would hide their hole cards, but remember, this optional rule is for quick resolution, not exacting simulation. The rounds of betting that would normally occur and options for cardplayers to “develop” their hands come down to just a single roll under this procedure.

trans-unit.source: Ante/Blinds: Each PC adds in‑world money to the pot—probably an inexpensive amount, though that can vary. (For simplicity’s sake, hold ’em variations that include big and small blinds are rolled up into this step.)
trans-unit.target: Ante/Blinds: Each PC adds in‑world money to the pot—probably an inexpensive amount, though that can vary. (For simplicity’s sake, hold ’em variations that include big and small blinds are rolled up into this step.)

trans-unit.source: Determine Hand Level: As the GM, you set the difficulty for the hand, which is equal to the level of the highest-level NPC—or their modification for poker skill—at the table. However, don’t reveal that level until after PCs decide whether to stay in or fold. (If you want to increase the level of the handlater, you can do so as a GM intrusion.
trans-unit.target: Determine Hand Level: As the GM, you set the difficulty for the hand, which is equal to the level of the highest-level NPC—or their modification for poker skill—at the table. However, don’t reveal that level until after PCs decide whether to stay in or fold. (If you want to increase the level of the handlater, you can do so as a GM intrusion.

trans-unit.source: Set the Bet: You also set the bet, which could be a moderate or higher amount of money.
trans-unit.target: Set the Bet: You also set the bet, which could be a moderate or higher amount of money.

trans-unit.source: Stay or Fold: Once PCs know the bet, they can fold and leave the hand if they don’t want to add that additional amount to the pot above the ante they’ve already paid. If they stay in, the character must commit the bet amount to the pot. (In an actual card game, cardplayers could also raise the bet that everyone else has to meet to stay in, but we’re going for simplicity, and all thoserounds are condensed into this single step.)
trans-unit.target: Stay or Fold: Once PCs know the bet, they can fold and leave the hand if they don’t want to add that additional amount to the pot above the ante they’ve already paid. If they stay in, the character must commit the bet amount to the pot. (In an actual card game, cardplayers could also raise the bet that everyone else has to meet to stay in, but we’re going for simplicity, and all thoserounds are condensed into this single step.)

trans-unit.source: Resolve the Hand: PCs who are still in must succeed on an Intellect‑based roll against the hand’s difficulty. Skills related to playing poker apply to their roll, and the player can apply Effort.
trans-unit.target: Resolve the Hand: PCs who are still in must succeed on an Intellect‑based roll against the hand’s difficulty. Skills related to playing poker apply to their roll, and the player can apply Effort.

trans-unit.source: Interpret Results: Use the following guidelines to figure out who wins the hand. The PC with the highest result that beats the hand’s level wins the hand and the amount in the pot goes to them. If two or more PCs beat the hand’s level and achieve the same result—say, both succeed on what would be a level 6 challenge—the pot for that round is split among those PCs. If no PC beats the hand’s level, the hand goes to the NPC at the table whose level in poker set the hand’s level.
trans-unit.target: Interpret Results: Use the following guidelines to figure out who wins the hand. The PC with the highest result that beats the hand’s level wins the hand and the amount in the pot goes to them. If two or more PCs beat the hand’s level and achieve the same result—say, both succeed on what would be a level 6 challenge—the pot for that round is split among those PCs. If no PC beats the hand’s level, the hand goes to the NPC at the table whose level in poker set the hand’s level.

trans-unit.source: If the evoking poker with dice optional rule seems too much for your players’ tastes, an entire poker game could be resolved by one roll against the hand’s level, set by the level of the highest-level NPC (or their modification for poker). The PC with the highest result that beats the hand’s level wins the hand and the amount in the pot goes to them.
trans-unit.target: If the evoking poker with dice optional rule seems too much for your players’ tastes, an entire poker game could be resolved by one roll against the hand’s level, set by the level of the highest-level NPC (or their modification for poker). The PC with the highest result that beats the hand’s level wins the hand and the amount in the pot goes to them.

trans-unit.source: If two or more PCs beat the hand’s level and achieve the same result—say, both succeed on what would be a level 6 challenge—the pot for that round is split among those PCs.
trans-unit.target: If two or more PCs beat the hand’s level and achieve the same result—say, both succeed on what would be a level 6 challenge—the pot for that round is split among those PCs.

trans-unit.source: If no PC beats the hand’s level, the hand goes to the NPC at the table whose level in poker set the hand.
trans-unit.target: If no PC beats the hand’s level, the hand goes to the NPC at the table whose level in poker set the hand.

trans-unit.source: HANDS OF FATE
trans-unit.target: HANDS OF FATE

trans-unit.source: Introducing the Hands of Fate optional rule gives PCs a bit more control over their situation while further investing them in a weird west feel.
trans-unit.target: Introducing the Hands of Fate optional rule gives PCs a bit more control over their situation while further investing them in a weird west feel.

trans-unit.source: Deal Fate’s Hand: At the beginning of each day (usually after players have completed a ten-hour recovery roll), deal each player two cards—these are their personal Hand of Fate cards. The hand doesn’t exist in‑world, but is instead a meta resource, to be used by the player for the benefit of their PC (sort of like XP).
trans-unit.target: Deal Fate’s Hand: At the beginning of each day (usually after players have completed a ten-hour recovery roll), deal each player two cards—these are their personal Hand of Fate cards. The hand doesn’t exist in‑world, but is instead a meta resource, to be used by the player for the benefit of their PC (sort of like XP).

trans-unit.source: Draw Community Cards: The first time the PCs have an encounter that day, draw three Hand of Fate community cards. These cards are placed face up on the table where all the players can see; all the players can use these community cards, combined with their personal Hand of Fate cards, to evaluate and eventually play their individual Hands of Fate. After you’ve dealt the first three community cards, draw and place one additional Hand of Fate community card each time a player triggers an intrusion or you intrude, until there are five community cards in total. These cards remain in play until a new day dawns or until all the players have played their individual Hands of Fate.
trans-unit.target: Draw Community Cards: The first time the PCs have an encounter that day, draw three Hand of Fate community cards. These cards are placed face up on the table where all the players can see; all the players can use these community cards, combined with their personal Hand of Fate cards, to evaluate and eventually play their individual Hands of Fate. After you’ve dealt the first three community cards, draw and place one additional Hand of Fate community card each time a player triggers an intrusion or you intrude, until there are five community cards in total. These cards remain in play until a new day dawns or until all the players have played their individual Hands of Fate.

trans-unit.source: Play a Hand of Fate: After the first three Hand of Fate community cards are drawn, a player can, at any time, choose to play their Hand of Fate for the day, using any combination of personal and community cards. Their PC gains the benefit noted for their hand, or a lesser benefit that appears further on in the list.
trans-unit.target: Play a Hand of Fate: After the first three Hand of Fate community cards are drawn, a player can, at any time, choose to play their Hand of Fate for the day, using any combination of personal and community cards. Their PC gains the benefit noted for their hand, or a lesser benefit that appears further on in the list.

trans-unit.source: Royal Flush (an Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and 10 all of the same suit): PC gains one benefit below and can be dealt another Hand of Fate for the day.
trans-unit.target: Royal Flush (an Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and 10 all of the same suit): PC gains one benefit below and can be dealt another Hand of Fate for the day.

trans-unit.source: Straight Flush (five sequential cards, Aces high, all of the same suit): PC gains 1 XP (to keep or use like any XP).
trans-unit.target: Straight Flush (five sequential cards, Aces high, all of the same suit): PC gains 1 XP (to keep or use like any XP).

trans-unit.source: Four of a Kind (four cards of the same value): PC can immediately take an action, even if they’ve already acted this round.
trans-unit.target: Four of a Kind (four cards of the same value): PC can immediately take an action, even if they’ve already acted this round.

trans-unit.source: Full House (three of a kind and a pair): PC replaces a d20 roll (their own or another player’s) with a 20.
trans-unit.target: Full House (three of a kind and a pair): PC replaces a d20 roll (their own or another player’s) with a 20.

trans-unit.source: Flush (five cards of the same suit): PC can apply three free levels of Effort to any one roll.
trans-unit.target: Flush (five cards of the same suit): PC can apply three free levels of Effort to any one roll.

trans-unit.source: Straight (five sequential cards, Aces high, in sequence): PC can apply two free levels of Effort to any one roll.
trans-unit.target: Straight (five sequential cards, Aces high, in sequence): PC can apply two free levels of Effort to any one roll.

trans-unit.source: Three of a Kind (three cards of the same value): PC can apply a free level of Effort to any one roll.
trans-unit.target: Three of a Kind (three cards of the same value): PC can apply a free level of Effort to any one roll.

trans-unit.source: Two Pair (two cards of the same value, twice): PC regains 5 Pool points.
trans-unit.target: Two Pair (two cards of the same value, twice): PC regains 5 Pool points.

trans-unit.source: One Pair (two cards of the same value): PC regains 3 Pool points.
trans-unit.target: One Pair (two cards of the same value): PC regains 3 Pool points.

trans-unit.source: High Card (none of the above hands): PC regains 1 Pool point.
trans-unit.target: High Card (none of the above hands): PC regains 1 Pool point.

trans-unit.source: DECK AS D20
trans-unit.target: DECK AS D20

trans-unit.source: Rolling a d20 offers a consistent 5% chance to produce any number from 1 to 20.
trans-unit.target: Rolling a d20 offers a consistent 5% chance to produce any number from 1 to 20.

trans-unit.source: This optional rule temporarily replaces player character d20 rolls with a card drawn from a specially constructed Midnight Deck (or standard 52‑card deck) that grants the same probability. The idea is that using the deck instead of dice further steeps a game in weird west ambiance.
trans-unit.target: This optional rule temporarily replaces player character d20 rolls with a card drawn from a specially constructed Midnight Deck (or standard 52‑card deck) that grants the same probability. The idea is that using the deck instead of dice further steeps a game in weird west ambiance.

trans-unit.source: When To Use Deck as D20
trans-unit.target: When To Use Deck as D20

trans-unit.source: Session: You could use the constructed “d20 deck” for part of a (or an entire) game session when playing in a High Noon at Midnight adventure or setting. For example, if a scenario asks characters to compete in an in‑world game of poker (such as in the adventure “Five Card Fiasco”), you could ask PCs to draw from the d20 deck instead of rolling dice, especially if you’ve opted for evoking poker with dice instead of actually playing poker in‑world.
trans-unit.target: Session: You could use the constructed “d20 deck” for part of a (or an entire) game session when playing in a High Noon at Midnight adventure or setting. For example, if a scenario asks characters to compete in an in‑world game of poker (such as in the adventure “Five Card Fiasco”), you could ask PCs to draw from the d20 deck instead of rolling dice, especially if you’ve opted for evoking poker with dice instead of actually playing poker in‑world.

trans-unit.source: Special Moment: Alternatively, you could keep the constructed d20 deck in reserve, then pull it out for the PCs to draw from once or twice in a session at a pivotal point or fun moment in the game. This does some of the same ambiance‑building work as the Full Session option, but also gives you more leeway to create a Loaded Deck.
trans-unit.target: Special Moment: Alternatively, you could keep the constructed d20 deck in reserve, then pull it out for the PCs to draw from once or twice in a session at a pivotal point or fun moment in the game. This does some of the same ambiance‑building work as the Full Session option, but also gives you more leeway to create a Loaded Deck.

trans-unit.source: Construct the D20 Deck
trans-unit.target: Construct the D20 Deck

trans-unit.source: Here’s how to construct a “d20 deck.”
trans-unit.target: Here’s how to construct a “d20 deck.”

trans-unit.source: Choose two suits, one red and one black—say, gears (diamonds) and eyes (spades).
trans-unit.target: Choose two suits, one red and one black—say, gears (diamonds) and eyes (spades).

trans-unit.source: Gather all the cards from each of your chosen suits from Ace to King, then discard the Jack, King, and Queen from each.
trans-unit.target: Gather all the cards from each of your chosen suits from Ace to King, then discard the Jack, King, and Queen from each.

trans-unit.source: Combine the two sets of ten cards—this is your d20 deck!
trans-unit.target: Combine the two sets of ten cards—this is your d20 deck!

trans-unit.source: Each card has an associated numerical value, as follows:
trans-unit.target: Each card has an associated numerical value, as follows:

trans-unit.target: Card Value
