trans-unit.target: Precious metals handled by/near target turn to lead (jumped a prospector’s claim)

trans-unit.source: Target is cursed with lycanthropy; regularly becomes a vicious werewolf (hunted for sport, let the wolf pelt rot)
trans-unit.target: Target is cursed with lycanthropy; regularly becomes a vicious werewolf (hunted for sport, let the wolf pelt rot)

trans-unit.source: Target loses every bet, every gamble, every wager (cheated a demon at cards)
trans-unit.target: Target loses every bet, every gamble, every wager (cheated a demon at cards)

trans-unit.source: Target’s flesh is constantly dripping a foul ordure, hindering pleasant social interaction by two steps (actions led to someone drowning in a cesspit)
trans-unit.target: Target’s flesh is constantly dripping a foul ordure, hindering pleasant social interaction by two steps (actions led to someone drowning in a cesspit)

trans-unit.source: Target’s attacks tend to ricochet; at least one attack rebounds on target per conflict (ricochet killed a bystander)
trans-unit.target: Target’s attacks tend to ricochet; at least one attack rebounds on target per conflict (ricochet killed a bystander)

trans-unit.source: Target grows a second head each night, which detaches on scorpion legs and attacks anyone (including target) nearby (killed an alchemist)
trans-unit.target: Target grows a second head each night, which detaches on scorpion legs and attacks anyone (including target) nearby (killed an alchemist)

trans-unit.source: Target is sometimes pulled into a dark dimension (left a companion to die in the dark)
trans-unit.target: Target is sometimes pulled into a dark dimension (left a companion to die in the dark)

trans-unit.source: Target wakes up after some ten-hour recovery rolls buried in a coffin within long range of where they went to sleep (actions led to someone being buried alive)
trans-unit.target: Target wakes up after some ten-hour recovery rolls buried in a coffin within long range of where they went to sleep (actions led to someone being buried alive)

trans-unit.source: Target exudes darkness, filling a short area around them; candles, torches, lanterns, and even electric lights only illuminate an immediate distance (blinded someone)
trans-unit.target: Target exudes darkness, filling a short area around them; candles, torches, lanterns, and even electric lights only illuminate an immediate distance (blinded someone)

trans-unit.source: *Head on scorpion legs: level 3; on failed Might defense roll, stinger deals an additional 3 Speed damage (ignores Armor)
trans-unit.target: *Head on scorpion legs: level 3; on failed Might defense roll, stinger deals an additional 3 Speed damage (ignores Armor)

trans-unit.source: Demonic bull: level 5; health 33; gores twice each round for 6 damage each; if killed, returns to life next midnight
trans-unit.target: Demonic bull: level 5; health 33; gores twice each round for 6 damage each; if killed, returns to life next midnight

trans-unit.source: Dark dimension: level 3; occupants take 3 Intellect damage (ignores Armor) each round until they can escape with an Intellect‑based roll as their action
trans-unit.target: Dark dimension: level 3; occupants take 3 Intellect damage (ignores Armor) each round until they can escape with an Intellect‑based roll as their action

trans-unit.source: SURIVAL
trans-unit.target: SURIVAL

trans-unit.source: Survival GM Intrusions
trans-unit.target: Survival GM Intrusions

trans-unit.source: PCs camp on an unmarked grave and a vengeful ghost attempts to possess a PC
trans-unit.target: PCs camp on an unmarked grave and a vengeful ghost attempts to possess a PC

trans-unit.source: The helpful stranger who offers to lead the PCs to safety turns out to be something sinister
trans-unit.target: The helpful stranger who offers to lead the PCs to safety turns out to be something sinister

trans-unit.source: The old fort the PCs find that seemed so hopeful turns out to be a chupacabra lair
trans-unit.target: The old fort the PCs find that seemed so hopeful turns out to be a chupacabra lair

trans-unit.source: A pack of dire coyotes begins howling in the night; they’ve caught the PCs’ scent
trans-unit.target: A pack of dire coyotes begins howling in the night; they’ve caught the PCs’ scent

trans-unit.source: Red mists, swarming insects, a freak cold snap, etc. hinder PCs’ foraging/trapping tasks by two steps
trans-unit.target: Red mists, swarming insects, a freak cold snap, etc. hinder PCs’ foraging/trapping tasks by two steps

trans-unit.source: Spores from strange fungus infect gathered food, causing PCs to fall into a disturbing sleep
trans-unit.target: Spores from strange fungus infect gathered food, causing PCs to fall into a disturbing sleep

trans-unit.source: Disturbing sleep: _level 5; PCs take 1 Intellect damage (ignores Armor) each minute asleep but can attempt an Intellect defense roll each minute to wake_
trans-unit.target: Disturbing sleep: _level 5; PCs take 1 Intellect damage (ignores Armor) each minute asleep but can attempt an Intellect defense roll each minute to wake_

trans-unit.source: Hunting, Trapping, and Finding Shelter
trans-unit.target: Hunting, Trapping, and Finding Shelter

trans-unit.source: Generally, characters must spend at least four hours of any given day foraging, hunting, and trapping, then succeed on a level 5 Intellect task. The task is eased for someone trained in identifying plants and creatures, navigation, or specifically in wilderness survival. On a success, enough food and water is obtained to sustain a group of five or six characters for one day.
trans-unit.target: Generally, characters must spend at least four hours of any given day foraging, hunting, and trapping, then succeed on a level 5 Intellect task. The task is eased for someone trained in identifying plants and creatures, navigation, or specifically in wilderness survival. On a success, enough food and water is obtained to sustain a group of five or six characters for one day.

trans-unit.source: A separate level 5 Intellect task is required to find shelter after about four hours of searching, though time spent hunting and trapping also counts toward keeping an eye out for suitable campsites and materials that a shelter can be made from.
trans-unit.target: A separate level 5 Intellect task is required to find shelter after about four hours of searching, though time spent hunting and trapping also counts toward keeping an eye out for suitable campsites and materials that a shelter can be made from.

trans-unit.source: Food and Water
trans-unit.target: Food and Water

trans-unit.source: Food is some combination of foraged plants and roots, and hunted and/or trapped game.
trans-unit.target: Food is some combination of foraged plants and roots, and hunted and/or trapped game.

trans-unit.source: Specific foraged edible plants could include ramps, prairie turnips, cactus pads, clover, sotol (a desert plant), mushrooms, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Specific foraged edible plants could include ramps, prairie turnips, cactus pads, clover, sotol (a desert plant), mushrooms, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Specific hunted and/or trapped game could include bison, jackrabbits, quail, prairie dogs, coyotes, and if especially desperate, one or more cursed beasts. Once found, the food is best if dressed and cooked, though especially desperate people can still gain the benefit of food if it’s not cooked.
trans-unit.target: Specific hunted and/or trapped game could include bison, jackrabbits, quail, prairie dogs, coyotes, and if especially desperate, one or more cursed beasts. Once found, the food is best if dressed and cooked, though especially desperate people can still gain the benefit of food if it’s not cooked.

trans-unit.source: Water is usually found in cricks, springs, or small lakes; collected in deep rock cavities or caves; or even collected from morning dew. Water should be boiled when possible—otherwise PCs risk catching dysentery (and similar diseases). Water that isn’t boiled doesn’t automatically mean PCs are exposed to the disease, but it’s common enough.
trans-unit.target: Water is usually found in cricks, springs, or small lakes; collected in deep rock cavities or caves; or even collected from morning dew. Water should be boiled when possible—otherwise PCs risk catching dysentery (and similar diseases). Water that isn’t boiled doesn’t automatically mean PCs are exposed to the disease, but it’s common enough.

trans-unit.source: Dysentery (level 4 disease): People exposed to dysentery come down with severe diarrhea and cramps on a failed Might defense roll. After several hours, all their tasks are hindered by two steps. Each day, an infected character must succeed on a Might defense roll or suffer 4 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor). If a target succeeds on three Might defense rolls, they get better.
trans-unit.target: Dysentery (level 4 disease): People exposed to dysentery come down with severe diarrhea and cramps on a failed Might defense roll. After several hours, all their tasks are hindered by two steps. Each day, an infected character must succeed on a Might defense roll or suffer 4 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor). If a target succeeds on three Might defense rolls, they get better.

trans-unit.source: Starvation: Generally, a PC can survive without food for about ten days to several weeks. In game terms, PCs who go without food take 3 points of ambient damage each day. On any day a PC has taken starvation damage, their tasks are hindered (even if the character makes a recovery roll to regain lost Pool points). In addition, after seven days without food, a starving character must make a level 5 Might defense roll each day that follows. On a failed roll, the character descends one step on the damage track.
trans-unit.target: Starvation: Generally, a PC can survive without food for about ten days to several weeks. In game terms, PCs who go without food take 3 points of ambient damage each day. On any day a PC has taken starvation damage, their tasks are hindered (even if the character makes a recovery roll to regain lost Pool points). In addition, after seven days without food, a starving character must make a level 5 Might defense roll each day that follows. On a failed roll, the character descends one step on the damage track.

trans-unit.source: Shelter
trans-unit.target: Shelter

trans-unit.source: Depending on the area, shelter could be obtained by digging into hillsides, finding caves, pulling up sod to use as insulation, collecting deadfall or cutting saplings to create a tent‑like structure (made all the better if hide from slaughtered game is available), digging a trench or cave in a snow bank, and if nothing else serves, at least finding some shade at high noon.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the area, shelter could be obtained by digging into hillsides, finding caves, pulling up sod to use as insulation, collecting deadfall or cutting saplings to create a tent‑like structure (made all the better if hide from slaughtered game is available), digging a trench or cave in a snow bank, and if nothing else serves, at least finding some shade at high noon.

trans-unit.source: TALL TALES
trans-unit.target: TALL TALES

trans-unit.source: Growing Reputation
trans-unit.target: Growing Reputation

trans-unit.source: Beginning at tier 3 or later, PCs have been active in the setting long enough that tall tales start being told about the group. That’s especially true if the characters have interacted with NPCs who know a little about the characters and their exploits.
trans-unit.target: Beginning at tier 3 or later, PCs have been active in the setting long enough that tall tales start being told about the group. That’s especially true if the characters have interacted with NPCs who know a little about the characters and their exploits.

trans-unit.source: However, a tall tale grows in the telling. Whatever exploit is being recounted should include an exaggeration or two, if not at least one outright fabrication.
trans-unit.target: However, a tall tale grows in the telling. Whatever exploit is being recounted should include an exaggeration or two, if not at least one outright fabrication.

trans-unit.source: General examples of tall tales include the following, but tall tales that include the PCs should be customized to their particular experience, and not all tall tales put the subject in a positive light (though many do).
trans-unit.target: General examples of tall tales include the following, but tall tales that include the PCs should be customized to their particular experience, and not all tall tales put the subject in a positive light (though many do).

trans-unit.source: Tall Tale
trans-unit.target: Tall Tale

trans-unit.source: Raised by magical winds, the characters once roped a tornado to avert disaster.
trans-unit.target: Raised by magical winds, the characters once roped a tornado to avert disaster.

trans-unit.source: The characters are able to grow to giant stature, such that lakes form in their footprints.
trans-unit.target: The characters are able to grow to giant stature, such that lakes form in their footprints.

trans-unit.source: Hard‑hearted survivalists, the characters avoided starvation by eating everyone else in town.
trans-unit.target: Hard‑hearted survivalists, the characters avoided starvation by eating everyone else in town.

trans-unit.source: Able to invoke the elements, the characters mowed down a forest by blowing on it.
trans-unit.target: Able to invoke the elements, the characters mowed down a forest by blowing on it.

trans-unit.source: Raised by storms, the characters ride cyclones and dust devils instead of horses.
trans-unit.target: Raised by storms, the characters ride cyclones and dust devils instead of horses.

trans-unit.source: Keen‑eyed as the sun, the characters can shoot a bull between the eyes from miles away.
trans-unit.target: Keen‑eyed as the sun, the characters can shoot a bull between the eyes from miles away.

trans-unit.source: Stronger than iron, the characters chewed through the steel bars to escape jail.
trans-unit.target: Stronger than iron, the characters chewed through the steel bars to escape jail.

trans-unit.source: Able to outsmart privation, the characters wrung water from a wet rock.
trans-unit.target: Able to outsmart privation, the characters wrung water from a wet rock.

trans-unit.source: Loud as thunder, the characters once killed an outlaw with their booming voices alone.
trans-unit.target: Loud as thunder, the characters once killed an outlaw with their booming voices alone.

trans-unit.source: Heartless and cruel, the characters once drowned an entire mining camp just for sport.
trans-unit.target: Heartless and cruel, the characters once drowned an entire mining camp just for sport.

trans-unit.source: Tall Tale Determination
trans-unit.target: Tall Tale Determination

trans-unit.source: PCs first learn they’re featured in at least one tall tale because they overhear someone in a saloon, on a train, or in some other social gathering telling a story that includes elements they personally remember.
trans-unit.target: PCs first learn they’re featured in at least one tall tale because they overhear someone in a saloon, on a train, or in some other social gathering telling a story that includes elements they personally remember.

trans-unit.source: Tall tales may spring up about the PCs a couple of different ways.
trans-unit.target: Tall tales may spring up about the PCs a couple of different ways.

trans-unit.source: GM Fiat: Based on the actions of PCs who are at least tier 3, you craft a tall tale and set it loose in the campaign.
trans-unit.target: GM Fiat: Based on the actions of PCs who are at least tier 3, you craft a tall tale and set it loose in the campaign.

trans-unit.source: Player Intrusion: A PC of at least tier 3 may gain the benefits of a tall tale for one particular encounter if they use a player intrusion; however, this tall tale does not catch on—it’s later recognized as utterly untrue or otherwise gutters out.
trans-unit.target: Player Intrusion: A PC of at least tier 3 may gain the benefits of a tall tale for one particular encounter if they use a player intrusion; however, this tall tale does not catch on—it’s later recognized as utterly untrue or otherwise gutters out.

trans-unit.source: Long-Term Benefit: A PC of at least tier 3 may spend 3 XP to gain a long-term benefit in the form of a tall tale about their character. The rest of the PCs aren’t featured in this tall tale unless they all do the same.
trans-unit.target: Long-Term Benefit: A PC of at least tier 3 may spend 3 XP to gain a long-term benefit in the form of a tall tale about their character. The rest of the PCs aren’t featured in this tall tale unless they all do the same.

trans-unit.source: Benefits of Tall Tales
trans-unit.target: Benefits of Tall Tales

trans-unit.source: Even if folks don’t fully believe the tall tales told about the PCs, the mere fact that the stories persist gives the PCs the following benefits.
trans-unit.target: Even if folks don’t fully believe the tall tales told about the PCs, the mere fact that the stories persist gives the PCs the following benefits.

trans-unit.source: Reputation: When PCs are first recognized by NPCs familiar with the tall tale (and most are, unless they’re isolated), PCs’ very first interaction task (whether positive or negative) is eased by three steps. Once the shock of recognizing the PCs wears off a round later, future interaction tasks with the same NPCs are eased by one step.
trans-unit.target: Reputation: When PCs are first recognized by NPCs familiar with the tall tale (and most are, unless they’re isolated), PCs’ very first interaction task (whether positive or negative) is eased by three steps. Once the shock of recognizing the PCs wears off a round later, future interaction tasks with the same NPCs are eased by one step.

trans-unit.source: Tall Tale Perks: When PCs are recognized, people do favors for the characters. For instance, they can be seated at any card game, see the mayor at any hour, secure an invitation to any show or gathering, reserve a seat on any train or coach, throw together a posse of enthusiastic folks, or get into any saloon, joy house, or club, no matter how exclusive.
trans-unit.target: Tall Tale Perks: When PCs are recognized, people do favors for the characters. For instance, they can be seated at any card game, see the mayor at any hour, secure an invitation to any show or gathering, reserve a seat on any train or coach, throw together a posse of enthusiastic folks, or get into any saloon, joy house, or club, no matter how exclusive.

trans-unit.source: *Posses gathered by celebrity PCs using Tall Tale Perks number about ten to fifteen level 2 NPCs and last for about a day or until the posse accomplishes the stated goal, whichever comes sooner.
trans-unit.target: *Posses gathered by celebrity PCs using Tall Tale Perks number about ten to fifteen level 2 NPCs and last for about a day or until the posse accomplishes the stated goal, whichever comes sooner.

trans-unit.source: Retelling the Tale: If the PCs wish, they can tell the tall tale from their own perspective. Whether or not they stick closer to the truth or invent even more outrageous events is up to them. Either way, for as long as at least one PC is telling the story and listeners are not harmed, they keep the attention of all level 2 or lower NPCs who can hear them. If they have the Enthrall ability, they can captivate level 3 or lower NPCs. And if they have the Captivate With Starshine ability, they can captivate level 4 or lower NPCs.
trans-unit.target: Retelling the Tale: If the PCs wish, they can tell the tall tale from their own perspective. Whether or not they stick closer to the truth or invent even more outrageous events is up to them. Either way, for as long as at least one PC is telling the story and listeners are not harmed, they keep the attention of all level 2 or lower NPCs who can hear them. If they have the Enthrall ability, they can captivate level 3 or lower NPCs. And if they have the Captivate With Starshine ability, they can captivate level 4 or lower NPCs.

trans-unit.source: Downsides of Tall Tales
trans-unit.target: Downsides of Tall Tales

trans-unit.source: Introduce any of the following situations as group (or individual) GM intrusions.
trans-unit.target: Introduce any of the following situations as group (or individual) GM intrusions.

trans-unit.source: Consequence of Tall Tale Acclaim
trans-unit.target: Consequence of Tall Tale Acclaim

trans-unit.source: A newspaper exposé is published about the PCs’ exploits, painting them in an unflattering light.
trans-unit.target: A newspaper exposé is published about the PCs’ exploits, painting them in an unflattering light.

trans-unit.source: A 10‑foot (3 m) tall humanoid covered in hair as thick as fur—a wild one—begins stalking PCs.
trans-unit.target: A 10‑foot (3 m) tall humanoid covered in hair as thick as fur—a wild one—begins stalking PCs.

trans-unit.source: Misanthropes arrive and begin making all sorts of hateful comments about the PCs.
trans-unit.target: Misanthropes arrive and begin making all sorts of hateful comments about the PCs.

trans-unit.source: Someone tells an alternate tall tale painting PCs as ruthless outlaws; folks begin to shun PCs.
trans-unit.target: Someone tells an alternate tall tale painting PCs as ruthless outlaws; folks begin to shun PCs.

trans-unit.source: Relatives of one or more PCs come under scrutiny and harassment by fame chasers.
trans-unit.target: Relatives of one or more PCs come under scrutiny and harassment by fame chasers.

trans-unit.source: Federal marshals attempt to press‑gang PCs into service to face a horrific threat.
trans-unit.target: Federal marshals attempt to press‑gang PCs into service to face a horrific threat.

trans-unit.source: A hex gunner decides the PCs aren’t all that and challenges one character to a showdown.
trans-unit.target: A hex gunner decides the PCs aren’t all that and challenges one character to a showdown.

trans-unit.source: A former friend and/or ally no longer wants anything to do with the PCs.
trans-unit.target: A former friend and/or ally no longer wants anything to do with the PCs.

trans-unit.source: Thieves try to claim all the riches they believe the PCs have for themselves.
trans-unit.target: Thieves try to claim all the riches they believe the PCs have for themselves.

trans-unit.source: Fame chasers break in on the PCs during important negotiations.
trans-unit.target: Fame chasers break in on the PCs during important negotiations.

trans-unit.source: Wild one: _level 5, wilderness and magical lore as level 7; health 24; Armor 1; batters foes twice as their action_
trans-unit.target: Wild one: _level 5, wilderness and magical lore as level 7; health 24; Armor 1; batters foes twice as their action_

trans-unit.source: PARANORMAL VICES OF THE WEIRD WEST
trans-unit.target: PARANORMAL VICES OF THE WEIRD WEST

trans-unit.source: Fair warning, pardner—if you ain’t careful, grifters, drunkards, and rabble‑rousers will drag you to Perdition. ’Cept some folks never seem to suffer from their own impure actions—and not even they really know why.
trans-unit.target: Fair warning, pardner—if you ain’t careful, grifters, drunkards, and rabble‑rousers will drag you to Perdition. ’Cept some folks never seem to suffer from their own impure actions—and not even they really know why.

trans-unit.source: A vice is behavior that many consider immoral or wicked. In some times and places, one person’s vice is another’s completely healthy pastime, if not taken to an extreme. But taking it to the extreme is what vices in the weird west rely on to empower them.
trans-unit.target: A vice is behavior that many consider immoral or wicked. In some times and places, one person’s vice is another’s completely healthy pastime, if not taken to an extreme. But taking it to the extreme is what vices in the weird west rely on to empower them.

trans-unit.source: Characters that lean into vice in a weird west setting gain advantages above and beyond mere pleasure in the pursuit of their debauchery. One of those advantages is seeming immunity from the downsides such degeneracy eventually exacts on longtime indulgers. At least, they evade consequences for a lot longer than seems possible, until the force the PCs have unintentionally connected themselves to decides otherwise.
trans-unit.target: Characters that lean into vice in a weird west setting gain advantages above and beyond mere pleasure in the pursuit of their debauchery. One of those advantages is seeming immunity from the downsides such degeneracy eventually exacts on longtime indulgers. At least, they evade consequences for a lot longer than seems possible, until the force the PCs have unintentionally connected themselves to decides otherwise.

trans-unit.source: NPCs With Paranormal Vices: It could turn out that PC activity is too “pure” to warrant a mystical connection to invisible forces of oblivion, entropy, lies, and so on. In that case, the PCs might well encounter the rare NPC that always at least breaks even in poker (a Cardsharp), can drink anyone under the table and only seem steadier and more unflinching (an Inebriate), or can talk someone else out of their hat and spurs and be thanked for it (a Shyster). (In effect, the NPC has one or more supernatural vice abilities; determining how they work from an NPC point of view may require some creative interpretation on your part as the GM.)
trans-unit.target: NPCs With Paranormal Vices: It could turn out that PC activity is too “pure” to warrant a mystical connection to invisible forces of oblivion, entropy, lies, and so on. In that case, the PCs might well encounter the rare NPC that always at least breaks even in poker (a Cardsharp), can drink anyone under the table and only seem steadier and more unflinching (an Inebriate), or can talk someone else out of their hat and spurs and be thanked for it (a Shyster). (In effect, the NPC has one or more supernatural vice abilities; determining how they work from an NPC point of view may require some creative interpretation on your part as the GM.)

trans-unit.source: Paranormal Vice Origins
trans-unit.target: Paranormal Vice Origins

trans-unit.source: How an indulged vice imbues the devotee with inhuman power is not well understood, even by the few alchemists aware of the phenomenon. The current hypothesis is that indulging a vice acts like a ritual of worship that connects someone with a primordial avatar or power. These mysterious mystic forces lie on the edges of existence, normally hidden in the deeps of time.
trans-unit.target: How an indulged vice imbues the devotee with inhuman power is not well understood, even by the few alchemists aware of the phenomenon. The current hypothesis is that indulging a vice acts like a ritual of worship that connects someone with a primordial avatar or power. These mysterious mystic forces lie on the edges of existence, normally hidden in the deeps of time.

trans-unit.source: Developing a Paranormal Vice
trans-unit.target: Developing a Paranormal Vice

trans-unit.source: A PC might develop a paranormal vice in a manner similar to one of the ways a character can become cursed—as a result of poor choices. In this case, ongoing dedication to drinking, gambling, or swindling might forge a linkage to an invisible force related to the individual activity. A force that encourages that vice, knowing that with continued use, the pinhole connection it’s forged to the world will grow.
trans-unit.target: A PC might develop a paranormal vice in a manner similar to one of the ways a character can become cursed—as a result of poor choices. In this case, ongoing dedication to drinking, gambling, or swindling might forge a linkage to an invisible force related to the individual activity. A force that encourages that vice, knowing that with continued use, the pinhole connection it’s forged to the world will grow.

trans-unit.source: When a character gains a vice with ties to a primordial power source, the character knows it. The revelation comes to them as a sort of waking dream where they see a version of themself cloaked in flame, shadow, ice, blades, or some other dramatic energy, standing ascendent while engaging in their vice. It feels like a promise of future glory. And with that promise, the character gains some understanding about how their paranormal vice functions.
trans-unit.target: When a character gains a vice with ties to a primordial power source, the character knows it. The revelation comes to them as a sort of waking dream where they see a version of themself cloaked in flame, shadow, ice, blades, or some other dramatic energy, standing ascendent while engaging in their vice. It feels like a promise of future glory. And with that promise, the character gains some understanding about how their paranormal vice functions.

trans-unit.source: Mechanics of a Paranormal Vice
trans-unit.target: Mechanics of a Paranormal Vice

trans-unit.source: There are positives and negatives associated with a paranormal vice.
trans-unit.target: There are positives and negatives associated with a paranormal vice.

trans-unit.source: Paranormal Abilities: A character with a paranormal vice gains additional abilities via their connection to a primordial power, as noted under each vice. Make just a couple of the indicated abilities available to the character initially, but give them one more each time they increase their connection with a low connection roll.
trans-unit.target: Paranormal Abilities: A character with a paranormal vice gains additional abilities via their connection to a primordial power, as noted under each vice. Make just a couple of the indicated abilities available to the character initially, but give them one more each time they increase their connection with a low connection roll.

trans-unit.source: Repercussions From a Connection: Over time, a connection grows between a character’s paranormal vice and the mysterious force behind it. Repercussions sometimes manifest depending on the character’s connection roll.
trans-unit.target: Repercussions From a Connection: Over time, a connection grows between a character’s paranormal vice and the mysterious force behind it. Repercussions sometimes manifest depending on the character’s connection roll.

trans-unit.source: Connection Roll: Each time a character with a paranormal vice uses one of their abilities, they must make 1d10 connection roll. On a connection roll of 1, the connection range increases by 1, and the character suffers a repercussion (see hereafter). For instance, if a character rolls a 1, the next time they make a connection roll, a connection occurs on a roll of 1–2. If a connection is made, the associated repercussion occurs immediately (but the character also gains the benefit of the ability that triggered it during the same period, if applicable).
trans-unit.target: Connection Roll: Each time a character with a paranormal vice uses one of their abilities, they must make 1d10 connection roll. On a connection roll of 1, the connection range increases by 1, and the character suffers a repercussion (see hereafter). For instance, if a character rolls a 1, the next time they make a connection roll, a connection occurs on a roll of 1–2. If a connection is made, the associated repercussion occurs immediately (but the character also gains the benefit of the ability that triggered it during the same period, if applicable).

trans-unit.source: If the connection range reaches 1–6, the character suffers the final repercussion.
trans-unit.target: If the connection range reaches 1–6, the character suffers the final repercussion.

trans-unit.source: Repercussions and final repercussions are noted under each paranormal vice.
trans-unit.target: Repercussions and final repercussions are noted under each paranormal vice.

trans-unit.source: DRINKING
trans-unit.target: DRINKING

trans-unit.source: A person with this vice is called an Inebriate.
trans-unit.target: A person with this vice is called an Inebriate.

trans-unit.source: Libations are celebrations in a glass for some, fortitude and confidence for others, or both at once. Best not to be stingy with the liquor! For an Inebriate, alcohol means transcending everyday existence. Graced by the spirits consumed, inhibitions dissolve and the Inebriate is set adrift on a sea of euphoria—or, for some, unstoppable rage.
trans-unit.target: Libations are celebrations in a glass for some, fortitude and confidence for others, or both at once. Best not to be stingy with the liquor! For an Inebriate, alcohol means transcending everyday existence. Graced by the spirits consumed, inhibitions dissolve and the Inebriate is set adrift on a sea of euphoria—or, for some, unstoppable rage.

trans-unit.source: _Related Vices:_ A character who overindulges in some other drug—like laudanum, opium, tobacco, and patent medicines like “Doctor Good” (derived from cocaine, opium, and alcohol)—could gain a paranormal vice with the same characteristics as an Inebriate.
trans-unit.target: _Related Vices:_ A character who overindulges in some other drug—like laudanum, opium, tobacco, and patent medicines like “Doctor Good” (derived from cocaine, opium, and alcohol)—could gain a paranormal vice with the same characteristics as an Inebriate.

trans-unit.source: Ill Effects of Drinking
trans-unit.target: Ill Effects of Drinking

trans-unit.source: Someone who drinks too much in the short term descends one or more steps on the intoxication track. (Someone who drinks too much in the longer term risks alcoholism, liver disease, cancer, and an early death.)
trans-unit.target: Someone who drinks too much in the short term descends one or more steps on the intoxication track. (Someone who drinks too much in the longer term risks alcoholism, liver disease, cancer, and an early death.)

trans-unit.source: **Intoxication Track** The intoxication track has five states: sober, tipsy, inebriated, passed out, and hungover.
trans-unit.target: **Intoxication Track** The intoxication track has five states: sober, tipsy, inebriated, passed out, and hungover.

trans-unit.source: Each time a character has more than one drink in an hour, they must succeed on a Might defense roll. On a failed roll, they descend a step on the track (except as noted). The difficulty of the Might defense roll starts at 3, increasing by 1 for each additional drink taken during the same hour, or while the character is down one or more steps on the intoxication track.
trans-unit.target: Each time a character has more than one drink in an hour, they must succeed on a Might defense roll. On a failed roll, they descend a step on the track (except as noted). The difficulty of the Might defense roll starts at 3, increasing by 1 for each additional drink taken during the same hour, or while the character is down one or more steps on the intoxication track.

trans-unit.source: Sober is the normal state for characters who haven’t been drinking and who aren’t hungover.
trans-unit.target: Sober is the normal state for characters who haven’t been drinking and who aren’t hungover.

trans-unit.source: Tipsy characters are those who’ve started to feel one or two drinks. Tipsy characters can apply a free level of Effort to positive social interaction tasks, but must spend 1 extra point per level of Effort applied to any other task. For example, applying one level of Effort costs 4 points instead of 3, and applying two levels of Effort costs 7 points instead of 5.
trans-unit.target: Tipsy characters are those who’ve started to feel one or two drinks. Tipsy characters can apply a free level of Effort to positive social interaction tasks, but must spend 1 extra point per level of Effort applied to any other task. For example, applying one level of Effort costs 4 points instead of 3, and applying two levels of Effort costs 7 points instead of 5.

trans-unit.source: If a tipsy character has no more drinks, they return to sober in about an hour and probably won’t become hungover.
trans-unit.target: If a tipsy character has no more drinks, they return to sober in about an hour and probably won’t become hungover.

trans-unit.source: Inebriated characters’ tasks are hindered by two steps. Inebriated characters must spend 1 extra point per level of Effort applied to any task.
trans-unit.target: Inebriated characters’ tasks are hindered by two steps. Inebriated characters must spend 1 extra point per level of Effort applied to any task.

trans-unit.source: The GM should also intrude on an inebriated character at least once to afflict them with the accidents that beset drunks, ranging from something as simple as an accidental fall onto their face, the character finding themself throwing a drunken tantrum over some perceived (but not actual) slight, or blacking out and waking up hours later in the town jail.
trans-unit.target: The GM should also intrude on an inebriated character at least once to afflict them with the accidents that beset drunks, ranging from something as simple as an accidental fall onto their face, the character finding themself throwing a drunken tantrum over some perceived (but not actual) slight, or blacking out and waking up hours later in the town jail.

trans-unit.source: If an inebriated character has no more drinks, they return to sober in about three hours and must succeed on a Might defense roll against a difficulty of 3 + the number of drinks consumed. On a failure, the character instead moves to the hungover step on the track.
trans-unit.target: If an inebriated character has no more drinks, they return to sober in about three hours and must succeed on a Might defense roll against a difficulty of 3 + the number of drinks consumed. On a failure, the character instead moves to the hungover step on the track.

trans-unit.source: Passed out means a character is unconscious, or as good as.
trans-unit.target: Passed out means a character is unconscious, or as good as.

trans-unit.source: A passed-out character won’t revive on their own for four to eight hours. When they do revive, they descend the track to hungover. If roused earlier by shaking and/or slapping (or by taking damage), the character wakes but returns to inebriated status.
trans-unit.target: A passed-out character won’t revive on their own for four to eight hours. When they do revive, they descend the track to hungover. If roused earlier by shaking and/or slapping (or by taking damage), the character wakes but returns to inebriated status.

trans-unit.source: Characters who passed out don’t remember what happened while they were inebriated, or if they do, only as unconnected flashes.
trans-unit.target: Characters who passed out don’t remember what happened while they were inebriated, or if they do, only as unconnected flashes.

trans-unit.source: Hungover characters feel horrible and their tasks are hindered. A hangover lasts six to twelve hours, or until a character has “hair of the dog” (at least one drink).
trans-unit.target: Hungover characters feel horrible and their tasks are hindered. A hangover lasts six to twelve hours, or until a character has “hair of the dog” (at least one drink).

trans-unit.source: Inebriate Abilities
trans-unit.target: Inebriate Abilities

trans-unit.source: An Inebriate gains the following abilities, drawn from some inscrutable, invisible source.
trans-unit.target: An Inebriate gains the following abilities, drawn from some inscrutable, invisible source.

trans-unit.source: Make just a couple of the indicated abilities available to the character initially, but give them one more each time they increase their connection with a low connection roll.
trans-unit.target: Make just a couple of the indicated abilities available to the character initially, but give them one more each time they increase their connection with a low connection roll.

trans-unit.source: Triggering Inebriate Abilities: Some Inebriate abilities require the Inebriate to throw back a drink (as part of the same action, or as a separate action, as noted) to gain the effect, which means the character needs to have access to alcohol. Each time an ability is used (including enablers), the Inebriate must roll 1d10 to check for a connection.
trans-unit.target: Triggering Inebriate Abilities: Some Inebriate abilities require the Inebriate to throw back a drink (as part of the same action, or as a separate action, as noted) to gain the effect, which means the character needs to have access to alcohol. Each time an ability is used (including enablers), the Inebriate must roll 1d10 to check for a connection.

trans-unit.source: Deadeye: For ten minutes, the Inebriate eases ranged attacks. Drink (separate action) to activate.
trans-unit.target: Deadeye: For ten minutes, the Inebriate eases ranged attacks. Drink (separate action) to activate.

trans-unit.source: Hair-Trigger Reflexes: The Inebriate adds a free level of Effort to initiative tasks. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Hair-Trigger Reflexes: The Inebriate adds a free level of Effort to initiative tasks. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Iron Liver: When they wish, an Inebriate doesn’t suffer ill effects of alcohol, including descending steps on the intoxication track (see boxed text). Instead, they can put down shot after shot of whiskey or other drink with no apparent effect, other than being able to access the abilities noted. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Iron Liver: When they wish, an Inebriate doesn’t suffer ill effects of alcohol, including descending steps on the intoxication track (see boxed text). Instead, they can put down shot after shot of whiskey or other drink with no apparent effect, other than being able to access the abilities noted. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Mean Drunk: For one minute, the Inebriate’s ranged attacks deal 1 additional point of damage. Drink (part of same action) to activate.
trans-unit.target: Mean Drunk: For one minute, the Inebriate’s ranged attacks deal 1 additional point of damage. Drink (part of same action) to activate.

trans-unit.source: Unflinching: For ten minutes, the Inebriate gains +1 to Armor and eases Might defense rolls by two steps. For the same period, the Inebriate gains one extra step on the damage track called hurt, which is effectively the same as hale but a bit rougher looking. Drink (separate action) to activate.
trans-unit.target: Unflinching: For ten minutes, the Inebriate gains +1 to Armor and eases Might defense rolls by two steps. For the same period, the Inebriate gains one extra step on the damage track called hurt, which is effectively the same as hale but a bit rougher looking. Drink (separate action) to activate.

trans-unit.source: Inebriate Repercussions
trans-unit.target: Inebriate Repercussions

trans-unit.source: An Inebriate faces the following repercussions each time they roll a 1 (or higher, if previously triggered) on a connection roll. The repercussions flow from the same inhuman powers granting them their abilities. Each repercussion also increases the connection range by 1.
trans-unit.target: An Inebriate faces the following repercussions each time they roll a 1 (or higher, if previously triggered) on a connection roll. The repercussions flow from the same inhuman powers granting them their abilities. Each repercussion also increases the connection range by 1.

trans-unit.source: d6
trans-unit.target: d6

trans-unit.source: Inebriate Repercussions
trans-unit.target: Inebriate Repercussions

trans-unit.source: Blind in One Eye. The character loses vision from one eye for one hour. During this period, a burning, alien eye looks out from the character’s eye socket instead of their own, and their sight‑based tasks are hindered. The alien eye has Armor 10 and rarely blinks.
trans-unit.target: Blind in One Eye. The character loses vision from one eye for one hour. During this period, a burning, alien eye looks out from the character’s eye socket instead of their own, and their sight‑based tasks are hindered. The alien eye has Armor 10 and rarely blinks.

trans-unit.source: a
trans-unit.target: a

trans-unit.source: Liquor Purge. All the alcohol the character carries or touches for the next hour turns to dust—the character can’t benefit from Inebriate abilities for that hour. During that same hour, a penumbra (a shadow’s edge) shrouds the character so they seem weirdly dim, as if standing half in shadow even in bright light.
trans-unit.target: Liquor Purge. All the alcohol the character carries or touches for the next hour turns to dust—the character can’t benefit from Inebriate abilities for that hour. During that same hour, a penumbra (a shadow’s edge) shrouds the character so they seem weirdly dim, as if standing half in shadow even in bright light.

trans-unit.source: Infectious Intoxication. A nearby ally descends one step on the intoxication track. While the ally remains intoxicated, the character can’t look at them or say their name.
trans-unit.target: Infectious Intoxication. A nearby ally descends one step on the intoxication track. While the ally remains intoxicated, the character can’t look at them or say their name.

trans-unit.source: Worm From the Bottle. The character loses the ability to speak for ten minutes. Instead, an echoing voice that sounds like dark liquid rushing down a waterfall laughs and titters, sometimes threatening others, other times launching into obscenity‑laden tirades.
trans-unit.target: Worm From the Bottle. The character loses the ability to speak for ten minutes. Instead, an echoing voice that sounds like dark liquid rushing down a waterfall laughs and titters, sometimes threatening others, other times launching into obscenity‑laden tirades.

trans-unit.source: Rampage. A drunken rage overtakes the character, during which time their entire face seems to be replaced by an alien, inhuman mask. While enraged, the character must attack the closest creature in short range each round (whether ally, foe, or a stranger), until they can succeed on a difficulty 5 Intellect defense roll to end the effect.
trans-unit.target: Rampage. A drunken rage overtakes the character, during which time their entire face seems to be replaced by an alien, inhuman mask. While enraged, the character must attack the closest creature in short range each round (whether ally, foe, or a stranger), until they can succeed on a difficulty 5 Intellect defense roll to end the effect.

trans-unit.source: Retching Summons. Character upchucks a horrific quantity of gelatinous goo that animates as an insidious thing (a horrifying mass of writhing, slapping, undulating tentacles twice the size of a person) that attacks everyone.
trans-unit.target: Retching Summons. Character upchucks a horrific quantity of gelatinous goo that animates as an insidious thing (a horrifying mass of writhing, slapping, undulating tentacles twice the size of a person) that attacks everyone.

trans-unit.source: Final
trans-unit.target: Final

trans-unit.source: Character vanishes, leaving behind clothing and possessions sopping wet with rancid whiskey. Depending on the campaigning or setting, this summons an avatar of oblivion into the physical world—whatever that means for your game.
trans-unit.target: Character vanishes, leaving behind clothing and possessions sopping wet with rancid whiskey. Depending on the campaigning or setting, this summons an avatar of oblivion into the physical world—whatever that means for your game.

trans-unit.source: *Insidious thing: level 5; health 18; attacks with toothed tentacles; where damaged, target’s skin is discolored for several weeks
trans-unit.target: *Insidious thing: level 5; health 18; attacks with toothed tentacles; where damaged, target’s skin is discolored for several weeks

trans-unit.source: GAMBLING
trans-unit.target: GAMBLING

trans-unit.source: A person with this vice is called a Cardsharp.
trans-unit.target: A person with this vice is called a Cardsharp.

trans-unit.source: The promise of untold riches lies beyond the next card flip, dice roll, or spin of the wheel. Why sleep when one could be playing a game with a huge pot? For a Cardsharp, cards are weapons and dice are life. The whims of fate are nothing against their seemingly infallible luck. As stakes rise and tension mounts, a Cardsharp sees their opponents stripped bare, their true selves revealed as they gamble all their wealth away.
trans-unit.target: The promise of untold riches lies beyond the next card flip, dice roll, or spin of the wheel. Why sleep when one could be playing a game with a huge pot? For a Cardsharp, cards are weapons and dice are life. The whims of fate are nothing against their seemingly infallible luck. As stakes rise and tension mounts, a Cardsharp sees their opponents stripped bare, their true selves revealed as they gamble all their wealth away.

trans-unit.source: _Related Vices:_ Cardsharps are usually cardplayers (or dice players). But anyone who bets on the outcome of some event, such as stagecoach races, showdowns, or even flips of a coin might do it often enough to connect to the otherworldly and gain a paranormal vice.
trans-unit.target: _Related Vices:_ Cardsharps are usually cardplayers (or dice players). But anyone who bets on the outcome of some event, such as stagecoach races, showdowns, or even flips of a coin might do it often enough to connect to the otherworldly and gain a paranormal vice.

trans-unit.source: Cardsharp Abilities
trans-unit.target: Cardsharp Abilities

trans-unit.source: A Cardsharp gains the following abilities, drawn from some inscrutable, invisible source.
trans-unit.target: A Cardsharp gains the following abilities, drawn from some inscrutable, invisible source.

trans-unit.source: Make just a couple of the indicated abilities available to the character initially, but give them one more each time they increase their connection with a low connection roll.
trans-unit.target: Make just a couple of the indicated abilities available to the character initially, but give them one more each time they increase their connection with a low connection roll.

trans-unit.source: Triggering Cardsharp Abilities: Some Cardsharp abilities require the Cardsharp to flip a coin, card, or die (as part of the same action, or a separate action, as noted) to gain the effect. Each time an ability is used (including enablers), the Cardsharp must roll 1d10 to check for a connection.
trans-unit.target: Triggering Cardsharp Abilities: Some Cardsharp abilities require the Cardsharp to flip a coin, card, or die (as part of the same action, or a separate action, as noted) to gain the effect. Each time an ability is used (including enablers), the Cardsharp must roll 1d10 to check for a connection.

trans-unit.source: Playing Real Poker: If a real game of poker is being played around the table to evoke a game of poker being played in‑world, a Cardsharp player may accrue the same benefits as a player whose character is skilled in poker: the player should gain the benefit described under Specialized in Poker. After each hand the benefit is gained, a connection roll must be made.
trans-unit.target: Playing Real Poker: If a real game of poker is being played around the table to evoke a game of poker being played in‑world, a Cardsharp player may accrue the same benefits as a player whose character is skilled in poker: the player should gain the benefit described under Specialized in Poker. After each hand the benefit is gained, a connection roll must be made.

trans-unit.source: If the Cardsharp has Uncanny Luck or a similar ability in addition to Cardsharp’s Luck, it’s the Cardsharp’s choice (no roll required) whether they get a minor effect, a major effect, or a free activation of one of their Tier One–3 focus abilities.
trans-unit.target: If the Cardsharp has Uncanny Luck or a similar ability in addition to Cardsharp’s Luck, it’s the Cardsharp’s choice (no roll required) whether they get a minor effect, a major effect, or a free activation of one of their Tier One–3 focus abilities.

trans-unit.source: A PC that is already specialized in poker and is a Cardsharp gains three cards instead of two with each new hand.
trans-unit.target: A PC that is already specialized in poker and is a Cardsharp gains three cards instead of two with each new hand.

trans-unit.source: Breaking Even: When they wish, a Cardsharp doesn’t walk away from a game or bet having lost any money. They may not have any winnings, either (especially if they didn’t use their Cardsharp abilities), but at least they’re not out any money. The specific mechanism of how this happens varies by game and circumstance, but somehow, the invisible force associated with the Cardsharp tweaks the situation so the Cardsharp breaks even. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Breaking Even: When they wish, a Cardsharp doesn’t walk away from a game or bet having lost any money. They may not have any winnings, either (especially if they didn’t use their Cardsharp abilities), but at least they’re not out any money. The specific mechanism of how this happens varies by game and circumstance, but somehow, the invisible force associated with the Cardsharp tweaks the situation so the Cardsharp breaks even. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Cardsharp’s Luck: When the Cardsharp rolls for a task and succeeds, they roll again. If the second number rolled is higher than the first, they get a minor effect. If they roll the same number again, they get a major effect. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Cardsharp’s Luck: When the Cardsharp rolls for a task and succeeds, they roll again. If the second number rolled is higher than the first, they get a minor effect. If they roll the same number again, they get a major effect. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Deck to Hand: The Cardsharp gains a new deck of cards, set of dice, coin to flip, or other small gambling token required for the game at hand. How the Cardsharp gains the object varies—someone may give the deck, dice, or coin to the Cardsharp, the Cardsharp could find an extra one in their clothing, or it could just turn up. Action (obviously not one requiring an associated drawn card, dice throw, or coin flip).
trans-unit.target: Deck to Hand: The Cardsharp gains a new deck of cards, set of dice, coin to flip, or other small gambling token required for the game at hand. How the Cardsharp gains the object varies—someone may give the deck, dice, or coin to the Cardsharp, the Cardsharp could find an extra one in their clothing, or it could just turn up. Action (obviously not one requiring an associated drawn card, dice throw, or coin flip).

trans-unit.source: Entropy’s Luck: If the Cardsharp fails on a task, they can change the die result to a natural 20; however, when they do so, a repercussion is also automatically triggered. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Entropy’s Luck: If the Cardsharp fails on a task, they can change the die result to a natural 20; however, when they do so, a repercussion is also automatically triggered. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Shuffle Wizard: For ten minutes, the Cardsharp gains +1 to Speed Edge and eases Speed defense rolls by two steps. Tasks to distract onlookers by the Cardsharp’s ability to shuffle and manipulate cards are also eased by two steps. Draw card, throw dice, or flip coin (each a separate action) to activate.
trans-unit.target: Shuffle Wizard: For ten minutes, the Cardsharp gains +1 to Speed Edge and eases Speed defense rolls by two steps. Tasks to distract onlookers by the Cardsharp’s ability to shuffle and manipulate cards are also eased by two steps. Draw card, throw dice, or flip coin (each a separate action) to activate.

trans-unit.source: Cardsharp Repercussions
trans-unit.target: Cardsharp Repercussions

trans-unit.source: A Cardsharp faces the following repercussions each time they roll a 1 (or higher, if previously triggered) on a connection roll. The repercussions flow from the same inhuman powers granting them their abilities. Each repercussion also increases the connection range by 1.
trans-unit.target: A Cardsharp faces the following repercussions each time they roll a 1 (or higher, if previously triggered) on a connection roll. The repercussions flow from the same inhuman powers granting them their abilities. Each repercussion also increases the connection range by 1.

trans-unit.source: d6
trans-unit.target: d6

trans-unit.source: Cardsharp Repercussions
trans-unit.target: Cardsharp Repercussions

trans-unit.source: Stone Hand. The character loses the use of one hand for one hour. During this period, physical tasks requiring two hands are hindered and the character’s hand and forearm appears as if replaced with an oversized chunk of crimson stone.
trans-unit.target: Stone Hand. The character loses the use of one hand for one hour. During this period, physical tasks requiring two hands are hindered and the character’s hand and forearm appears as if replaced with an oversized chunk of crimson stone.

trans-unit.source: Card Fire. Whatever the character carries to generate random results (cards, dice, coins, etc.) and all similar material within immediate range goes up in flames, sending tongues of choking smoke into the air. The Cardsharp and anyone else in immediate range takes 5 points of ambient damage.
trans-unit.target: Card Fire. Whatever the character carries to generate random results (cards, dice, coins, etc.) and all similar material within immediate range goes up in flames, sending tongues of choking smoke into the air. The Cardsharp and anyone else in immediate range takes 5 points of ambient damage.

trans-unit.source: Loser. A nearby ally loses big on a bet, and the Cardsharp forgets that ally’s name and existence for an hour. If no ally is betting, the Cardsharp loses their stake (despite their Breaking Even ability) and passes out for an hour, during which time they cannot be roused.
trans-unit.target: Loser. A nearby ally loses big on a bet, and the Cardsharp forgets that ally’s name and existence for an hour. If no ally is betting, the Cardsharp loses their stake (despite their Breaking Even ability) and passes out for an hour, during which time they cannot be roused.

trans-unit.source: Joker. For one hour, the Cardsharp’s features are muted in a penumbra (a shadow’s edge) so their face is weirdly dim, even in bright light. During this period, anything the Cardsharp says always concludes with a threat of horrific violence against whoever the Cardsharp is addressing.
trans-unit.target: Joker. For one hour, the Cardsharp’s features are muted in a penumbra (a shadow’s edge) so their face is weirdly dim, even in bright light. During this period, anything the Cardsharp says always concludes with a threat of horrific violence against whoever the Cardsharp is addressing.

trans-unit.source: Ace of Guns. Straining probability, a bullet from a distant gunfight ricochets into the area and off several walls, attacking the Cardsharp and up to five nearby people as a level 5 attack.
trans-unit.target: Ace of Guns. Straining probability, a bullet from a distant gunfight ricochets into the area and off several walls, attacking the Cardsharp and up to five nearby people as a level 5 attack.

trans-unit.source: Queen of Gears. The Cardsharp’s eyes blaze with purple radiance, animating a nearby stove, grandfather clock, or other mechanism as a forgeborn (somewhat resembling the queen of gears card) that attacks everyone.
trans-unit.target: Queen of Gears. The Cardsharp’s eyes blaze with purple radiance, animating a nearby stove, grandfather clock, or other mechanism as a forgeborn (somewhat resembling the queen of gears card) that attacks everyone.

trans-unit.target: Final
