trans-unit.target: Inebriating Round

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6

trans-unit.source: Form: Amber liquid visible through bullet case; leaves an amber, whiskey‑smelling streak in the air when fired
trans-unit.target: Form: Amber liquid visible through bullet case; leaves an amber, whiskey‑smelling streak in the air when fired

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. Instead of taking damage, a successfully attacked target immediately moves one step down on the intoxication track. Additional successful attacks continue moving the target on the track.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. Instead of taking damage, a successfully attacked target immediately moves one step down on the intoxication track. Additional successful attacks continue moving the target on the track.

trans-unit.source: Unlike most other alchemical rounds, an inebriating round can simply be swallowed by someone to gain the effect (however, doing so doesn’t infuse the inebriating effect for one minute as it would to a gun it was fired from).
trans-unit.target: Unlike most other alchemical rounds, an inebriating round can simply be swallowed by someone to gain the effect (however, doing so doesn’t infuse the inebriating effect for one minute as it would to a gun it was fired from).

trans-unit.target: Interrogation Round

trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 +1

trans-unit.source: Form: “ASK” scribed on bullet case
trans-unit.target: Form: “ASK” scribed on bullet case

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. The target takes damage normally. If the target has a mind and can speak a language known to the gunfighter and the target’s level is equal to or less than this cypher’s, the target is compelled to truthfully answer one short question immediately put to them by the gunfighter. Additional successful attacks allow for truthfully answered follow‑up questions. (If the attack with an interrogation round kills or incapacitates them, the target uses their dying breath to answer.)
trans-unit.target: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. The target takes damage normally. If the target has a mind and can speak a language known to the gunfighter and the target’s level is equal to or less than this cypher’s, the target is compelled to truthfully answer one short question immediately put to them by the gunfighter. Additional successful attacks allow for truthfully answered follow‑up questions. (If the attack with an interrogation round kills or incapacitates them, the target uses their dying breath to answer.)

trans-unit.source: Necrotic Round
trans-unit.target: Necrotic Round

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6

trans-unit.source: Form: Bullet case seems like rotting bone
trans-unit.target: Form: Bullet case seems like rotting bone

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute.

trans-unit.source: The necrotic round contains a core of undead flesh; it and subsequent bullets fired from the gun for the next minute mean that targets react according to their status.
trans-unit.target: The necrotic round contains a core of undead flesh; it and subsequent bullets fired from the gun for the next minute mean that targets react according to their status.

trans-unit.source: Against Undead: Undead targeted by a necrotic round regain health equal to 5 plus the cypher’s level with each hit—undead cognizant enough to know what’s happening usually don’t evade these “attacks.”
trans-unit.target: Against Undead: Undead targeted by a necrotic round regain health equal to 5 plus the cypher’s level with each hit—undead cognizant enough to know what’s happening usually don’t evade these “attacks.”

trans-unit.source: Against the Living: The living target takes damage normally, and the necrotic flesh begins to spread through the living target’s flesh; if a target whose level is equal to or less than the cypher’s is successfully attacked twice with a necrotic round within a minute, the unlife overwhelms their living flesh in a horrific wave, turning them into a zombie. The zombie acts according to its nature, but it ignores the gunfighter that created it unless provoked by them.
trans-unit.target: Against the Living: The living target takes damage normally, and the necrotic flesh begins to spread through the living target’s flesh; if a target whose level is equal to or less than the cypher’s is successfully attacked twice with a necrotic round within a minute, the unlife overwhelms their living flesh in a horrific wave, turning them into a zombie. The zombie acts according to its nature, but it ignores the gunfighter that created it unless provoked by them.

trans-unit.source: Form: “OTHERWHERE” scribed on bullet case
trans-unit.target: Form: “OTHERWHERE” scribed on bullet case

trans-unit.source: Effect: Firing the slug creates an invisible doorway within immediate range that only the shooter can see and use (plus any targets they designate). The doorway leads to a chilly, lightless cavern about 20 feet (6 m) in diameter. While the cold air is breathable, it is a bit thin, and the stone making up the periphery is charcoal‑like in color.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Firing the slug creates an invisible doorway within immediate range that only the shooter can see and use (plus any targets they designate). The doorway leads to a chilly, lightless cavern about 20 feet (6 m) in diameter. While the cold air is breathable, it is a bit thin, and the stone making up the periphery is charcoal‑like in color.

trans-unit.source: The doorway to otherwhere lasts for a number of days equal to the cypher’s level. When the door closes, visitors are automatically expelled back to their initial location.
trans-unit.target: The doorway to otherwhere lasts for a number of days equal to the cypher’s level. When the door closes, visitors are automatically expelled back to their initial location.

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. Instead of taking damage, a successfully attacked target immediately becomes sober, no matter their position on the intoxication track.

trans-unit.source: Form: “ETERNAL DEATH” scribed on bullet case
trans-unit.target: Form: “ETERNAL DEATH” scribed on bullet case

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. The target takes damage normally, or takes 2 additional points of damage if the cypher is level 5 or higher. If the target is killed by a gun infused with a soul‑killing round, their soul is destroyed permanently. That goes for demons and other animating spirits as well as for people. For instance, if a demon in stolen flesh is killed, there’s no need to salt and burn the body, because the demonic presence is erased, as opposed to merely being banished.

trans-unit.target: Form: Rumbles faintly like distant thunder

trans-unit.target: Effect: Firing the slug creates a region of hazed, billowing air from which the sound of distant thunder rumbles. The region fills an adjacent short area (or long area if the cypher is level 5 or higher) and lasts for about a minute.

trans-unit.target: Any creature that enters (or begins their turn in) the area is blasted with bone‑rattling thunder and takes 1 point of damage.

trans-unit.target: Form: Gray and corroded‑looking bullet; leaves an ashy streak in the air when fired

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. If an object no larger than a 10‑foot (3 m) cube is targeted, the object descends two steps on the object damage track if the object’s level is equal to or less than this cypher’s. (The object is immediately destroyed if its level is less than half the cypher’s level.)

trans-unit.source: WANTED SLUG
trans-unit.target: WANTED SLUG

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6 + 1
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 1

trans-unit.source: Form: “WANTED” scribed on bullet case
trans-unit.target: Form: “WANTED” scribed on bullet case

trans-unit.source: Effect: The bullet only fires if aimed at a WANTED poster. Assuming the poster is hit (a routine task if within short range and nothing else is distracting the shooter) the spent shell gains a special resonance with the creature indicated on the poster. If the spent slug is collected, it acts like a soul magnet, pulling in the direction of the individual shown on the poster, no matter how far away they are. The holder of the slug also has a general sense of how far their quarry is—somewhere in the same building, somewhere in town, miles away, hundreds of miles away, etc. The spent slug retains this affinity for a number of days equal to the cypher’s level.

trans-unit.source: Effect: When this round is fired from a gun, additional attacks made from the gun gain the same benefit for the next minute. Instead of taking damage, a successfully attacked target is immediately subject to a good scrubbing, leaving them and their clothes a bit damp, but clean and as odor‑free as if they’d washed and laundered in the finest bathhouse. If the cypher is level 5 or higher, the effect is so potent that the target’s positive interaction tasks are eased for an hour afterward.

trans-unit.source: WATCHER SLUG
trans-unit.target: WATCHER SLUG

trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 3

trans-unit.source: Form: “SEE UNSEEN” scribed on bullet case
trans-unit.target: Form: “SEE UNSEEN” scribed on bullet case

trans-unit.source: Effect: When a watcher slug is fired (whether as an attack or just into the air), the shooter immediately gains the ability to perceive creatures and objects within long range whose level is equal to or less than the cypher’s that are normally invisible, out of phase, only partially in the same realm, hiding, or merely under partial physical cover for one minute.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When a watcher slug is fired (whether as an attack or just into the air), the shooter immediately gains the ability to perceive creatures and objects within long range whose level is equal to or less than the cypher’s that are normally invisible, out of phase, only partially in the same realm, hiding, or merely under partial physical cover for one minute.

trans-unit.source: Alchemical Round Fusion Effect
trans-unit.target: Alchemical Round Fusion Effect

trans-unit.source: If a gun fires an alchemical round that infuses it with a magical effect while the weapon is still infused with the effect of a previous alchemical round, the result of the fusion is random and unstable, as follows.
trans-unit.target: If a gun fires an alchemical round that infuses it with a magical effect while the weapon is still infused with the effect of a previous alchemical round, the result of the fusion is random and unstable, as follows.

trans-unit.source: Fusion Effect
trans-unit.target: Fusion Effect

trans-unit.source: Both infusion benefits are canceled in an alchemical blast dealing a number of points of damage equal to the levels of both cyphers to the wielder and everyone in immediate range on a failed Speed defense roll, or 3 points even with a successful roll.
trans-unit.target: Both infusion benefits are canceled in an alchemical blast dealing a number of points of damage equal to the levels of both cyphers to the wielder and everyone in immediate range on a failed Speed defense roll, or 3 points even with a successful roll.

trans-unit.source: The wielder is affected—no defense roll—as if targeted by an attack made by one of the infusions, and both infusion benefits are canceled.
trans-unit.target: The wielder is affected—no defense roll—as if targeted by an attack made by one of the infusions, and both infusion benefits are canceled.

trans-unit.source: The wielder is affected—no defense roll—as if targeted by an attack made by both of the infusions, and both infusion benefits are canceled.
trans-unit.target: The wielder is affected—no defense roll—as if targeted by an attack made by both of the infusions, and both infusion benefits are canceled.

trans-unit.source: Both infusion benefits are canceled and the gun melts into a lump of slag.
trans-unit.target: Both infusion benefits are canceled and the gun melts into a lump of slag.

trans-unit.source: One infusion benefit is canceled (GM decides); gun wielder is stunned for one round.
trans-unit.target: One infusion benefit is canceled (GM decides); gun wielder is stunned for one round.

trans-unit.source: The previous benefit is canceled, but the new one functions normally; gun wielder is dazed for one round.
trans-unit.target: The previous benefit is canceled, but the new one functions normally; gun wielder is dazed for one round.

trans-unit.source: One infusion benefit is canceled (GM decides); gun wielder is not adversely affected.
trans-unit.target: One infusion benefit is canceled (GM decides); gun wielder is not adversely affected.

trans-unit.source: Both infusions work without interaction.
trans-unit.target: Both infusions work without interaction.

trans-unit.source: Both infusions work without interaction, and the duration of both is increased to ten minutes.
trans-unit.target: Both infusions work without interaction, and the duration of both is increased to ten minutes.

trans-unit.source: Artifacts
trans-unit.target: Artifacts

trans-unit.source: The weird west artifacts described in this chapter include those created by alchemists, sorcerers, demons, and other supernatural beings, as well as a few leftover relics of an inhuman precursor species and their horrifying enemies.
trans-unit.target: The weird west artifacts described in this chapter include those created by alchemists, sorcerers, demons, and other supernatural beings, as well as a few leftover relics of an inhuman precursor species and their horrifying enemies.

trans-unit.source: If your setting doesn’t include these specific concepts, reskin likely looking artifacts (and for that matter, cyphers noted in the previous section) to better fit your setting’s history. For instance, if your weird west setting leans heavily into steampunk, maybe “engineers” create most of the fantastic options of the setting, so that instead of a “demon pistol” (a demon in the shape of a six‑shooter), characters gain a “gauss pistol” that fires tiny steam‑powered automatons into the target’s flesh.
trans-unit.target: If your setting doesn’t include these specific concepts, reskin likely looking artifacts (and for that matter, cyphers noted in the previous section) to better fit your setting’s history. For instance, if your weird west setting leans heavily into steampunk, maybe “engineers” create most of the fantastic options of the setting, so that instead of a “demon pistol” (a demon in the shape of a six‑shooter), characters gain a “gauss pistol” that fires tiny steam‑powered automatons into the target’s flesh.

trans-unit.source: Some weapon artifacts are noted as potentially self‑aware. Refer to the Self‑Aware Artifacts section for what that could mean for a PC who acquires such an item.
trans-unit.target: Some weapon artifacts are noted as potentially self‑aware. Refer to the Self‑Aware Artifacts section for what that could mean for a PC who acquires such an item.

trans-unit.source: Deck of Second Chances
trans-unit.target: Deck of Second Chances

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6

trans-unit.source: Form: Standard card deck; however, face cards take on strong resemblance to deck’s current bearer
trans-unit.target: Form: Standard card deck; however, face cards take on strong resemblance to deck’s current bearer

trans-unit.source: Alternate Form: Sometimes a deck of second chances becomes linked with a group instead of an individual bearer; in such cases, the face cards take on the resemblance of everyone in that group
trans-unit.target: Alternate Form: Sometimes a deck of second chances becomes linked with a group instead of an individual bearer; in such cases, the face cards take on the resemblance of everyone in that group

trans-unit.source: Effect: Each time the bearer of the deck (or a member of a group linked to the deck) would otherwise die, a random card is drawn and disappears from the deck. The beneficiary of this effect immediately regains Pool points equal to the artifact’s level they can allocate however they choose.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Each time the bearer of the deck (or a member of a group linked to the deck) would otherwise die, a random card is drawn and disappears from the deck. The beneficiary of this effect immediately regains Pool points equal to the artifact’s level they can allocate however they choose.

trans-unit.source: In addition, different cards grant different effects, as follow. To determine the effect, draw a card from a standard card deck that includes jokers, or use the Midnight Deck. (If no deck is handy, the GM determines the card drawn.)
trans-unit.target: In addition, different cards grant different effects, as follow. To determine the effect, draw a card from a standard card deck that includes jokers, or use the Midnight Deck. (If no deck is handy, the GM determines the card drawn.)

trans-unit.source: A character can also choose to draw a card from the deck at any time (regardless of whether they face mortal peril), and gain the additional benefit noted for that card, if any.
trans-unit.target: A character can also choose to draw a card from the deck at any time (regardless of whether they face mortal peril), and gain the additional benefit noted for that card, if any.

trans-unit.source: Number Card, Any Suite: No additional effect other than the bearer’s survival.
trans-unit.target: Number Card, Any Suite: No additional effect other than the bearer’s survival.

trans-unit.source: Gears (Diamonds) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, they find a random expensive item in their possession.
trans-unit.target: Gears (Diamonds) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, they find a random expensive item in their possession.

trans-unit.source: Guns (Clubs) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, they find their weapons and bandoliers fully loaded, including one random alchemical round.
trans-unit.target: Guns (Clubs) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, they find their weapons and bandoliers fully loaded, including one random alchemical round.

trans-unit.source: Elixirs (Hearts) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, they gain an alchemical protective sheen (granting them +1 to Armor) that lasts until midnight.
trans-unit.target: Elixirs (Hearts) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, they gain an alchemical protective sheen (granting them +1 to Armor) that lasts until midnight.

trans-unit.source: Eyes (Spades) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, the creature responsible for almost killing the bearer takes a number of points of Intellect damage equal to the artifact’s level.
trans-unit.target: Eyes (Spades) Face Card: In addition to the bearer surviving, the creature responsible for almost killing the bearer takes a number of points of Intellect damage equal to the artifact’s level.

trans-unit.source: Ace, any Suit: In addition to the bearer surviving, they gain a free level of Effort that they can apply to any task, which they must use before midnight.
trans-unit.target: Ace, any Suit: In addition to the bearer surviving, they gain a free level of Effort that they can apply to any task, which they must use before midnight.

trans-unit.source: Jackalopes (Jokers): Bearer survives, but instead of bouncing back, they are treated as if debilitated until they rest for ten hours.
trans-unit.target: Jackalopes (Jokers): Bearer survives, but instead of bouncing back, they are treated as if debilitated until they rest for ten hours.

trans-unit.source: Effect: This firearm is often a heavy long‑range weapon (but it can take on smaller form factors, becoming a medium or light pistol in the process). Attacks with the demon pistol are eased, or eased by two steps if a light pistol.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This firearm is often a heavy long‑range weapon (but it can take on smaller form factors, becoming a medium or light pistol in the process). Attacks with the demon pistol are eased, or eased by two steps if a light pistol.

trans-unit.source: If the shooter wishes, a successful hit causes the bullet lodged in the wound to transform into a tiny demonic imp (level 3) with mouths for eyes. The imp automatically deals 3 points of damage each round to the target until the target removes the imp with a successful Speed‑based roll; once removed or a minute elapses, the transformation magic fades and the body is revealed as no more than a spent bullet.
trans-unit.target: If the shooter wishes, a successful hit causes the bullet lodged in the wound to transform into a tiny demonic imp (level 3) with mouths for eyes. The imp automatically deals 3 points of damage each round to the target until the target removes the imp with a successful Speed‑based roll; once removed or a minute elapses, the transformation magic fades and the body is revealed as no more than a spent bullet.

trans-unit.source: The shooter’s attacks and defenses against demons are hindered while they bear this artifact.
trans-unit.target: The shooter’s attacks and defenses against demons are hindered while they bear this artifact.

trans-unit.source: Form: Kerchief stitched with alchemical symbols
trans-unit.target: Form: Kerchief stitched with alchemical symbols

trans-unit.source: Effect: When the wearer pulls the bandana up over their mouth and nose as part of another action, time stops for everyone but them, allowing the wearer to act and/or move without interruption from outside forces for one full round (or for two full rounds if the artifact is level 7 or higher). Moving or damaging objects and creatures is possible for a wearer acting during an interval of stopped time, but doing so immediately ends that interval.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When the wearer pulls the bandana up over their mouth and nose as part of another action, time stops for everyone but them, allowing the wearer to act and/or move without interruption from outside forces for one full round (or for two full rounds if the artifact is level 7 or higher). trans-unit.source: Effect: User can summon the Tomb Moon into the sky if they spend several rounds concentrating to do so. The summoned Tomb Moon persists for 1d10 hours before returning to its previous chaotic orbit.
trans-unit.target: Effect: User can summon the Tomb Moon into the sky if they spend several rounds concentrating to do so. The summoned Tomb Moon persists for 1d10 hours before returning to its previous chaotic orbit.

trans-unit.source: Illuck Stone
trans-unit.target: Illuck Stone

trans-unit.source: Level: 8
trans-unit.target: Level: 8

trans-unit.source: Form: Head‑sized lump of crystal with red filaments running through it
trans-unit.target: Form: Head‑sized lump of crystal with red filaments running through it

trans-unit.source: Effect (Alien): Bearer rerolls 1s (NPC bearers avoid a stroke of bad luck).
trans-unit.target: Effect (Alien): Bearer rerolls 1s (NPC bearers avoid a stroke of bad luck).

trans-unit.source: What’s not immediately obvious—though may become so with experience—is that ill luck is visited upon someone close to the bearer, whether a friend or a stranger, often in the form of a freak accident that hurts or kills them, usually within a day, as the GM determines. Examples include slipping on a wet surface, falling into a sinkhole, or being gored by a runaway bull, all the way up to drawing the attention of something terrible. The GM determines the severity of the incident, but the level of the threat is commensurate with the artifact’s level (level 8).
trans-unit.target: What’s not immediately obvious—though may become so with experience—is that ill luck is visited upon someone close to the bearer, whether a friend or a stranger, often in the form of a freak accident that hurts or kills them, usually within a day, as the GM determines. Examples include slipping on a wet surface, falling into a sinkhole, or being gored by a runaway bull, all the way up to drawing the attention of something terrible. The GM determines the severity of the incident, but the level of the threat is commensurate with the artifact’s level (level 8).

trans-unit.source: The bearer can’t choose not to reroll 1s as long as they bear the Illuck Stone. If the bearer tries to part ways with the stone, it somehow appears among their possessions again. Only by giving it to a new bearer can the old bearer part ways, though they become the first victim of bad luck when a new user would otherwise experience bad luck.
trans-unit.target: The bearer can’t choose not to reroll 1s as long as they bear the Illuck Stone. If the bearer tries to part ways with the stone, it somehow appears among their possessions again. Only by giving it to a new bearer can the old bearer part ways, though they become the first victim of bad luck when a new user would otherwise experience bad luck.

trans-unit.source: Effect (Alien): A successfully attacked target within short range whose level is equal to or less than the artifact’s disappears; the target’s essence is trapped in the artifact. trans-unit.target: Effect (Alien): A successfully attacked target within short range whose level is equal to or less than the artifact’s disappears; the target’s essence is trapped in the artifact. trans-unit.source: No time passes for a creature trapped in the artifact. The only way for a creature to escape is if the idol is destroyed, the idol’s bearer wills the trapped creature free, or the bearer traps a new creature.
trans-unit.target: No time passes for a creature trapped in the artifact. The only way for a creature to escape is if the idol is destroyed, the idol’s bearer wills the trapped creature free, or the bearer traps a new creature.

trans-unit.target: Form: Metal manacles etched with alchemical symbols

trans-unit.source: Effect: These manacles, which can be applied to both wrists of a willing or helpless target, hinder manual tasks by two steps (or four steps if the target’s hands are manacled behind their back). In addition, the manacles prevent the use of alchemical, magical, or other uncanny abilities if the target’s level is less than the artifact’s. (PCs must succeed on an Intellect‑based roll against the manacles’ level before using a supernatural ability and, on a failed attempt, take Intellect damage [ignores Armor] equal to the manacles’ level.)
trans-unit.target: Effect: These manacles, which can be applied to both wrists of a willing or helpless target, hinder manual tasks by two steps (or four steps if the target’s hands are manacled behind their back). Other horns might spit tendrils with different effects, or do something else entirely.

trans-unit.source: Horn Effect
trans-unit.target: Horn Effect

trans-unit.source: Tendril wraps target, preventing physical tasks and dealing damage equal to the artifact’s level each round until the target escapes. Either way, tendril desiccates and turns to dust after about a minute.
trans-unit.target: Tendril wraps target, preventing physical tasks and dealing damage equal to the artifact’s level each round until the target escapes. Either way, tendril desiccates and turns to dust after about a minute.

trans-unit.source: Tendril attempts to eat its way into target via mouth, ears, or eyes, inflicting damage equal to the artifact’s level that ignores Armor. If the target survives, the tendril desiccates and turns to dust. If the damage kills the target, the tendril successfully enters the corpse. About a minute later, target’s body tears open, and an awful thing emerges, which attacks the nearest living creature.
trans-unit.target: Tendril attempts to eat its way into target via mouth, ears, or eyes, inflicting damage equal to the artifact’s level that ignores Armor. If the target survives, the tendril desiccates and turns to dust. If the damage kills the target, the tendril successfully enters the corpse. About a minute later, target’s body tears open, and an awful thing emerges, which attacks the nearest living creature.

trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 1

trans-unit.target: Form: Pistol studded with intimidating spikes; produces menacing vapor and/or growls when owner attempts to intimidate; potentially self‑aware

trans-unit.source: Effect: This firearm is a medium long‑range weapon (though lighter and heavier versions are possible). When the pistol is visible (even if still holstered), the shooter’s intimidation tasks are eased by two steps.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This firearm is a medium long‑range weapon (though lighter and heavier versions are possible). When the pistol is visible (even if still holstered), the shooter’s intimidation tasks are eased by two steps.

trans-unit.source: When the shooter wishes, a bullet fired from the gun that would otherwise strike a target instead hangs menacingly in front of the target’s face, granting the shooter an immediate additional opportunity to intimidate the target, a task that gains an additional asset. After the intimidation attempt, the shooter decides whether to allow the hanging bullet to complete its trajectory and damage the target, or to fall harmlessly to the ground.
trans-unit.target: When the shooter wishes, a bullet fired from the gun that would otherwise strike a target instead hangs menacingly in front of the target’s face, granting the shooter an immediate additional opportunity to intimidate the target, a task that gains an additional asset. After the intimidation attempt, the shooter decides whether to allow the hanging bullet to complete its trajectory and damage the target, or to fall harmlessly to the ground.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check per menacing bullet fired); upon depletion, can still be used as a normal gun of its size.
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check per menacing bullet fired); upon depletion, can still be used as a normal gun of its size.

trans-unit.source: Philosopher’s Gun
trans-unit.target: Philosopher’s Gun

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6 + 3
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 3

trans-unit.source: Form: Oversize six‑shooter‑like glass gun featuring small reservoirs of multicolored fluids and vapors; potentially self‑aware
trans-unit.target: Form: Oversize six‑shooter‑like glass gun featuring small reservoirs of multicolored fluids and vapors; potentially self‑aware

trans-unit.source: Effect: This firearm is a medium long‑range weapon. In addition, when triggered by its owner, the philosopher’s gun synthesizes one variety of alchemical round and adds the round to the chamber; an attack using that round is available on the character’s next turn. A typical philosopher’s gun can only synthesize one type of alchemical round; however, if the artifact is level 7 or higher, two different round varieties may be synthesized, which the owner chooses between when triggering the synthesis. If the artifact is level 9, the gun synthesizes one of the two fixed alchemical round varieties immediately, quickly enough that the owner can attack with it as part of the same action.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This firearm is a medium long‑range weapon. In addition, when triggered by its owner, the philosopher’s gun synthesizes one variety of alchemical round and adds the round to the chamber; an attack using that round is available on the character’s next turn. A typical philosopher’s gun can only synthesize one type of alchemical round; however, if the artifact is level 7 or higher, two different round varieties may be synthesized, which the owner chooses between when triggering the synthesis. If the artifact is level 9, the gun synthesizes one of the two fixed alchemical round varieties immediately, quickly enough that the owner can attack with it as part of the same action.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d10; upon depletion, can still be used as a normal gun of its size.
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d10; upon depletion, can still be used as a normal gun of its size.

trans-unit.source: Ring of Seeping Travel
trans-unit.target: Ring of Seeping Travel

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6 + 1
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 1

trans-unit.source: Form: Pale crystal ring a little too large for any finger it is tried on
trans-unit.target: Form: Pale crystal ring a little too large for any finger it is tried on

trans-unit.source: Effect (Alien): As the wearer’s action, the wearer and their equipment transform into a mass of quivering slime. For one minute the wearer can seep through dirt, earth, stone, structures, and other inert objects, moving up to a long range each turn while in this form. The wearer can’t physically affect inert matter and objects, but can make a pseudopod melee attack against creatures that deals a number of points of damage equal to the artifact’s level.
trans-unit.target: Effect (Alien): As the wearer’s action, the wearer and their equipment transform into a mass of quivering slime. For one minute the wearer can seep through dirt, earth, stone, structures, and other inert objects, moving up to a long range each turn while in this form. The wearer can’t physically affect inert matter and objects, but can make a pseudopod melee attack against creatures that deals a number of points of damage equal to the artifact’s level.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, a bearer not wearing the ring can peer through it to see invisible objects or creatures, as well as out-of-phase objects or creatures.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, a bearer not wearing the ring can peer through it to see invisible objects or creatures, as well as out-of-phase objects or creatures.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d10 (upon depletion, recharged if brought into a proscribed zone)

trans-unit.source: Shadow Duster
trans-unit.target: Shadow Duster

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6

trans-unit.source: Form: Coal‑black leather duster (long, heavy overcoat)
trans-unit.target: Form: Coal‑black leather duster (long, heavy overcoat)

trans-unit.source: Effect: A shadow duster functions normally as light armor. If a shadow is within immediate range, the wearer can slip from view for up to one minute, becoming as one with the shadow as their action, effectively easing their stealth task to hide by a number of steps equal to the artifact’s level. The wearer can stay still and remain essentially invisible as long as they take no action. Alternatively, at any point before one minute elapses, they can step out of any other shadow within long range, even shadows separated by walls or terrain. (The owner gains a sort of sixth sense about other shadows while they’re hiding, learning about general shape and placement, but nothing more.)
trans-unit.target: Effect: A shadow duster functions normally as light armor. If a shadow is within immediate range, the wearer can slip from view for up to one minute, becoming as one with the shadow as their action, effectively easing their stealth task to hide by a number of steps equal to the artifact’s level. The wearer can stay still and remain essentially invisible as long as they take no action. Alternatively, at any point before one minute elapses, they can step out of any other shadow within long range, even shadows separated by walls or terrain. (The owner gains a sort of sixth sense about other shadows while they’re hiding, learning about general shape and placement, but nothing more.)

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20; upon depletion, can still be worn as a normal duster.

trans-unit.target: Form: Light blade with hilt (called a “bowie” knife in some settings); potentially self‑aware

trans-unit.source: Effect: This knife is a light melee weapon. Attacks made with it are automatically eased (two steps total).
trans-unit.target: Effect: This knife is a light melee weapon. Attacks made with it are automatically eased (two steps total).

trans-unit.source: In addition, the user gains two assets for noticing invisible creatures, spirits, and not‑currently‑manifested ghosts in the area by looking for their reflection in the blade. If spotted, such a creature within immediate range must answer one question put to it by the knife wielder if the creature’s level is less than or equal to the knife’s and if the knife wielder succeeds on an Intellect attack.

trans-unit.source: Effect (Alien): Bearer summons a swarm of tiny bug‑like creatures that persist for one minute. The swarm’s level is equal to the artifact’s level. The swarm attacks a designated foe within short range and hinders their perception tasks for the duration.
trans-unit.target: Effect (Alien): Bearer summons a swarm of tiny bug‑like creatures that persist for one minute. The swarm’s level is equal to the artifact’s level. The swarm attacks a designated foe within short range and hinders their perception tasks for the duration.

trans-unit.source: The bugs seem like roaches at first glance, but a closer look reveals them to have too many legs, eyes, and mouths—none are exactly like the other, and all make a sort of sickly twittering sound.
trans-unit.target: The bugs seem like roaches at first glance, but a closer look reveals them to have too many legs, eyes, and mouths—none are exactly like the other, and all make a sort of sickly twittering sound.

trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 1

trans-unit.source: Form: Rope glinting with entwined silver threads tied with a lasso at one end
trans-unit.target: Form: Rope glinting with entwined silver threads tied with a lasso at one end

trans-unit.source: Effect: User’s short‑range lasso attacks made with the lariat are eased. If an attack succeeds, the target is magically restrained, unable to take physical actions until they can escape (PCs make a Might‑based roll as their action; NPCs whose level is higher than the artifact’s can use their full turn to escape), the user lets them go, or midnight comes.
trans-unit.target: Effect: User’s short‑range lasso attacks made with the lariat are eased. If an attack succeeds, the target is magically restrained, unable to take physical actions until they can escape (PCs make a Might‑based roll as their action; NPCs whose level is higher than the artifact’s can use their full turn to escape), the user lets them go, or midnight comes.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the lassoer can instead choose to make an eased attack with the intention of just snaring a target’s arm or leg, hindering the target’s physical tasks and preventing them from moving more than an immediate distance on their turn until they use their full action to remove the rope (or the lassoer drops their end).
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, the lassoer can instead choose to make an eased attack with the intention of just snaring a target’s arm or leg, hindering the target’s physical tasks and preventing them from moving more than an immediate distance on their turn until they use their full action to remove the rope (or the lassoer drops their end).

trans-unit.source: Tesla Lasso Variant: This electrified variety is especially effective against demons. All tasks related to restraining demons (whether immaterial or wearing stolen flesh) with the lariat are eased by two steps; treat the lariat as two levels higher for purposes of demons attempting to escape.
trans-unit.target: Tesla Lasso Variant: This electrified variety is especially effective against demons. All tasks related to restraining demons (whether immaterial or wearing stolen flesh) with the lariat are eased by two steps; treat the lariat as two levels higher for purposes of demons attempting to escape.

trans-unit.source: Tracker’s Map
trans-unit.target: Tracker’s Map

trans-unit.source: Level: 1d6 + 1
trans-unit.target: Level: 1d6 + 1

trans-unit.source: Form: Basic but accurate map of the region where the map is activated
trans-unit.target: Form: Basic but accurate map of the region where the map is activated

trans-unit.source: Effect: Unfolding the map allows its bearer to locate a creature whose level is less than the artifact’s, no matter where the creature is. The bearer must know or have met the target, know the target’s full name (or “true” name), or have an article of clothing or other personal belonging of the target’s. If they do, the target’s location is pinpointed (to within a short area) on the map. The map includes locations near the map bearer as well as locations near the target, though depending on the distance separating the two, it may not be to scale. The map shows the target’s location for one day per artifact level, or until a new target is named.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Unfolding the map allows its bearer to locate a creature whose level is less than the artifact’s, no matter where the creature is. The bearer must know or have met the target, know the target’s full name (or “true” name), or have an article of clothing or other personal belonging of the target’s. If they do, the target’s location is pinpointed (to within a short area) on the map. The map includes locations near the map bearer as well as locations near the target, though depending on the distance separating the two, it may not be to scale. The map shows the target’s location for one day per artifact level, or until a new target is named.

trans-unit.source: In addition, if a PC rolls a major effect and the target’s level is equal to or less than the artifact’s, the PC can choose to implode the target’s head. For most living creatures that possess only a single head, that’s the end.

trans-unit.source: Form: Crystal hoop about 1 foot (30 cm) in diameter
trans-unit.target: Form: Crystal hoop about 1 foot (30 cm) in diameter

trans-unit.source: Effect (Alien): Anything passed through the hoop whose level is less than the artifact’s is disintegrated. Living creatures take damage equal to the artifact’s level each round they persist in keeping any part of their body within the ambit of the wheel. This item could be used as a weapon, but it’s awkward, hindering melee attacks (or a ranged attack) made with it by two steps. On a hit, the hoop deals damage equal to its level.

trans-unit.source: Self Aware Artifacts
trans-unit.target: Self Aware Artifacts

trans-unit.source: One method alchemists use to empower an object—usually a firearm—with uncanny abilities is to infuse a spirit that already has access to such abilities. Said spirit could be a ghost of a once‑living person, an elemental, a synthesized mind, or perhaps something inscrutable called from antediluvian epochs.
trans-unit.target: One method alchemists use to empower an object—usually a firearm—with uncanny abilities is to infuse a spirit that already has access to such abilities. Said spirit could be a ghost of a once‑living person, an elemental, a synthesized mind, or perhaps something inscrutable called from antediluvian epochs.

trans-unit.source: Item Goals: Some self‑aware artifacts have a goal; others can hardly be bothered to communicate with their bearer. A few options for those with goals include the following.
trans-unit.target: Item Goals: Some self‑aware artifacts have a goal; others can hardly be bothered to communicate with their bearer. A few options for those with goals include the following.

trans-unit.source: D6
trans-unit.target: D6

trans-unit.source: Artifact Goal
trans-unit.target: Artifact Goal

trans-unit.source: Conclude the unfinished business of the ghost infused with the item
trans-unit.target: Conclude the unfinished business of the ghost infused with the item

trans-unit.source: If a weapon, defeat a certain class of targets, such as cursed beasts or celebrities
trans-unit.target: If a weapon, defeat a certain class of targets, such as cursed beasts or celebrities

trans-unit.source: Spread order and rule of law
trans-unit.target: Spread order and rule of law

trans-unit.source: Spread chaos and anarchy
trans-unit.target: Spread chaos and anarchy

trans-unit.source: Befriend/assist bearer
trans-unit.target: Befriend/assist bearer

trans-unit.source: Undermine/gaslight bearer (“cursed”)
trans-unit.target: Undermine/gaslight bearer (“cursed”)

trans-unit.source: Artifact Communication: Some self‑aware items can speak directly into the minds of their bearers (or potential bearers), but no one else can hear the item. Others can speak audibly, allowing anyone nearby to potentially communicate with the item.
trans-unit.target: Artifact Communication: Some self‑aware items can speak directly into the minds of their bearers (or potential bearers), but no one else can hear the item. Others can speak audibly, allowing anyone nearby to potentially communicate with the item.

trans-unit.source: Artifact Autonomy: If a self‑aware artifact has a goal, then they work to achieve it in some fashion. Potential options include the following.
trans-unit.target: Artifact Autonomy: If a self‑aware artifact has a goal, then they work to achieve it in some fashion. Potential options include the following.

trans-unit.source: d6
trans-unit.target: d6

trans-unit.source: Ability to Act
trans-unit.target: Ability to Act

trans-unit.source: Convincing/cajoling bearer
trans-unit.target: Convincing/cajoling bearer

trans-unit.source: Punishing the bearer’s inaction by causing minor pain (a couple of points of Speed or Intellect damage) once each day, or each time a perfect opportunity to act is ignored by the bearer
trans-unit.target: Punishing the bearer’s inaction by causing minor pain (a couple of points of Speed or Intellect damage) once each day, or each time a perfect opportunity to act is ignored by the bearer

trans-unit.source: Creating auditory and visual hallucinations designed to lure/trick bearer into a situation where they have few choices other than do as the artifact wishes
trans-unit.target: Creating auditory and visual hallucinations designed to lure/trick bearer into a situation where they have few choices other than do as the artifact wishes

trans-unit.source: Offering a reward; possibly a new artifact function that can only be used in pursuit of the goal, or the location of some great treasure
trans-unit.target: Offering a reward; possibly a new artifact function that can only be used in pursuit of the goal, or the location of some great treasure

trans-unit.source: Acting of its own accord when no one is looking
trans-unit.target: Acting of its own accord when no one is looking

trans-unit.source: Taking mental control of the bearer for up to an hour per day on a failed Intellect defense roll; bearer may not remember what they did during the lost hour
trans-unit.target: Taking mental control of the bearer for up to an hour per day on a failed Intellect defense roll; bearer may not remember what they did during the lost hour

trans-unit.source: Artifact Depletion: Self‑aware artifacts don’t deplete the same way regular artifacts do; if a depletion is indicated, the entity within the artifact is “on sabbatical” or is otherwise choosing not to communicate. Usually, the artifact will return to normal after a few days, or when the user does something to mollify the entity granting the item self‑awareness.
trans-unit.target: Artifact Depletion: Self‑aware artifacts don’t deplete the same way regular artifacts do; if a depletion is indicated, the entity within the artifact is “on sabbatical” or is otherwise choosing not to communicate. Usually, the artifact will return to normal after a few days, or when the user does something to mollify the entity granting the item self‑awareness.

trans-unit.source: CELEBRITIES
trans-unit.target: CELEBRITIES

trans-unit.source: A celebrity NPC is someone whose fame gives them an outsize ability to command the attention of regular folks.Their reputation probably accrued thanks to stories of actual (or made‑up) daring deeds, their particular personality, or some combination of both. For instance, some celebrities are gunfighters who earned their reputation through gunplay, which means some number of weird west celebrities are antiheroes, though marshals and lawmen balance that trope.
trans-unit.target: A celebrity NPC is someone whose fame gives them an outsize ability to command the attention of regular folks.Their reputation probably accrued thanks to stories of actual (or made‑up) daring deeds, their particular personality, or some combination of both. For instance, some celebrities are gunfighters who earned their reputation through gunplay, which means some number of weird west celebrities are antiheroes, though marshals and lawmen balance that trope.

trans-unit.source: Another sort of weird west celebrity are folks about whom stories are told, or who tell those stories themselves, which makes them entertainers and performers of a sort. Whether holding forth in a saloon or showcasing their roping, pistol, bow, or other impressive skill, these celebrities are recognized locally and enjoy a few related benefits.
trans-unit.target: Another sort of weird west celebrity are folks about whom stories are told, or who tell those stories themselves, which makes them entertainers and performers of a sort. Whether holding forth in a saloon or showcasing their roping, pistol, bow, or other impressive skill, these celebrities are recognized locally and enjoy a few related benefits.

trans-unit.source: Effect: Apply the following stat adjustments to a celebrity.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Apply the following stat adjustments to a celebrity.

trans-unit.source: The NPC’s positive interaction tasks (or intimidation tasks, if an antihero) are eased by two steps
trans-unit.target: The NPC’s positive interaction tasks (or intimidation tasks, if an antihero) are eased by two steps

trans-unit.source: The NPC can “captivate with starshine”: for as long as they speak, they keep the attention of all level 2 or lower NPCs who can hear them.
trans-unit.target: The NPC can “captivate with starshine”: for as long as they speak, they keep the attention of all level 2 or lower NPCs who can hear them.

trans-unit.source: Celebrity Names: For a weird west setting, celebrities may be actual historical celebrities, or have names that merely evoke them, like the following.
trans-unit.target: Celebrity Names: For a weird west setting, celebrities may be actual historical celebrities, or have names that merely evoke them, like the following.

trans-unit.source: Belle Younger, Rainmaker, Calamity Anne, Massad Masterson, Evangeline Oakley, Doc Festival, Midday Thunder, Blackjack Cassidy, Wong Starr, Polly McGraw, Grizzlyhawk, Diamond Larue, Kieu the Kid
trans-unit.target: Belle Younger, Rainmaker, Calamity Anne, Massad Masterson, Evangeline Oakley, Doc Festival, Midday Thunder, Blackjack Cassidy, Wong Starr, Polly McGraw, Grizzlyhawk, Diamond Larue, Kieu the Kid

trans-unit.source: ALCHEMIST 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: ALCHEMIST 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: Alchemists ain’t afraid to use logic and laborious experiments to claw magic from the dirt. Their knowledge of alchemical lore allows them to imbue inert objects with arcane volatility. They employ tinctures that heal or control, fling powders that explode or transform, and most impressively, animate rude substances into pseudo‑living entities known as forgeborn. Many alchemists pursue their craft merely from a desire to push back the boundaries of ignorance. Others have a specific goal in mind, such as to gain riches or power, to bring back a loved one, or merely to make a friend.
trans-unit.target: Alchemists ain’t afraid to use logic and laborious experiments to claw magic from the dirt. Their knowledge of alchemical lore allows them to imbue inert objects with arcane volatility. They employ tinctures that heal or control, fling powders that explode or transform, and most impressively, animate rude substances into pseudo‑living entities known as forgeborn. Many alchemists pursue their craft merely from a desire to push back the boundaries of ignorance. Others have a specific goal in mind, such as to gain riches or power, to bring back a loved one, or merely to make a friend.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The alchemist’s round has a chemical load that expands and hardens when exposed to air, trapping the target in the resulting crust until they can escape.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The alchemist’s round has a chemical load that expands and hardens when exposed to air, trapping the target in the resulting crust until they can escape.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Use alchemy to achieve their ends
trans-unit.target: Motive: Use alchemy to achieve their ends

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 6 due to their forgeborn companion; alchemical knowledge as level 7
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 6 due to their forgeborn companion; alchemical knowledge as level 7

trans-unit.source: Combat: Alchemists use long range pistols or rifles. At least one of their bullets may be alchemical (see GM intrusion as an example).
trans-unit.target: Combat: Alchemists use long range pistols or rifles. At least one of their bullets may be alchemical (see GM intrusion as an example).

trans-unit.source: A forgeborn assistant also accompanies most alchemists, often helping with defense. Forgeborn assistant: level 3; health 15; Armor 1 Especially accomplished alchemists may have a far more powerful forgeborn assistant, such as a deadshot or angalith.
trans-unit.target: A forgeborn assistant also accompanies most alchemists, often helping with defense. Forgeborn assistant: level 3; health 15; Armor 1 Especially accomplished alchemists may have a far more powerful forgeborn assistant, such as a deadshot or angalith.

trans-unit.source: A given alchemist also has one or two of the following alchemical resources available in combat.
trans-unit.target: A given alchemist also has one or two of the following alchemical resources available in combat.

trans-unit.source: Empower: The alchemist uses a tincture to regain 11 points of health and gain +3 to Armor for one minute (or gives this tincture to an ally).
trans-unit.target: Empower: The alchemist uses a tincture to regain 11 points of health and gain +3 to Armor for one minute (or gives this tincture to an ally).

trans-unit.source: Petrify: The alchemist flings a powder that turns up to two targets in immediate range to stone on a failed Might defense roll. Targets remain stone for one minute, then regain their flesh.
trans-unit.target: Petrify: The alchemist flings a powder that turns up to two targets in immediate range to stone on a failed Might defense roll. Targets remain stone for one minute, then regain their flesh.

trans-unit.source: Flummox: The alchemist flings a powder causing two targets in immediate range to randomly attack their allies on a failed Intellect defense roll. Affected targets remain flummoxed for one minute or until they succeed on an Intellect defense roll on their turn.
trans-unit.target: Flummox: The alchemist flings a powder causing two targets in immediate range to randomly attack their allies on a failed Intellect defense roll. Affected targets remain flummoxed for one minute or until they succeed on an Intellect defense roll on their turn.

trans-unit.source: Blast: The alchemist flings a flask a short range that detonates in an acidic blast on impact, dealing damage to all creatures in an immediate area on a failed Speed defense roll, or 1 point of damage on a successful roll.
trans-unit.target: Blast: The alchemist flings a flask a short range that detonates in an acidic blast on impact, dealing damage to all creatures in an immediate area on a failed Speed defense roll, or 1 point of damage on a successful roll.

trans-unit.source: Non-Combat Alchemy: A given alchemist could create tinctures able to revive the recently dead, animate dead flesh, transform lead into gold, and so on, if given many hours or days.
trans-unit.target: Non-Combat Alchemy: A given alchemist could create tinctures able to revive the recently dead, animate dead flesh, transform lead into gold, and so on, if given many hours or days.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Few alchemists can resist talking about their research and the wonders of magic that “natural philosophy” can unlock, regardless of their larger goals.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Few alchemists can resist talking about their research and the wonders of magic that “natural philosophy” can unlock, regardless of their larger goals.

trans-unit.source: Use: The PCs need to revive an unresponsive forgeborn to learn what it knows, which means they need to find an alchemist.
trans-unit.target: Use: The PCs need to revive an unresponsive forgeborn to learn what it knows, which means they need to find an alchemist.

trans-unit.source: Loot: An alchemist may have a couple of useful items (roll twice on the Alchemical Rounds and Slugs table), assuming they didn’t use them in combat.
trans-unit.target: Loot: An alchemist may have a couple of useful items (roll twice on the Alchemical Rounds and Slugs table), assuming they didn’t use them in combat.

trans-unit.source: CURSED BEASTS
trans-unit.target: CURSED BEASTS

trans-unit.source: Cursed beasts are often hybrid animals, a fusion of two or more different beasts stitched together with dire sorcery, or a combination of beast and base material (such as snow and dead flesh). Other times they’re ancient creatures time would’ve been better off forgetting.
trans-unit.target: Cursed beasts are often hybrid animals, a fusion of two or more different beasts stitched together with dire sorcery, or a combination of beast and base material (such as snow and dead flesh). Other times they’re ancient creatures time would’ve been better off forgetting.

trans-unit.source: Mysterious things, cursed beasts are often capable of coming and going as they please. In some times and places, they are called “cryptids” because at their core, they seem unknowable. Cursed beasts include dire coyotes, frostwalkers, hellfire steeds, and sulfur stalkers.
trans-unit.target: Mysterious things, cursed beasts are often capable of coming and going as they please. In some times and places, they are called “cryptids” because at their core, they seem unknowable. Cursed beasts include dire coyotes, frostwalkers, hellfire steeds, and sulfur stalkers.

trans-unit.source: Chupacabra: Part huge dog, part crocodile; quilled like a porcupine.
trans-unit.target: Chupacabra: Part huge dog, part crocodile; quilled like a porcupine.

trans-unit.source: Level 3, Speed defense as level 4 due to quickness, stealth and perception as level 7; health 13; Armor 2; bites for 5 points of damage; long‑range quill attack puts target to sleep for one hour on a failed difficulty 5 Might defense roll (target can try to wake each round)
trans-unit.target: Level 3, Speed defense as level 4 due to quickness, stealth and perception as level 7; health 13; Armor 2; bites for 5 points of damage; long‑range quill attack puts target to sleep for one hour on a failed difficulty 5 Might defense roll (target can try to wake each round)

trans-unit.source: Quetzalsaur: Giraffe‑sized monstrosity with a 40‑foot (12 m) wingspan.
trans-unit.target: Quetzalsaur: Giraffe‑sized monstrosity with a 40‑foot (12 m) wingspan.

trans-unit.source: Level 6, Speed defense as level 4 due to size; health 33; Armor 2; flies a long distance each round; beak attack for 7 points of damage; vomits up two zombie helpers (corpses of past victims) once per conflict
trans-unit.target: Level 6, Speed defense as level 4 due to size; health 33; Armor 2; flies a long distance each round; beak attack for 7 points of damage; vomits up two zombie helpers (corpses of past victims) once per conflict

trans-unit.source: Grizzly Bull: Bison bull magically crossed with a grizzly bear.
trans-unit.target: Grizzly Bull: Bison bull magically crossed with a grizzly bear.

trans-unit.source: Level 6, Speed defense as level 5 due to size, breaking through walls as level 8; health 28; Armor 1; horns attack deal 6 points of damage; if a foe within immediate range misses the bull, the grizzly bull gets an immediate extra attack
trans-unit.target: Level 6, Speed defense as level 5 due to size, breaking through walls as level 8; health 28; Armor 1; horns attack deal 6 points of damage; if a foe within immediate range misses the bull, the grizzly bull gets an immediate extra attack

trans-unit.source: Deathtumbler: Human‑sized tumbleweeds whose “thorns” are actually animal fangs.
trans-unit.target: Deathtumbler: Human‑sized tumbleweeds whose “thorns” are actually animal fangs.

trans-unit.source: Level 3, Speed defense as level 4, disguise (as rotting carrion) as level 6; slashes with toothed branches for 3 points of damage; mundane attacks against deathtumbler deal only 1 point of damage each; attacks all targets in immediate area if it has surprise, dealing damage and, on a failed Might defense roll, 3 additional points of Speed damage (ignores Armor)
trans-unit.target: Level 3, Speed defense as level 4, disguise (as rotting carrion) as level 6; slashes with toothed branches for 3 points of damage; mundane attacks against deathtumbler deal only 1 point of damage each; attacks all targets in immediate area if it has surprise, dealing damage and, on a failed Might defense roll, 3 additional points of Speed damage (ignores Armor)

trans-unit.source: Jackalope: Jackrabbit with the horns of an antelope.
trans-unit.target: Jackalope: Jackrabbit with the horns of an antelope.

trans-unit.source: Level 2, Speed defense as level 4, stealth and illusions as level 5; moves a long distance each round, immediate when burrowing; gores with antlers for 3 points of damage; creates illusion that can fill a short area and lasts for ten minutes or until interacted with
trans-unit.target: Level 2, Speed defense as level 4, stealth and illusions as level 5; moves a long distance each round, immediate when burrowing; gores with antlers for 3 points of damage; creates illusion that can fill a short area and lasts for ten minutes or until interacted with

trans-unit.source: Nightcrawler: 20‑foot (6 m) long earthworm with skin stripped from past prey.
trans-unit.target: Nightcrawler: 20‑foot (6 m) long earthworm with skin stripped from past prey.

trans-unit.source: Level 4, Speed defense as level 3; bite deals 5 points of damage
trans-unit.target: Level 4, Speed defense as level 3; bite deals 5 points of damage

trans-unit.source: DIRE COYOTE 4 (12)
trans-unit.target: DIRE COYOTE 4 (12)

trans-unit.source: Remnants of ancient populations reinvigorated by cursed magic, dire coyotes hunt lost and isolated creatures, regardless of whether the prey is alive or already dead. Dire coyotes are gaunt and sinewy, almost as large as a horse. Their hides are branded with arcane sigils that still glow and smoke with the sorcery that pulses through them.
trans-unit.target: Remnants of ancient populations reinvigorated by cursed magic, dire coyotes hunt lost and isolated creatures, regardless of whether the prey is alive or already dead. Dire coyotes are gaunt and sinewy, almost as large as a horse. Their hides are branded with arcane sigils that still glow and smoke with the sorcery that pulses through them.

trans-unit.source: Dire coyotes usually hunt in teams of two or three. However, their howls give the impression of a far larger number of individuals in the night.
trans-unit.target: Dire coyotes usually hunt in teams of two or three. However, their howls give the impression of a far larger number of individuals in the night.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Hungers for flesh, defense
trans-unit.target: Motive: Hungers for flesh, defense

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere dark and isolated or near places ghosts haunt, individually and in teams of two or three
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere dark and isolated or near places ghosts haunt, individually and in teams of two or three

trans-unit.source: Health: 15
trans-unit.target: Health: 15

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 4 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 4 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 1
trans-unit.target: Armor: 1

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Perception as level 6; attacks and defense against ghosts, wraiths, and other spirits as level 6
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Perception as level 6; attacks and defense against ghosts, wraiths, and other spirits as level 6

trans-unit.source: Combat: A dire coyote bites each round.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A dire coyote bites each round.

trans-unit.source: A dire coyote also has one or more of the following traits.
trans-unit.target: A dire coyote also has one or more of the following traits.

trans-unit.source: Forlorn Howl: The dire coyote unleashes a forlorn howl that magically resonates within an adjacent short area (no more than once every few minutes). Creatures in the area take 4 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor), causing them to run terrified in a random direction determined by the GM for several minutes, unless they succeed on an Intellect defense roll to end the effect early.
trans-unit.target: Forlorn Howl: The dire coyote unleashes a forlorn howl that magically resonates within an adjacent short area (no more than once every few minutes). Creatures in the area take 4 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor), causing them to run terrified in a random direction determined by the GM for several minutes, unless they succeed on an Intellect defense roll to end the effect early.

trans-unit.source: Ghost eater: A dire coyote’s attacks affect incorporeal ghosts, wraiths, and similar spirits. If a dire coyote destroys a ghost or wraith, that usually ends the haunting, even if the spirit normally returns. Destroying a ghost heals a dire coyote to full health, but afterward the dire coyote must sleep for a few hours to “digest” the essence.
trans-unit.target: Ghost eater: A dire coyote’s attacks affect incorporeal ghosts, wraiths, and similar spirits. If a dire coyote destroys a ghost or wraith, that usually ends the haunting, even if the spirit normally returns. Destroying a ghost heals a dire coyote to full health, but afterward the dire coyote must sleep for a few hours to “digest” the essence.

trans-unit.source: Ignite Gun: If a dire coyote is damaged by a gun attack (or bow, or similar mechanism), the gun wielder must immediately succeed on an Intellect defense roll or their gun ignites, burning anyone holding it for 4 points of damage each round for three rounds.
trans-unit.target: Ignite Gun: If a dire coyote is damaged by a gun attack (or bow, or similar mechanism), the gun wielder must immediately succeed on an Intellect defense roll or their gun ignites, burning anyone holding it for 4 points of damage each round for three rounds.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Dire coyotes have a secret language and society, but usually present to outsiders as just particularly dangerous coyotes. However, if they wish, dire coyotes can speak with the voice and memories of any ghost they have personally destroyed.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Dire coyotes have a secret language and society, but usually present to outsiders as just particularly dangerous coyotes. However, if they wish, dire coyotes can speak with the voice and memories of any ghost they have personally destroyed.

trans-unit.source: Use: A sheriff who posted a bounty on dire coyotes has gone missing, and their spouse needs someone to go find them. GM intrusion: The dire coyote takes on the likeness of a ghost of someone the character knew—the ghost is someone the dire coyote has recently destroyed
trans-unit.target: Use: A sheriff who posted a bounty on dire coyotes has gone missing, and their spouse needs someone to go find them. GM intrusion: The dire coyote takes on the likeness of a ghost of someone the character knew—the ghost is someone the dire coyote has recently destroyed

trans-unit.source: FROSTWALKER 3 (9)
trans-unit.target: FROSTWALKER 3 (9)

trans-unit.source: A frostwalker is a cursed beast made of packed snow layered over the severed limbs, heads, gristle, antlers, and sinew from deer, wolves, and sometimes people who’ve died in the cold. As such, they vary in appearance. Some are about the size of wolves, others are human‑sized with antlers, and a few—especially those with more limbs and/or heads than normal—can be up to twice the size of a person.
trans-unit.target: A frostwalker is a cursed beast made of packed snow layered over the severed limbs, heads, gristle, antlers, and sinew from deer, wolves, and sometimes people who’ve died in the cold. As such, they vary in appearance. Some are about the size of wolves, others are human‑sized with antlers, and a few—especially those with more limbs and/or heads than normal—can be up to twice the size of a person.

trans-unit.source: Frostwalkers may be creations of dire sorcery, though some gain motive force from the spirits of blizzards, ice, and enmity earned through past atrocity.
trans-unit.target: Frostwalkers may be creations of dire sorcery, though some gain motive force from the spirits of blizzards, ice, and enmity earned through past atrocity.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Revenge
trans-unit.target: Motive: Revenge

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere cold enough for snow and ice
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere cold enough for snow and ice

trans-unit.source: Health: 12
trans-unit.target: Health: 12

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 4 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 4 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 1
trans-unit.target: Armor: 1

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Perception as level 5
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Perception as level 5

trans-unit.source: Combat: Frostwalkers bite, gore, or claw with whatever body part they have available.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Frostwalkers bite, gore, or claw with whatever body part they have available.

trans-unit.source: Frostwalkers may also have one or more of the following abilities.
trans-unit.target: Frostwalkers may also have one or more of the following abilities.

trans-unit.source: Frozen: The frostwalker regains 1 point of health for each point of damage they would otherwise take from cold. In freezing temperatures and lower, they regain 1 point of health each round (assuming they’re not destroyed).
trans-unit.target: Frozen: The frostwalker regains 1 point of health for each point of damage they would otherwise take from cold. In freezing temperatures and lower, they regain 1 point of health each round (assuming they’re not destroyed).

trans-unit.source: Scream the Blizzard: The frostwalker can expel screaming cold winds (no more than once every few minutes), filling an adjacent short area. Creatures in the area take 4 points of ambient damage from the cold and, on a failed Might defense roll, are frozen in place for one minute or until they succeed on a Might‑based roll as their action. Even a successful Might defense roll dazes the target with cold, hindering their tasks for one minute.
trans-unit.target: Scream the Blizzard: The frostwalker can expel screaming cold winds (no more than once every few minutes), filling an adjacent short area. Creatures in the area take 4 points of ambient damage from the cold and, on a failed Might defense roll, are frozen in place for one minute or until they succeed on a Might‑based roll as their action. Even a successful Might defense roll dazes the target with cold, hindering their tasks for one minute.

trans-unit.source: Small and Quick: About the size of a wolf, this frostwalker only has 1 Armor but can move a long distance each round.
trans-unit.target: Small and Quick: About the size of a wolf, this frostwalker only has 1 Armor but can move a long distance each round.

trans-unit.source: Snow Monster: Twice the size of a person, this frostwalker might have two or more heads (one wolf, one deer) and extra arms. It attacks twice per round, moves an immediate distance each round, and has 24 health.
trans-unit.target: Snow Monster: Twice the size of a person, this frostwalker might have two or more heads (one wolf, one deer) and extra arms. It attacks twice per round, moves an immediate distance each round, and has 24 health.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Frostwalkers are usually made (or form spontaneously) to enact vengeance or to attack a foe, and will do so until they’re destroyed.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Frostwalkers are usually made (or form spontaneously) to enact vengeance or to attack a foe, and will do so until they’re destroyed.

trans-unit.source: Use: When the lake freezes over, monstrous things made of snow slide across the solid surface and begin terrorizing whatever they find.
trans-unit.target: Use: When the lake freezes over, monstrous things made of snow slide across the solid surface and begin terrorizing whatever they find.

trans-unit.source: Frostwalkers could be classified as necrovores instead of (or in addition to) cursed beasts, or possibly even as a forgeborn variety. Creature classification isn’t as neat and tidy as some alchemists might wish.
trans-unit.target: Frostwalkers could be classified as necrovores instead of (or in addition to) cursed beasts, or possibly even as a forgeborn variety. Creature classification isn’t as neat and tidy as some alchemists might wish.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: An important piece of the character’s equipment freezes solid, rendering it unusable until it’s thawed.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: An important piece of the character’s equipment freezes solid, rendering it unusable until it’s thawed.

trans-unit.source: HELLFIRE STEED 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: HELLFIRE STEED 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: Intermittently ridden straight out of Hell by demons wearing borrowed flesh, the Damned, and others seeking to escape the accursed underworld, hellfire steeds are demonic, fire‑dripping destriers. Their manes are boiling napalm, their glowing red hooves leave prints that burn and smolder for days, and a single demonic horn curls from their brows. Once free of Hell, these steeds typically buck their riders and race off across the prairielands, setting blazes as they go, apparently seeking to wreak as much havoc as they can before they’re reclaimed by Hell.
trans-unit.target: Intermittently ridden straight out of Hell by demons wearing borrowed flesh, the Damned, and others seeking to escape the accursed underworld, hellfire steeds are demonic, fire‑dripping destriers. Their manes are boiling napalm, their glowing red hooves leave prints that burn and smolder for days, and a single demonic horn curls from their brows. Once free of Hell, these steeds typically buck their riders and race off across the prairielands, setting blazes as they go, apparently seeking to wreak as much havoc as they can before they’re reclaimed by Hell.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Havoc and suffering
trans-unit.target: Motive: Havoc and suffering

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere; sometimes ridden as a mount by the powerful or foolish
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere; sometimes ridden as a mount by the powerful or foolish

trans-unit.source: Health: 21
trans-unit.target: Health: 21

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 5 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 5 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 1 (10 against fire)
trans-unit.target: Armor: 1 (10 against fire)

trans-unit.source: Combat: Hellfire steeds attack twice each round with their horn.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Hellfire steeds attack twice each round with their horn.

trans-unit.source: Hellfire steeds also have one or more of the following traits.
trans-unit.target: Hellfire steeds also have one or more of the following traits.

trans-unit.source: Fires of the Underworld: Anyone not chosen as a rider by the hellfire steed that ends a turn within immediate range of the creature takes 2 points of damage from hellish heat.
trans-unit.target: Fires of the Underworld: Anyone not chosen as a rider by the hellfire steed that ends a turn within immediate range of the creature takes 2 points of damage from hellish heat.

trans-unit.source: Lifedraining Horn: The hellfire steed deals an additional 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) with its horn attack once every few minutes, gaining that drained life as health.
trans-unit.target: Lifedraining Horn: The hellfire steed deals an additional 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) with its horn attack once every few minutes, gaining that drained life as health.

trans-unit.source: Render Immune to Fire: If the hellfire steed is compelled or agrees to serve as a mount, the steed’s rider takes no damage from the steed’s Fires of the Underworld and gains +2 Armor against fire from other sources while riding.
trans-unit.target: Render Immune to Fire: If the hellfire steed is compelled or agrees to serve as a mount, the steed’s rider takes no damage from the steed’s Fires of the Underworld and gains +2 Armor against fire from other sources while riding.

trans-unit.source: From Hell: Once per year, a hellfire steed can emerge from or enter Hell through a transitory portal, bearing riders if it chooses. Death Gallop: If killed, a hellfire steed’s body animates one last time, galloping a long distance before turning to ash. Everyone along its final route takes 5 points of fire damage on a failed Speed defense roll.
trans-unit.target: From Hell: Once per year, a hellfire steed can emerge from or enter Hell through a transitory portal, bearing riders if it chooses. Death Gallop: If killed, a hellfire steed’s body animates one last time, galloping a long distance before turning to ash. Everyone along its final route takes 5 points of fire damage on a failed Speed defense roll.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Though usually driven by demonic desire, hellfire steeds are fully sapient and can speak all languages. They may negotiate with someone seeking to use them as a mount, but only in return for a promise of committing atrocities.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Though usually driven by demonic desire, hellfire steeds are fully sapient and can speak all languages. They may negotiate with someone seeking to use them as a mount, but only in return for a promise of committing atrocities.

trans-unit.source: Use: Stuck in Hell or a similarly hellish place, characters may have to ask a hellfire steed for a ride out.
trans-unit.target: Use: Stuck in Hell or a similarly hellish place, characters may have to ask a hellfire steed for a ride out.

trans-unit.source: Loot: A hellfire steed’s horn is a sought‑after alchemist ingredient; a full horn is a very expensive item. GM intrusion: The steed decides it no longer wants the character as a rider and takes back their immunity to fire.
