trans-unit.target: Loot: A hellfire steed’s horn is a sought‑after alchemist ingredient; a full horn is a very expensive item. GM intrusion: The steed decides it no longer wants the character as a rider and takes back their immunity to fire.

trans-unit.source: SULFUR STALKER 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: SULFUR STALKER 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: Dwelling in steaming, acidic hot springs, sulfur stalkers’ umbral, scaled bodies can reach lengths of 10 or more feet (3 m). Their broad, flat heads feature wide, gaping mouths filled with rows of sharp teeth. Feathery tendrils fringe their heads, twining and stretching as if of their own accord. Powerful clawed limbs and an eel‑like tail mean they’re equally adept on land and in liquid—even boiling hot, acrid springs. The overpowering smell of sulfur—like rotten eggs—precedes and follows them.
trans-unit.target: Dwelling in steaming, acidic hot springs, sulfur stalkers’ umbral, scaled bodies can reach lengths of 10 or more feet (3 m). Their broad, flat heads feature wide, gaping mouths filled with rows of sharp teeth. Feathery tendrils fringe their heads, twining and stretching as if of their own accord. Powerful clawed limbs and an eel‑like tail mean they’re equally adept on land and in liquid—even boiling hot, acrid springs. The overpowering smell of sulfur—like rotten eggs—precedes and follows them.

trans-unit.source: Sulfur stalkers periodically emerge from their pools and migrate long distances, presumably to mate. During this migration, they grow ravenously hungry, preying on anything. They also drag away people, which they feed to their newly hatched young.
trans-unit.target: Sulfur stalkers periodically emerge from their pools and migrate long distances, presumably to mate. During this migration, they grow ravenously hungry, preying on anything. They also drag away people, which they feed to their newly hatched young.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Defense, gather food for newly hatched young
trans-unit.target: Motive: Defense, gather food for newly hatched young

trans-unit.source: Environment: Anywhere near hot springs, or anywhere during seasons of migration
trans-unit.target: Environment: Anywhere near hot springs, or anywhere during seasons of migration

trans-unit.source: Health: 21
trans-unit.target: Health: 21

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 6 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 6 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 2 (5 against fire; immune to acid)
trans-unit.target: Armor: 2 (5 against fire; immune to acid)

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; swims a short distance each round
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; swims a short distance each round

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 4 due to size; stealth as level 6
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 4 due to size; stealth as level 6

trans-unit.source: Combat: Sulfur stalkers bite.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Sulfur stalkers bite.

trans-unit.source: Additional sulfur stalker abilities include one or more of the following.
trans-unit.target: Additional sulfur stalker abilities include one or more of the following.

trans-unit.source: Tendril Aura: Any creature that begins their turn within immediate range of a sulfur stalker must succeed on a Speed defense roll or be grazed by a feathery tendril for 3 points of damage from dripping acid.
trans-unit.target: Tendril Aura: Any creature that begins their turn within immediate range of a sulfur stalker must succeed on a Speed defense roll or be grazed by a feathery tendril for 3 points of damage from dripping acid.

trans-unit.source: Acid Geyser: A boiling‑hot acid stream sprays all creatures in a short‑range line, dealing 9 points of damage on a failed Speed defense roll, and 2 points of damage even if successful. (The sulfur stalker can’t make this attack more than once every few minutes.)
trans-unit.target: Acid Geyser: A boiling‑hot acid stream sprays all creatures in a short‑range line, dealing 9 points of damage on a failed Speed defense roll, and 2 points of damage even if successful. (The sulfur stalker can’t make this attack more than once every few minutes.)

trans-unit.source: Regrow: If damaged, a sulfur stalker regains 2 health each round on any round it hasn’t taken damage from cold or magic. This ability is so pernicious that an entirely new sulfur stalker could grow from a severed portion.
trans-unit.target: Regrow: If damaged, a sulfur stalker regains 2 health each round on any round it hasn’t taken damage from cold or magic. This ability is so pernicious that an entirely new sulfur stalker could grow from a severed portion.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Sulfur stalkers have a language, and some can speak human tongues, especially those that have made deals with locals. Such deals usually involve turning over some number of other people each year for the stalker to eat—culled from a local jail, taken in outlaw raids, etc.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Sulfur stalkers have a language, and some can speak human tongues, especially those that have made deals with locals. Such deals usually involve turning over some number of other people each year for the stalker to eat—culled from a local jail, taken in outlaw raids, etc.

trans-unit.source: Use: A bounty for sulfur stalker eggs is so generous that folks everywhere begin hunting. This riles up the local stalker population, who begin attacking towns and homesteads preemptively.
trans-unit.target: Use: A bounty for sulfur stalker eggs is so generous that folks everywhere begin hunting. This riles up the local stalker population, who begin attacking towns and homesteads preemptively.

trans-unit.source: Loot: Because sulfur stalkers tend to capture people to feed their young, cast‑off belongings can sometimes be found in their nests—which are well‑hidden locations near hot springs, but not under them. In addition, a nest might contain an egg or two, each equal in value to an expensive item. GM intrusion: A severed segment of a sulfur stalker animates as a half‑size, level 3 sulfur stalker that attacks the character. The stalker might have to bite off its tail to start this process
trans-unit.target: Loot: Because sulfur stalkers tend to capture people to feed their young, cast‑off belongings can sometimes be found in their nests—which are well‑hidden locations near hot springs, but not under them. In addition, a nest might contain an egg or two, each equal in value to an expensive item. GM intrusion: A severed segment of a sulfur stalker animates as a half‑size, level 3 sulfur stalker that attacks the character. The stalker might have to bite off its tail to start this process

trans-unit.source: FORGEBORN
trans-unit.target: FORGEBORN

trans-unit.source: Forgeborn—also called golems—are animate figures of metal, reanimated flesh, or other normally inert materials. They are constructed for a specific purpose; an angalith is usually
trans-unit.target: Forgeborn—also called golems—are animate figures of metal, reanimated flesh, or other normally inert materials. They are constructed for a specific purpose; an angalith is usually

trans-unit.source: sent to punish or guard, and inkubuses are commonly seeded as spies or assassins.
trans-unit.target: sent to punish or guard, and inkubuses are commonly seeded as spies or assassins.

trans-unit.source: Most forgeborn have the following traits:
trans-unit.target: Most forgeborn have the following traits:

trans-unit.source: Dim: Most forgeborn (though there are many exceptions) aren’t quick thinkers; their
trans-unit.target: Dim: Most forgeborn (though there are many exceptions) aren’t quick thinkers; their

trans-unit.source: Intellect defense against being tricked or mentally attacked is level 2.
trans-unit.target: Intellect defense against being tricked or mentally attacked is level 2.

trans-unit.source: Temperamental: A forgeborn can break free of the spells that bind them to service for brief periods. This happens automatically two rounds after the forgeborn fails an Intellect defense roll against an attack or attempt to control them. The triggered forgeborn attacks twice each round for two or three rounds, choosing targets indiscriminately but preferring anyone who attempted to control them.
trans-unit.target: Temperamental: A forgeborn can break free of the spells that bind them to service for brief periods. This happens automatically two rounds after the forgeborn fails an Intellect defense roll against an attack or attempt to control them. The triggered forgeborn attacks twice each round for two or three rounds, choosing targets indiscriminately but preferring anyone who attempted to control them.

trans-unit.source: Resistant: Forgeborn cannot be stunned or dazed. They are immune to most poisons and disease.
trans-unit.target: Resistant: Forgeborn cannot be stunned or dazed. They are immune to most poisons and disease.

trans-unit.source: Quiet: Most forgeborn can’t speak (but some can).
trans-unit.target: Quiet: Most forgeborn can’t speak (but some can).

trans-unit.source: Locomotem: 20‑foot (6 m) tall humanoid figure fabricated from a coal‑fed train engine.
trans-unit.target: Locomotem: 20‑foot (6 m) tall humanoid figure fabricated from a coal‑fed train engine.

trans-unit.source: Level 6, Speed defense as level 4 due to size; health 30; Armor 5; steam whistle (once per hour) stuns creatures in immediate range on failed Might defense roll
trans-unit.target: Level 6, Speed defense as level 4 due to size; health 30; Armor 5; steam whistle (once per hour) stuns creatures in immediate range on failed Might defense roll

trans-unit.source: Fleshmare: Made from the stitched‑together flesh of deceased horses.
trans-unit.target: Fleshmare: Made from the stitched‑together flesh of deceased horses.

trans-unit.source: Level 4; health 24; Armor 3; hoof attack deals 6 points of damage; electrical damage heals instead of harms fleshmare
trans-unit.target: Level 4; health 24; Armor 3; hoof attack deals 6 points of damage; electrical damage heals instead of harms fleshmare

trans-unit.source: Alchehemoth: 10‑foot (3 m) tall humanoid figure fabricated from a metallic whiskey still.
trans-unit.target: Alchehemoth: 10‑foot (3 m) tall humanoid figure fabricated from a metallic whiskey still.

trans-unit.source: Level 5, Speed defense as level 4 due to size; health 27; fists deal 7 points of damage; inebriating breath causes creatures in immediate range to fall into booze‑fueled slumber for one hour on failed Might defense roll
trans-unit.target: Level 5, Speed defense as level 4 due to size; health 27; fists deal 7 points of damage; inebriating breath causes creatures in immediate range to fall into booze‑fueled slumber for one hour on failed Might defense roll

trans-unit.source: ANGALITH 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: ANGALITH 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: An angalith—a forgeborn fabricated from prismatic stained glass windows taken from cathedrals and churches—is a 15‑foot (4.5 m) tall figure. Motive: Follow the will of their creator (but actually, break the control of their creator or whoever has control over them; see Temperamental)
trans-unit.target: An angalith—a forgeborn fabricated from prismatic stained glass windows taken from cathedrals and churches—is a 15‑foot (4.5 m) tall figure. Motive: Follow the will of their creator (but actually, break the control of their creator or whoever has control over them; see Temperamental)

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere

trans-unit.source: Health: 27
trans-unit.target: Health: 27

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 7 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 7 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 3
trans-unit.target: Armor: 3

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; long when flying
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; long when flying

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Intellect defense as level 2; Speed defense as level 4 due to size
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Intellect defense as level 2; Speed defense as level 4 due to size

trans-unit.source: Combat: Angaliths slice foes with jagged edges of their stained glass wings.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Angaliths slice foes with jagged edges of their stained glass wings.

trans-unit.source: Angaliths have the following additional abilities and traits.
trans-unit.target: Angaliths have the following additional abilities and traits.

trans-unit.source: Prismatic Blaze: Six prismatic shafts of light shine from the angalith’s core as their action, illuminating the sins of all creatures within short range (no more than once each minute). A given target is subject to only one shaft of light, which they must make an Intellect defense roll to resist. Choose or roll for which sin is brought to light for each target.
trans-unit.target: Prismatic Blaze: Six prismatic shafts of light shine from the angalith’s core as their action, illuminating the sins of all creatures within short range (no more than once each minute). A given target is subject to only one shaft of light, which they must make an Intellect defense roll to resist. Choose or roll for which sin is brought to light for each target.

trans-unit.source: Red (Wrath): Target attacks an ally on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Red (Wrath): Target attacks an ally on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Orange (Envy): Target throws mud/dung/etc. in the face of an ally on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Orange (Envy): Target throws mud/dung/etc. in the face of an ally on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Yellow (Apathy): Target sits down and stares into space on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Yellow (Apathy): Target sits down and stares into space on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Green (Greed): Target attempts to steal something from an ally on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Green (Greed): Target attempts to steal something from an ally on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Blue (Gluttony): Target chows down nearest food—or goes looking for some—on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Blue (Gluttony): Target chows down nearest food—or goes looking for some—on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Indigo (Pride): Target sniffs disdainfully and walks away from the combat on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Indigo (Pride): Target sniffs disdainfully and walks away from the combat on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Forgeborn Traits: Angaliths are Dim, Temperamental, Resistant, and Quiet.
trans-unit.target: Forgeborn Traits: Angaliths are Dim, Temperamental, Resistant, and Quiet.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Angaliths resonate with the worship and faith their component parts once witnessed. Often, that faith was preaching about the welfare of other beings, so they may stop to help those in need. But if they see someone act against the common good, in an angalith’s estimation, that someone is due only hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Angaliths resonate with the worship and faith their component parts once witnessed. Often, that faith was preaching about the welfare of other beings, so they may stop to help those in need. But if they see someone act against the common good, in an angalith’s estimation, that someone is due only hellfire.

trans-unit.source: Use: Angaliths—like most forgeborn—are tough encounters even for those who are tooled up for a fight. However, they can be assuaged with promises of saintly acts or demonstrations of good works, which could turn an angry angalith found in a demolished church into a temporary ally.
trans-unit.target: Use: Angaliths—like most forgeborn—are tough encounters even for those who are tooled up for a fight. However, they can be assuaged with promises of saintly acts or demonstrations of good works, which could turn an angry angalith found in a demolished church into a temporary ally.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The character sliced by the jagged edge of a stained glass wing begins bleeding for 1 ambient damage each round until someone succeeds on a difficulty 3 healing task to stop the flow.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The character sliced by the jagged edge of a stained glass wing begins bleeding for 1 ambient damage each round until someone succeeds on a difficulty 3 healing task to stop the flow.

trans-unit.source: INKUBUS 4 (12)
trans-unit.target: INKUBUS 4 (12)

trans-unit.source: An inkubus enjoys two different states of being. One is as an alchemically marked‑up page, whether that’s a sheet in a book or newspaper, a letter, a broadsheet, or a wanted poster. There’s little to distinguish this inkubus “seed” from regular paper without a concerted search for magical influence. Each seed has a trigger, set by the alchemist who created it. The trigger could be when the page is read, when a certain amount of time is expired, when a specified individual sees the page, or something else.
trans-unit.target: An inkubus enjoys two different states of being. One is as an alchemically marked‑up page, whether that’s a sheet in a book or newspaper, a letter, a broadsheet, or a wanted poster. There’s little to distinguish this inkubus “seed” from regular paper without a concerted search for magical influence. Each seed has a trigger, set by the alchemist who created it. The trigger could be when the page is read, when a certain amount of time is expired, when a specified individual sees the page, or something else.

trans-unit.source: A triggered inkubus takes on substance either immediately, as nearby paper swirls in and accretes around the seed, or gradually, if the inkubus is meant to remain unobtrusive (as often happens when the seed is a wanted poster whose target just wandered by).
trans-unit.target: A triggered inkubus takes on substance either immediately, as nearby paper swirls in and accretes around the seed, or gradually, if the inkubus is meant to remain unobtrusive (as often happens when the seed is a wanted poster whose target just wandered by).

trans-unit.source: When fully embodied, an inkubus appears as a human‑sized dragonfly‑like paper sculpture covered in constantly scrolling words.
trans-unit.target: When fully embodied, an inkubus appears as a human‑sized dragonfly‑like paper sculpture covered in constantly scrolling words.

trans-unit.source: Motive: As determined when seeded (but actually, break the control of their creator or whoever has control over them; see Temperamental)
trans-unit.target: Motive: As determined when seeded (but actually, break the control of their creator or whoever has control over them; see Temperamental)

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere

trans-unit.source: Health: 21
trans-unit.target: Health: 21

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 5 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 5 points

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; long when flying
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; long when flying

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Stealth as level 8 (when not fully manifest)
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Stealth as level 8 (when not fully manifest)

trans-unit.source: Combat: Inkubuses slice targets with knife‑sharp paper cuts as their attack.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Inkubuses slice targets with knife‑sharp paper cuts as their attack.

trans-unit.source: Inkubuses may have one or more of the following additional traits, depending on their purpose.
trans-unit.target: Inkubuses may have one or more of the following additional traits, depending on their purpose.

trans-unit.source: Word of Power: An inkubus contains a “word of power” that it can display as an action once per day. A target in short range who sees it and fails an Intellect defense roll is affected as indicated for one minute (or longer for Forget):
trans-unit.target: Word of Power: An inkubus contains a “word of power” that it can display as an action once per day. A target in short range who sees it and fails an Intellect defense roll is affected as indicated for one minute (or longer for Forget):

trans-unit.source: Stunned: Target takes no action.
trans-unit.target: Stunned: Target takes no action.

trans-unit.source: Confess: Target starts with their most egregious crimes/secrets, one per turn.
trans-unit.target: Confess: Target starts with their most egregious crimes/secrets, one per turn.

trans-unit.source: Betray: Target attacks nearby allies.
trans-unit.target: Betray: Target attacks nearby allies.

trans-unit.source: Forget: Target goes back to whatever they were doing and doesn’t remember meeting the inkubus unless or until they meet again.
trans-unit.target: Forget: Target goes back to whatever they were doing and doesn’t remember meeting the inkubus unless or until they meet again.

trans-unit.source: Words on the Floor: The inkubus can send written words to their creator (or anyone), such as a warning, an update on their status, or some other predetermined signal. Words appear on a surface near the creator.
trans-unit.target: Words on the Floor: The inkubus can send written words to their creator (or anyone), such as a warning, an update on their status, or some other predetermined signal. Words appear on a surface near the creator.

trans-unit.source: Forgeborn Traits: Inkubuses are Resistant and Temperamental.
trans-unit.target: Forgeborn Traits: Inkubuses are Resistant and Temperamental.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: The inkubus is more self‑aware than most other forgeborn, and may interact with characters by using its Words on the Floor ability.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: The inkubus is more self‑aware than most other forgeborn, and may interact with characters by using its Words on the Floor ability.

trans-unit.source: Use: The PCs receive a letter from a famous alchemist, which becomes an inkubus that relays the alchemist’s message (an invitation, a warning, a threat, or something else).
trans-unit.target: Use: The PCs receive a letter from a famous alchemist, which becomes an inkubus that relays the alchemist’s message (an invitation, a warning, a threat, or something else).

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: Important documents or other papers the character carries flap away and become part of the inkubus.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: Important documents or other papers the character carries flap away and become part of the inkubus.

trans-unit.source: GUNFIGHTERS
trans-unit.target: GUNFIGHTERS

trans-unit.source: Gunfighters live and die by their six‑chambered peacemakers using a threatened—or actual—lightning‑quick draw to accomplish their aims. Most gunfighters are regular folks who practice their craft so diligently that they become the best, at least until they measure themselves against a desperado who’s a smidge faster. Most gunfighters in a weird west setting have a bit of the supernatural about them, but one variety of gunfighter, known as a hex gunner, explicitly mixes magic with bullets.
trans-unit.target: Gunfighters live and die by their six‑chambered peacemakers using a threatened—or actual—lightning‑quick draw to accomplish their aims. Most gunfighters are regular folks who practice their craft so diligently that they become the best, at least until they measure themselves against a desperado who’s a smidge faster. Most gunfighters in a weird west setting have a bit of the supernatural about them, but one variety of gunfighter, known as a hex gunner, explicitly mixes magic with bullets.

trans-unit.source: Bounty hunter: Figure in sleek, form‑fitting dark duster and wide‑brimmed hat with twin guns.
trans-unit.target: Bounty hunter: Figure in sleek, form‑fitting dark duster and wide‑brimmed hat with twin guns.

trans-unit.source: Level 4; tracking, surveillance, stealth, and disguise as level 6; health 15; Armor 1; attacks twice with long‑range pistol; a melee attack with locking cuffs (level 5) binds target to a nearby large object on a failed Speed defense roll
trans-unit.target: Level 4; tracking, surveillance, stealth, and disguise as level 6; health 15; Armor 1; attacks twice with long‑range pistol; a melee attack with locking cuffs (level 5) binds target to a nearby large object on a failed Speed defense roll

trans-unit.source: Deadshot: Eight-foot (3 m) figure stitched together from the reanimated flesh of deceased gunslingers.
trans-unit.target: Deadshot: Eight-foot (3 m) figure stitched together from the reanimated flesh of deceased gunslingers.

trans-unit.source: Level 5; initiative as level 8; health 27; Armor 4; long‑range pistol attack deals 7 points of damage; once a minute fires necrotic bullet that deals 3 points of damage each round (ignores Armor) until bullet extracted with a difficulty 4 healing task
trans-unit.target: Level 5; initiative as level 8; health 27; Armor 4; long‑range pistol attack deals 7 points of damage; once a minute fires necrotic bullet that deals 3 points of damage each round (ignores Armor) until bullet extracted with a difficulty 4 healing task

trans-unit.source: Gunslinger: Grim‑faced pistoleer pursuing vengeance, doing crime, or making a name for themself.
trans-unit.target: Gunslinger: Grim‑faced pistoleer pursuing vengeance, doing crime, or making a name for themself.

trans-unit.source: Level 4, initiative as level 7; health 18; Armor 1; long‑range pistol attack deals 6 points of damage (or 8 points with eased attack if they attack before their foe); every hit increases damage by 1 point for the rest of the encounter (to a maximum of +10)
trans-unit.target: Level 4, initiative as level 7; health 18; Armor 1; long‑range pistol attack deals 6 points of damage (or 8 points with eased attack if they attack before their foe); every hit increases damage by 1 point for the rest of the encounter (to a maximum of +10)

trans-unit.source: Lawman: Driven by a dream of justice, a lawman enforces rules even when no one else will.
trans-unit.target: Lawman: Driven by a dream of justice, a lawman enforces rules even when no one else will.

trans-unit.source: Level 5, Might defense as level 6; health 20; Armor 1; long‑range rifle attacks; the first time a lawman would normally succumb to their wounds (having lost all their health), they instead gain a second wind (and 10 health); banishing rounds deal full damage to ghosts and similarly protected creatures
trans-unit.target: Level 5, Might defense as level 6; health 20; Armor 1; long‑range rifle attacks; the first time a lawman would normally succumb to their wounds (having lost all their health), they instead gain a second wind (and 10 health); banishing rounds deal full damage to ghosts and similarly protected creatures

trans-unit.source: HEX GUNNER 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: HEX GUNNER 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: Hex gunners weave iron and lead with Hellish sorcery. Gifts from a demon gained during a crossroads deal, a hex gunner’s six‑shooters are demonic constructs that grant the equivalent of years of practice and occult study. Their bullets whisper in the chamber, smoking with necromancy, then scream with exultant, hellish fury when fired. Each round is imbued with fragments of souls from those the hex gunner has previously defeated in gunfights.
trans-unit.target: Hex gunners weave iron and lead with Hellish sorcery. Gifts from a demon gained during a crossroads deal, a hex gunner’s six‑shooters are demonic constructs that grant the equivalent of years of practice and occult study. Their bullets whisper in the chamber, smoking with necromancy, then scream with exultant, hellish fury when fired. Each round is imbued with fragments of souls from those the hex gunner has previously defeated in gunfights.

trans-unit.source: Hex gunners may be pledged to a literal lord of Hell (or some other occult being of damnation and pain, such as a ghost rider). Only if they harvest a certain number of souls during their gunfighting career is their own soul safe from being claimed when their life ends. That value may be visible as a glowing number burning in their eyes.
trans-unit.target: Hex gunners may be pledged to a literal lord of Hell (or some other occult being of damnation and pain, such as a ghost rider). Only if they harvest a certain number of souls during their gunfighting career is their own soul safe from being claimed when their life ends. That value may be visible as a glowing number burning in their eyes.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Reap souls for Hell
trans-unit.target: Motive: Reap souls for Hell

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere

trans-unit.source: Health: 23
trans-unit.target: Health: 23

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 5 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 5 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 2
trans-unit.target: Armor: 2

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; long while riding a horse
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; long while riding a horse

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Initiative as level 7
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Initiative as level 7

trans-unit.source: Combat: A hex gunner makes two long‑range pistol attacks as their action.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A hex gunner makes two long‑range pistol attacks as their action.

trans-unit.source: A hex gunner also has one or both of the following abilities.
trans-unit.target: A hex gunner also has one or both of the following abilities.

trans-unit.source: Hell‑Hexed Rounds: A bullet that deals damage stays in the wound on a hit, cursing the target until the bullet is surgically removed (each requiring a successful difficulty 6 healing task and inflicting 1 point of ambient damage). Curses vary, including:
trans-unit.target: Hell‑Hexed Rounds: A bullet that deals damage stays in the wound on a hit, cursing the target until the bullet is surgically removed (each requiring a successful difficulty 6 healing task and inflicting 1 point of ambient damage). Curses vary, including:

trans-unit.source: Soul of damned previous target possesses the new target once per day for one minute on a failed Intellect defense roll. Possessing spirit may work against target, or simply take off seeking some goal of their own.
trans-unit.target: Soul of damned previous target possesses the new target once per day for one minute on a failed Intellect defense roll. Possessing spirit may work against target, or simply take off seeking some goal of their own.

trans-unit.source: Wound leaks a horrific smell and discharge; target’s pleasant interaction tasks are hindered by two steps.
trans-unit.target: Wound leaks a horrific smell and discharge; target’s pleasant interaction tasks are hindered by two steps.

trans-unit.source: Target’s GM intrusion range increases by 1 until bullet is removed.
trans-unit.target: Target’s GM intrusion range increases by 1 until bullet is removed.

trans-unit.source: Grave Round: If they shoot a corpse, the corpse rises as a zombie that serves the hex gunner for a day. During this period, the zombie can reveal secrets it knew in life to the hex gunner.
trans-unit.target: Grave Round: If they shoot a corpse, the corpse rises as a zombie that serves the hex gunner for a day. During this period, the zombie can reveal secrets it knew in life to the hex gunner.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Hex gunners are mainly concerned with reaping more souls for whoever they are pledged to. Usually, they prefer those souls be already tainted by evil, but hex gunners are angry and impatient as a rule and have nearly as little sympathy for the innocent as they do for the damned.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Hex gunners are mainly concerned with reaping more souls for whoever they are pledged to. Usually, they prefer those souls be already tainted by evil, but hex gunners are angry and impatient as a rule and have nearly as little sympathy for the innocent as they do for the damned.

trans-unit.source: Use: PCs need information from someone who died. They learn that a “hex gunner” who dwells nearby may be able to communicate with the body.
trans-unit.target: Use: PCs need information from someone who died. They learn that a “hex gunner” who dwells nearby may be able to communicate with the body.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The hex gunner releases a demon from their gun that immediately attacks the character
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The hex gunner releases a demon from their gun that immediately attacks the character

trans-unit.source: NECROVORE
trans-unit.target: NECROVORE

trans-unit.source: Necrovores—otherwise known as undead—are what some call those that feed on death, those that are dead but still move, those that feed on life, and all things that lie somewhere in between. Now, some might quibble about using “necrovore” for such a wide range of creatures. But does it make a lick of difference if you call a shade of the tomb—a wraith that takes form from a gravestone’s shadow—a necrovore, a demon, or an undead when it’s draining all joy from existence? Nope. Same holds true for a deathbinder, hollowed ranger, risen (also called Damned), and tombdrift.
trans-unit.target: Necrovores—otherwise known as undead—are what some call those that feed on death, those that are dead but still move, those that feed on life, and all things that lie somewhere in between. Now, some might quibble about using “necrovore” for such a wide range of creatures. But does it make a lick of difference if you call a shade of the tomb—a wraith that takes form from a gravestone’s shadow—a necrovore, a demon, or an undead when it’s draining all joy from existence? Nope. Same holds true for a deathbinder, hollowed ranger, risen (also called Damned), and tombdrift.

trans-unit.source: Ghost Rider: Harbingers of chaos and catastrophe, ghost riders spread havoc long past their deaths.
trans-unit.target: Ghost Rider: Harbingers of chaos and catastrophe, ghost riders spread havoc long past their deaths.

trans-unit.source: Level 6; health 20; Armor 1; rides a skeletal mount a long distance each round; long‑range pistol attack deals 6 damage; short‑range curse causes target who fails an Intellect defense roll to lose their next turn as they freeze in terror Wraith Lord: A malign artifact or especially powerful curse may form an exceptional wraith.
trans-unit.target: Level 6; health 20; Armor 1; rides a skeletal mount a long distance each round; long‑range pistol attack deals 6 damage; short‑range curse causes target who fails an Intellect defense roll to lose their next turn as they freeze in terror Wraith Lord: A malign artifact or especially powerful curse may form an exceptional wraith.

trans-unit.source: Level 5, stealth as level 6; health 22; Armor 1; flies a short distance each round (or is mounted on a quetzalsaur); spectral weapon deals 6 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) and induces target to fall one step on the damage track each day a Might defense roll fails (three successes purge the effect); if destroyed, a wraith usually reforms the following midnight
trans-unit.target: Level 5, stealth as level 6; health 22; Armor 1; flies a short distance each round (or is mounted on a quetzalsaur); spectral weapon deals 6 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) and induces target to fall one step on the damage track each day a Might defense roll fails (three successes purge the effect); if destroyed, a wraith usually reforms the following midnight

trans-unit.source: Zombie sorcerer: Magic‑infused corpse that knows enough sorcery to be dangerous.
trans-unit.target: Zombie sorcerer: Magic‑infused corpse that knows enough sorcery to be dangerous.

trans-unit.source: Level 4; health 18; moves an immediate distance each round; long‑range necrotic blast deals 4 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) to all in an immediate area, or 1 point even with a successful defense roll; even‑numbered attack rolls that would reduce its health to 0 reduce health to 1 instead
trans-unit.target: Level 4; health 18; moves an immediate distance each round; long‑range necrotic blast deals 4 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) to all in an immediate area, or 1 point even with a successful defense roll; even‑numbered attack rolls that would reduce its health to 0 reduce health to 1 instead

trans-unit.source: DEATHBINDER 7(21)
trans-unit.target: DEATHBINDER 7(21)

trans-unit.source: Alchemists who learn enough science and magic to retain corporeal existence after death, like risen, might transition to necrovore status. Unlike a risen, a deathbinder ensures their eternal existence by placing splinters of their soul into six bullets chambered in a “soul pistol.” If all six bullets are fired, the deathbinder is finally destroyed.
trans-unit.target: Alchemists who learn enough science and magic to retain corporeal existence after death, like risen, might transition to necrovore status. Unlike a risen, a deathbinder ensures their eternal existence by placing splinters of their soul into six bullets chambered in a “soul pistol.” If all six bullets are fired, the deathbinder is finally destroyed.

trans-unit.source: Two pistols are holstered on a deathbinder’s gun belt: the deathbinder’s soul pistol, which they reserve for special circumstances, and their “workaday” six‑shooter, loaded with unique alchemical rounds.
trans-unit.target: Two pistols are holstered on a deathbinder’s gun belt: the deathbinder’s soul pistol, which they reserve for special circumstances, and their “workaday” six‑shooter, loaded with unique alchemical rounds.

trans-unit.source: A deathbinder usually resides alone, herding cursed beasts or forgeborn creatures of their own creation, probably astride a fleshmare.
trans-unit.target: A deathbinder usually resides alone, herding cursed beasts or forgeborn creatures of their own creation, probably astride a fleshmare.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Continue alchemical studies and magical collection without interruption
trans-unit.target: Motive: Continue alchemical studies and magical collection without interruption

trans-unit.source: Environment: Wilderness, ghost towns, and other underpopulated areas
trans-unit.target: Environment: Wilderness, ghost towns, and other underpopulated areas

trans-unit.source: Health: 27
trans-unit.target: Health: 27

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 7 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 7 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 2
trans-unit.target: Armor: 2

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short

trans-unit.source: Combat: A deathbinder attacks twice each round with long‑range pistol attacks.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A deathbinder attacks twice each round with long‑range pistol attacks.

trans-unit.source: The deathbinder also has most or all of the following attacks and traits.
trans-unit.target: The deathbinder also has most or all of the following attacks and traits.

trans-unit.source: Alchemical Pistol: Targets hit by a “workaday” pistol shot take damage and, on a failed Might or Intellect defense roll, suffer one additional effect:
trans-unit.target: Alchemical Pistol: Targets hit by a “workaday” pistol shot take damage and, on a failed Might or Intellect defense roll, suffer one additional effect:

trans-unit.source: Target is frozen in amber until they can escape.
trans-unit.target: Target is frozen in amber until they can escape.

trans-unit.source: Deathbinder learns one of the target’s secrets.
trans-unit.target: Deathbinder learns one of the target’s secrets.

trans-unit.source: Target is teleported to a pre‑prepared nearby location.
trans-unit.target: Target is teleported to a pre‑prepared nearby location.

trans-unit.source: Soul Pistol: Under extreme circumstances, a deathbinder may fire a precious bullet from their soul pistol, hoping they’ll have a chance later to rebind the liberated soul energy. A bullet from the soul gun has all of the following deadly traits:
trans-unit.target: Soul Pistol: Under extreme circumstances, a deathbinder may fire a precious bullet from their soul pistol, hoping they’ll have a chance later to rebind the liberated soul energy. A bullet from the soul gun has all of the following deadly traits:

trans-unit.source: Automatically hits target within long range—a targeted PC should get a GM intrusion for this attack.
trans-unit.target: Automatically hits target within long range—a targeted PC should get a GM intrusion for this attack.

trans-unit.source: The soul round deals damage and the character descends two steps on the damage track, or one step on a successful Might defense roll.
trans-unit.target: The soul round deals damage and the character descends two steps on the damage track, or one step on a successful Might defense roll.

trans-unit.source: Target is cursed on a failed Intellect defense roll.
trans-unit.target: Target is cursed on a failed Intellect defense roll.

trans-unit.source: Alchemical Resurrection: If destroyed, a deathbinder usually reforms within 1d6 days unless all six bullets from their soul pistol are fired.
trans-unit.target: Alchemical Resurrection: If destroyed, a deathbinder usually reforms within 1d6 days unless all six bullets from their soul pistol are fired.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Deathbinders don’t cotton to interruptions because the reason they chose undeath in the first place was to pursue a specialized purpose—usually, even deeper secrets of alchemy and/or collecting more unique magical artifacts and treasures.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Deathbinders don’t cotton to interruptions because the reason they chose undeath in the first place was to pursue a specialized purpose—usually, even deeper secrets of alchemy and/or collecting more unique magical artifacts and treasures.

trans-unit.source: Use: A herd of ghost cattle wanders into town and causes problems. Folks say it’s the fault of the “lich cowboy” who lives out in the wastes.
trans-unit.target: Use: A herd of ghost cattle wanders into town and causes problems. Folks say it’s the fault of the “lich cowboy” who lives out in the wastes.

trans-unit.source: Loot: The deathbinder’s pistols have uniquely powerful rounds loaded in them; roll once on the Alchemical Rounds and Slugs table.
trans-unit.target: Loot: The deathbinder’s pistols have uniquely powerful rounds loaded in them; roll once on the Alchemical Rounds and Slugs table.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The deathbinder makes an extra pistol attack even if it’s not their turn.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The deathbinder makes an extra pistol attack even if it’s not their turn.

trans-unit.source: HOLLOWED RANGER 4 (12)
trans-unit.target: HOLLOWED RANGER 4 (12)

trans-unit.source: Cloaked in a tattered duster and riding nothing but a memory, the necrovore known as a hollowed ranger is a traveling portal to elsewhere—perhaps connecting to a nightmare, the far future after everyone has died, or some region of Hell where corpses shamble beneath an eternal eclipse.
trans-unit.target: Cloaked in a tattered duster and riding nothing but a memory, the necrovore known as a hollowed ranger is a traveling portal to elsewhere—perhaps connecting to a nightmare, the far future after everyone has died, or some region of Hell where corpses shamble beneath an eternal eclipse.

trans-unit.source: Hollowed rangers ride forth where good people were gunned down in cold blood and then dumped in shallow, unmarked graves. The injustice rips a hole in the world, which the murdered spirit possesses and becomes. Unfortunately, a hollowed ranger’s desire for vengeance doesn’t restrict them from visiting horror on most everything they encounter.
trans-unit.target: Hollowed rangers ride forth where good people were gunned down in cold blood and then dumped in shallow, unmarked graves. The injustice rips a hole in the world, which the murdered spirit possesses and becomes. Unfortunately, a hollowed ranger’s desire for vengeance doesn’t restrict them from visiting horror on most everything they encounter.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Vengeance (first against their killer, then their killer’s family and friends, then their killer’s species, and so on)
trans-unit.target: Motive: Vengeance (first against their killer, then their killer’s family and friends, then their killer’s species, and so on)

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere

trans-unit.source: Health: 18
trans-unit.target: Health: 18

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 4 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 4 points

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 6 due to partially non‑existent body
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 6 due to partially non‑existent body

trans-unit.source: Combat: A hollowed ranger’s long‑range entropic bullet—fired from a rifle‑shaped hole in reality—deals 4 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) as a bit of the target’s reality is blasted away.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A hollowed ranger’s long‑range entropic bullet—fired from a rifle‑shaped hole in reality—deals 4 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) as a bit of the target’s reality is blasted away.

trans-unit.source: A hollowed ranger also has the following traits.
trans-unit.target: A hollowed ranger also has the following traits.

trans-unit.source: Necrovore Door: As their action, the ranger shudders as a wraith lord emerges from their body, acting as the ranger wishes for one minute. After one minute, the wraith is drawn back into the ranger, or it just fades. (Other necrovores could instead be called from the deathly realms a hollowed ranger is connected to, but anything level 3 or higher takes two actions to disgorge.)
trans-unit.target: Necrovore Door: As their action, the ranger shudders as a wraith lord emerges from their body, acting as the ranger wishes for one minute. After one minute, the wraith is drawn back into the ranger, or it just fades. (Other necrovores could instead be called from the deathly realms a hollowed ranger is connected to, but anything level 3 or higher takes two actions to disgorge.)

trans-unit.source: Fall Into Oblivion: On a failed Might defense roll, a living creature starting their turn in immediate range of a hollowed ranger is sucked through the hollowed ranger’s form into the deathly realm beyond. This realm is anathema to life—the affected target immediately takes 4 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) from the necrotic energy draining their soul. Affected targets are drained of life each additional round they spend in the deathly realm, but can attempt a Might‑based task to pull themselves back to their reality. The hollowed ranger regains 1 point of health each time an affected target’s soul is so drained.
trans-unit.target: Fall Into Oblivion: On a failed Might defense roll, a living creature starting their turn in immediate range of a hollowed ranger is sucked through the hollowed ranger’s form into the deathly realm beyond. This realm is anathema to life—the affected target immediately takes 4 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) from the necrotic energy draining their soul. Affected targets are drained of life each additional round they spend in the deathly realm, but can attempt a Might‑based task to pull themselves back to their reality. The hollowed ranger regains 1 point of health each time an affected target’s soul is so drained.

trans-unit.source: Door Shift: A hollowed ranger can instantly transport themself miles away as its action, if they have previously been to or seen the other location.
trans-unit.target: Door Shift: A hollowed ranger can instantly transport themself miles away as its action, if they have previously been to or seen the other location.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Speaking with a voice like wind on gravestones, a hollowed ranger may tell of the primary target of their vengeance, deliver a message from a more powerful necrovore, or simply promise to eat the soul of whoever tries negotiating with them.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Speaking with a voice like wind on gravestones, a hollowed ranger may tell of the primary target of their vengeance, deliver a message from a more powerful necrovore, or simply promise to eat the soul of whoever tries negotiating with them.

trans-unit.source: Use: Characters need to travel a huge distance and are told the quickest way is to use the door shift offered by a hollowed ranger, though doing so will require appeasing the ranger in some way.
trans-unit.target: Use: Characters need to travel a huge distance and are told the quickest way is to use the door shift offered by a hollowed ranger, though doing so will require appeasing the ranger in some way.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The character drawn through the hollowed ranger’s form to a deathly realm is attacked by a ghost lurking there.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The character drawn through the hollowed ranger’s form to a deathly realm is attacked by a ghost lurking there.

trans-unit.source: RISEN 4 (12)
trans-unit.target: RISEN 4 (12)

trans-unit.source: Clawed back into “life” thanks to a promise, an alchemical experiment, or a demonic curse straight out of Hell, risen look normal enough—from a distance. Up close, something ain’t right. That’s all the more obvious if the risen is someone folks knew before they died.
trans-unit.target: Clawed back into “life” thanks to a promise, an alchemical experiment, or a demonic curse straight out of Hell, risen look normal enough—from a distance. Up close, something ain’t right. That’s all the more obvious if the risen is someone folks knew before they died.

trans-unit.source: Risen—also known as the Damned—spook horses and set dogs to growling. They have unblinking eyes like coins and skin the color of a snake’s belly, and are naturally as motionless as a corpse when not engaged in an activity. A risen may just want to be left alone, or they could seek to right a wrong, serve as a deathbinder’s herald, or ride in an undead posse looking to take as much as they can from a world they know would just as soon put them back in their grave.
trans-unit.target: Risen—also known as the Damned—spook horses and set dogs to growling. They have unblinking eyes like coins and skin the color of a snake’s belly, and are naturally as motionless as a corpse when not engaged in an activity. A risen may just want to be left alone, or they could seek to right a wrong, serve as a deathbinder’s herald, or ride in an undead posse looking to take as much as they can from a world they know would just as soon put them back in their grave.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Varies
trans-unit.target: Motive: Varies

trans-unit.source: Environment: Out-of-the-way places
trans-unit.target: Environment: Out-of-the-way places

trans-unit.source: Health: 12
trans-unit.target: Health: 12

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 4 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 4 points

trans-unit.source: Armor: 1
trans-unit.target: Armor: 1

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short

trans-unit.source: Combat: A risen makes a long‑range pistol attack.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A risen makes a long‑range pistol attack.

trans-unit.source: Risen also have one or more of the following additional traits.
trans-unit.target: Risen also have one or more of the following additional traits.

trans-unit.source: Damned Rounds: Every other attack against PCs is Hell‑tainted, blazing with hellfire. If one of these bullets strikes true, the target combusts for an additional 3 points of damage (ignores Armor) each round until an action is taken to smother the flames.
trans-unit.target: Damned Rounds: Every other attack against PCs is Hell‑tainted, blazing with hellfire. If one of these bullets strikes true, the target combusts for an additional 3 points of damage (ignores Armor) each round until an action is taken to smother the flames.

trans-unit.source: Necrovore Resilience: The first time in an encounter that a risen would normally succumb to their wounds (having lost all their health), they instead remain active and regain 1 health.
trans-unit.target: Necrovore Resilience: The first time in an encounter that a risen would normally succumb to their wounds (having lost all their health), they instead remain active and regain 1 health.

trans-unit.source: In addition, risen don’t breathe—drowning, suffocation, and similar threats don’t faze them.
trans-unit.target: In addition, risen don’t breathe—drowning, suffocation, and similar threats don’t faze them.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes They Come Back: A destroyed risen might reanimate within a few days, unless its head is removed from its body and separated by a couple of miles, or the body is burned to ash.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes They Come Back: A destroyed risen might reanimate within a few days, unless its head is removed from its body and separated by a couple of miles, or the body is burned to ash.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Risen are rarely excitable; even those bent on mayhem are chillingly quiet as they murder and burn. Some risen are open to negotiation and alliances, while others would as soon shoot as talk.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Risen are rarely excitable; even those bent on mayhem are chillingly quiet as they murder and burn. Some risen are open to negotiation and alliances, while others would as soon shoot as talk.

trans-unit.source: Use: Folks are concerned because someone who looks a lot like Luke Reynolds has taken up farming at the old Reynolds place, even though outlaws killed the whole family.
trans-unit.target: Use: Folks are concerned because someone who looks a lot like Luke Reynolds has taken up farming at the old Reynolds place, even though outlaws killed the whole family.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The character recognizes the risen as someone they personally killed and is dazed with surprise until the end of their next turn, hindering all tasks.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The character recognizes the risen as someone they personally killed and is dazed with surprise until the end of their next turn, hindering all tasks.

trans-unit.source: TOMBDRIFT 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: TOMBDRIFT 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: Necrovore sand dunes 30 feet (9 m) in diameter are sometimes seeded from those who die in the desert and are buried only by shifting sands. When inactive, it’s nearly impossible to distinguish tombdrifts from regular desert dunes. But when one senses life, the necrovore rolls forward like a slow ocean wave, or alternatively, condenses into the shape of the spirit that seeded the undead thing. When assuming the echo of the person who seeded them, tombdrifts might speak. However, keeping such a shape requires energy—the assumed shape is constantly crumbling away and reforming, until it collapses once again into an unquiet, hungry dune.
trans-unit.target: Necrovore sand dunes 30 feet (9 m) in diameter are sometimes seeded from those who die in the desert and are buried only by shifting sands. When inactive, it’s nearly impossible to distinguish tombdrifts from regular desert dunes. But when one senses life, the necrovore rolls forward like a slow ocean wave, or alternatively, condenses into the shape of the spirit that seeded the undead thing. When assuming the echo of the person who seeded them, tombdrifts might speak. However, keeping such a shape requires energy—the assumed shape is constantly crumbling away and reforming, until it collapses once again into an unquiet, hungry dune.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Bury the living; feed on life
trans-unit.target: Motive: Bury the living; feed on life

trans-unit.source: Environment: Desert and badlands
trans-unit.target: Environment: Desert and badlands

trans-unit.source: Health: 23
trans-unit.target: Health: 23

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 5 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 5 points

trans-unit.source: Movement: Immediate (but see Dust Devil Speed)
trans-unit.target: Movement: Immediate (but see Dust Devil Speed)

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 2 due to size
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 2 due to size

trans-unit.source: Combat: The tombdrift abrades every creature in immediate range with scouring sand. The tombdrift is immune to poison, disease, and life‑draining effects.
trans-unit.target: Combat: The tombdrift abrades every creature in immediate range with scouring sand. The tombdrift is immune to poison, disease, and life‑draining effects.

trans-unit.source: They also have one or more of the following attacks and traits.
trans-unit.target: They also have one or more of the following attacks and traits.

trans-unit.source: Drain Life: One target damaged by the tombdrift is subject to life drain, taking 3 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) on a failed Might defense roll. In addition, the target is sickened until the end of their next turn, hindering all tasks. On a successful defense roll, the target still takes 1 point of Speed damage, but isn’t sickened.
trans-unit.target: Drain Life: One target damaged by the tombdrift is subject to life drain, taking 3 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) on a failed Might defense roll. In addition, the target is sickened until the end of their next turn, hindering all tasks. On a successful defense roll, the target still takes 1 point of Speed damage, but isn’t sickened.

trans-unit.source: Dust Devil Speed: The tombdrift spins up into a dust devil of sand that speeds forward a long distance (no more than once every minute), attacking all creatures along the line of travel. On a failed Might defense roll, damaged targets are also blinded on their next turn.
trans-unit.target: Dust Devil Speed: The tombdrift spins up into a dust devil of sand that speeds forward a long distance (no more than once every minute), attacking all creatures along the line of travel. On a failed Might defense roll, damaged targets are also blinded on their next turn.

trans-unit.source: Sand Regeneration: Tombdrifts regain 1 health each round they are in a desert or badlands region, unless they’ve taken damage from banishing rounds or similar anti‑undead attacks (in which case they don’t begin regaining health again for a couple of minutes).
trans-unit.target: Sand Regeneration: Tombdrifts regain 1 health each round they are in a desert or badlands region, unless they’ve taken damage from banishing rounds or similar anti‑undead attacks (in which case they don’t begin regaining health again for a couple of minutes).

trans-unit.source: Interaction: When they take the echo of their former shape, tombdrifts can communicate in rasping voices, and may choose to negotiate with other creatures instead of draining their life. Tombdrifts may want their remains properly buried, or something else. Some tombdrifts don’t care or don’t remember their lives and simply wish to feed.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: When they take the echo of their former shape, tombdrifts can communicate in rasping voices, and may choose to negotiate with other creatures instead of draining their life. Tombdrifts may want their remains properly buried, or something else. Some tombdrifts don’t care or don’t remember their lives and simply wish to feed.

trans-unit.source: Use: A sandstorm blew through the town’s cemetery with enough force to rip graves out of the ground. Now, some drifts of sand left in the storm’s wake have started moving.
trans-unit.target: Use: A sandstorm blew through the town’s cemetery with enough force to rip graves out of the ground. Now, some drifts of sand left in the storm’s wake have started moving.

trans-unit.source: Loot: A tombdrift, which contains the remains of the individual who seeded it (maybe just a few eroded bones), might also have some of their belongings, such as a box with a few remaining alchemical rounds.
trans-unit.target: Loot: A tombdrift, which contains the remains of the individual who seeded it (maybe just a few eroded bones), might also have some of their belongings, such as a box with a few remaining alchemical rounds.

trans-unit.source: GM intrusion: The character is pulled into the dune and is crushed and suffocated for 5 points of ambient damage each round until they can escape with a Might‑based roll as their action.
trans-unit.target: GM intrusion: The character is pulled into the dune and is crushed and suffocated for 5 points of ambient damage each round until they can escape with a Might‑based roll as their action.

trans-unit.source: SHADE OF THE TOMB 5 (15)
trans-unit.target: SHADE OF THE TOMB 5 (15)

trans-unit.source: Though thankfully rare, shades of the tomb (commonly called “tomb shades”) may spontaneously manifest beneath the dull light of the Tomb Moon, taking form from gravestone shadows. Other times tomb shades are called into brief existence by a summoning spell. When they resolve, they regard the world with the head of an ink-beaked raven, with half a dozen clutching ebony arms emerging from their tenebrous cloak. If need be, a tomb shade can seep through cracks and around barriers that would stymie most corporeal beings.
trans-unit.target: Though thankfully rare, shades of the tomb (commonly called “tomb shades”) may spontaneously manifest beneath the dull light of the Tomb Moon, taking form from gravestone shadows. Other times tomb shades are called into brief existence by a summoning spell. When they resolve, they regard the world with the head of an ink-beaked raven, with half a dozen clutching ebony arms emerging from their tenebrous cloak. If need be, a tomb shade can seep through cracks and around barriers that would stymie most corporeal beings.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Douse other beings’ light, life, and joy
trans-unit.target: Motive: Douse other beings’ light, life, and joy

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere

trans-unit.source: Health: 20
trans-unit.target: Health: 20

trans-unit.source: Damage Inflicted: 5 points
trans-unit.target: Damage Inflicted: 5 points

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; short when climbing
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; short when climbing

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Stealth as level 7
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Stealth as level 7

trans-unit.source: Combat: A tomb shade’s touch drains life, inflicting Speed damage (ignores Armor).
trans-unit.target: Combat: A tomb shade’s touch drains life, inflicting Speed damage (ignores Armor).

trans-unit.source: In dim light and darkness, a tomb shade only takes 1 point of damage from successful attacks against them.
trans-unit.target: In dim light and darkness, a tomb shade only takes 1 point of damage from successful attacks against them.

trans-unit.source: Individual tomb shades may also have one or more of the following abilities they can use as their action.
trans-unit.target: Individual tomb shades may also have one or more of the following abilities they can use as their action.

trans-unit.source: Siphon: On a failed Might defense task, a short‑range necrotic ray deals 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor), which the shade gains as health, up to their maximum.
trans-unit.target: Siphon: On a failed Might defense task, a short‑range necrotic ray deals 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor), which the shade gains as health, up to their maximum.

trans-unit.source: Darken: The shade summons magical darkness that blooms from a point within long range (no more than once every ten minutes). The darkness fills an area an immediate distance across and lasts for ten minutes. Even creatures that can normally see in darkness can’t see in this magical murk, except for tomb shades and undead.
trans-unit.target: Darken: The shade summons magical darkness that blooms from a point within long range (no more than once every ten minutes). The darkness fills an area an immediate distance across and lasts for ten minutes. Even creatures that can normally see in darkness can’t see in this magical murk, except for tomb shades and undead.

trans-unit.source: Anguish: The shade drains happiness and joy from all creatures within immediate range (no more than once per minute). Targets that fail an Intellect defense roll take 5 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) and are disconsolate, losing their next turn. Each turn after that they can attempt another Intellect defense roll to regain their composure and act normally.
trans-unit.target: Anguish: The shade drains happiness and joy from all creatures within immediate range (no more than once per minute). Targets that fail an Intellect defense roll take 5 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) and are disconsolate, losing their next turn. Each turn after that they can attempt another Intellect defense roll to regain their composure and act normally.

trans-unit.source: Portal: The tomb shade dissolves, their animus departing (possibly back to the Tomb Moon). The resulting implosive burst of necrotic energy deals 3 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) to all creatures within immediate range that fail a Speed defense task. Damaged targets must also succeed on a Might defense roll or be pulled partially through the portal, sustaining 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) each round from the necrotic contact until they can pull free with a successful Might roll as their action. When the last target pulls free (or dies and is pulled through), the portal closes.
trans-unit.target: Portal: The tomb shade dissolves, their animus departing (possibly back to the Tomb Moon). The resulting implosive burst of necrotic energy deals 3 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) to all creatures within immediate range that fail a Speed defense task. Damaged targets must also succeed on a Might defense roll or be pulled partially through the portal, sustaining 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) each round from the necrotic contact until they can pull free with a successful Might roll as their action. When the last target pulls free (or dies and is pulled through), the portal closes.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Sinister and conniving, a tomb shade doesn’t speak, but uses its many arms for magical signing, usually only to make threats.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Sinister and conniving, a tomb shade doesn’t speak, but uses its many arms for magical signing, usually only to make threats.

trans-unit.source: Use: An alchemist wants PCs to collect a cursed book for their library, but whenever someone opens the tome, shadows (a tomb shade) swallow the reader.
trans-unit.target: Use: An alchemist wants PCs to collect a cursed book for their library, but whenever someone opens the tome, shadows (a tomb shade) swallow the reader.
